original: @1b # // bcom ldan 'das la gzhan dbang phyug la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: @1b # // bcom ldan 'das la gzhan dbang phyug la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, not Īśvara, etc.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Even so” means “by means of omniscience.”

original: smos te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: smos te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o//
translated: “It is said” means “the result.”

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das la yang dag pa nyid gsung ba'i rgyu de'i phyir sgrub byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das la yang dag pa nyid gsung ba'i rgyu de'i phyir sgrub byed de /
translated: Since the Blessed One is the cause of speaking the truth, therefore, the proof

original: yang dag pa gsung ba'i rtags la ltos pa tshad ma ste tshad ma'i tha snyad bya bar bcom ldan 'das kho na rigs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa gsung ba'i rtags la ltos pa tshad ma ste tshad ma'i tha snyad bya bar bcom ldan 'das kho na rigs te /
translated: is the valid cognition that depends on the reason of speaking the truth. The Blessed One alone is the one to whom the term “valid cognition” is to be applied,

original: de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the result of that.

original: phyin ci ma log par thams cad gsungs pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i yul can gyi mkhyen pa nyid rjes su dpog gi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par thams cad gsungs pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i yul can gyi mkhyen pa nyid rjes su dpog gi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by the reason of the result of speaking everything without error, the Blessed One’s own knowledge that has that as its object is inferred.

original: ldog pa brjod pa ni rig byed ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldog pa brjod pa ni rig byed ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The expression “not” is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: gang gi tshe dbang phyug la sogs pa srid pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang phyug la sogs pa srid pa de'i tshe /
translated: When Īśvara, etc. are possible,

original: tshad mas gnod pa yang dag pa ma yin pa brjod pa'i phyir de thams cad shes pa nyid du nges pa thabs med do //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa yang dag pa ma yin pa brjod pa'i phyir de thams cad shes pa nyid du nges pa thabs med do //
translated: Because it is not correct to contradict valid cognition, there is no way to ascertain that all of that is consciousness.

original: byed pa po med pa'i phyogs la yang gdon mi za bar sgra rnams don dang 'brel bar 'dod dgos na /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i phyogs la yang gdon mi za bar sgra rnams don dang 'brel bar 'dod dgos na /
translated: In the position that there is no agent, one must certainly accept that the words are related to the meaning.

original: de yang med do zhes bstan pa ni rig byed ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang med do zhes bstan pa ni rig byed ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But that is also nonexistent. This is taught by “There is no Veda at all.”

original: 'di ni zhes @2a * //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes @2a * //
translated: “This”

original: bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: refers to the Bhagavān.

original: gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i spyod yul ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i spyod yul ma yin pa la'o //
translated: “To others” refers to those who are not the domain of valid cognition.

original: bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni le'u 'di nyid du'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni le'u 'di nyid du'o //
translated: “Should be explained” refers to this very chapter.

original: de ltar tha snyad du bcom ldan 'das tshad mar bsgrubs nas don dam pa la ltos nas sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad du bcom ldan 'das tshad mar bsgrubs nas don dam pa la ltos nas sbyor ba ni /
translated: Thus, having established the Bhagavān as valid cognition conventionally, in dependence on the ultimate, the application is:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Or else.”

original: de ldan te /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyang gnyis su med pa rtogs pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ldan te / bcom ldan 'das kyang gnyis su med pa rtogs pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He has that”🔽refers to the Bhagavān’s realization of nonduality.

original: ma shes don gyi gsal byed kyang //
analyzed: ma shes don gyi gsal byed kyang //
translated: “He is also the one who elucidates the meaning that is not known.”

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs kyi /
translated: This is the context of the verse.

original: de 'di la mnga' zhes bshad pa'i sgo nas khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pas ma rtogs pa gnyis su med pa'i de kho na gsal bar mdzad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyang tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'di la mnga' zhes bshad pa'i sgo nas khyab 'jug dang dbang phyug la sogs pas ma rtogs pa gnyis su med pa'i de kho na gsal bar mdzad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyang tshad ma yin te /
translated: The word possesses in the verse indicates that the Bhagavan is the only one who has clearly realized the nondual reality that is not understood by Vishnu, Ishvara, and so on.🔽 The Bhagavan is a valid cognizer because

original: mngon sum la sogs pa rang gi yul la tshad ma yin par ni mi zad do //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa rang gi yul la tshad ma yin par ni mi zad do //
translated: direct perception and so on are valid with regard to their objects.

original: zhes don gyis 'phangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: zhes don gyis 'phangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: 'o na ci ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa yin no zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Well, then, how can it be said that the Bhagavan is omniscient?

original: don thams cad yongs su shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don thams cad yongs su shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The verse says, He knows all objects of knowledge.

original: de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par dbye ba la ma ltos pa spyi dbang phyug la sogs pa don ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'am rig byed dang 'brel bar sgrub par byed pa tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni yong pa ma yin no
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam par dbye ba la ma ltos pa spyi dbang phyug la sogs pa don ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'am rig byed dang 'brel bar sgrub par byed pa tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni yong pa ma yin no
translated: Thus, the reason for the term valid cognition, which is applied to the one who knows or perceives the way things really are, is not found in the case of Ishvara and so on, who are permanent or impermanent in an unspecified way.

original: zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes bstan nas /
translated: Having taught this,🔽Chandrakirti now gives an example.

original: rtag pa dang mi @2b rtag pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis kyang tshad mar mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs snga ma 'god do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi @2b rtag pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis kyang tshad mar mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i don du gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs snga ma 'god do //
translated: It is also not tenable that a valid cognition is permanent or impermanent by nature. In order to demonstrate this, the opponent’s position is set forth beginning with “If it is permanent . . .”

original: rtag pa'i dus thams cad du gnas pa yin gyi skad cig las gzhan dus cung zad gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i dus thams cad du gnas pa yin gyi skad cig las gzhan dus cung zad gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is permanent, abiding at all times, and not abiding for a moment.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'dod pa'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the desire realm, beings, and so on.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa las gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa bsal bas so //🔽tshad ma rtag pa nyid min zhes bya ba la yod pa'i sgras ni yod pa'i tha snyad du rung ba brjod do //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa las gzhan de bzhin gshegs pa bsal bas so // tshad ma rtag pa nyid min zhes bya ba la yod pa'i sgras ni yod pa'i tha snyad du rung ba brjod do //
translated: The Tathāgata is excluded from being other than Īśvara and so on.🔽“ Valid cognition is not permanent” means that a valid cognition that is suitable to be conventionally existent is not permanent.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i tshad ma rtag pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i tshad ma rtag pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang na med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or it means that it is nonexistent.

original: de la phyogs dang po la gtan tshigs su bsams pa ni 'grel par tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la gtan tshigs su bsams pa ni 'grel par tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The first position is considered to be the reason, which the Commentary explains as “because there is no valid cognition.”

original: 'bras bu nyid la sogs gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ni bkod nas sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la sogs gtan tshigs ltar snang ba ni bkod nas sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The second position is the apparent reason, which is refuted by the statement “because the effect exists.”

original: phyogs gnyis pa la ni gtan tshigs gnyis yid dngos yod rtogs pa tshad phyir dang zhes bya ba de dngos po yod pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la ni gtan tshigs gnyis yid dngos yod rtogs pa tshad phyir dang zhes bya ba de dngos po yod pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second position has two reasons: “because the cognition of the existence of things is valid” and “because the cognition of the existence of things is valid.”

original: ji ltar shes pa tsam mam dbang phyug dang rig byed rtag pa tshad ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa tsam mam dbang phyug dang rig byed rtag pa tshad ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “How can mere consciousness, Īśvara, or the eternal Veda be valid cognition?” is that they are not valid cognition.

original: mi rtag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par ni mi rtag na yang tshad ma med ce na zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par ni mi rtag na yang tshad ma med ce na zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: The statement “Even if it is impermanent, it is not valid cognition” teaches that even if it is impermanent, it is not valid cognition.

original: gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i bar du dbang phyug gi blo yul thams cad la khyab pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i bar du dbang phyug gi blo yul thams cad la khyab pa gcig yin la /
translated: If the cognition of Īśvara, which is the cause of the creation and destruction of the world, is a single cognition that pervades all objects,

original: tshad mar 'gyur ba de dbang phyug la 'du ba'i phyir tshad ma'i tha snyad du byed kyi rang gi ni ma yin no snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: tshad mar 'gyur ba de dbang phyug la 'du ba'i phyir tshad ma'i tha snyad du byed kyi rang gi ni ma yin no snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you suspect that the valid cognition is included in God, and therefore the convention of valid cognition is made in dependence on God, not in dependence on itself,

original: shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis de ni mi rtag pa nyid phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis de ni mi rtag pa nyid phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said, “because of impermanence, it is impermanent.”

original: 'o na dngos po yod pa'i rtog pa'i mi rtag pa dang 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid kyis na 'brel ba'i phyir dbang phyug tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na dngos po yod pa'i rtog pa'i mi rtag pa dang 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid kyis na 'brel ba'i phyir dbang phyug tshad ma yin no //
translated: Well then, since the conception of an existent thing is impermanent and is related by the cause of being a composite, God is valid cognition.

original: rig byed kyang rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi tshad mar brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: rig byed kyang rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi tshad mar brjod do zhe na /
translated: And the Vedas are also said to be valid cognition because they are the cause of the reason.

original: 'di yang ma 'brel ba'i phyir mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang ma 'brel ba'i phyir mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
translated: This is also unreasonable because it is unrelated. To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
analyzed: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
translated: Those that arise in sequence

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: are not related to each other.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyis pa bstan pa tsam mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyis pa bstan pa tsam mo //
translated: Moreover means merely teaching a second position.

original: gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is not just anything means that conception is not valid cognition.

original: dngos pos stong pa'i snang tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //🔽gal te mi slu ba @3a * //
analyzed: dngos pos stong pa'i snang tsam ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes pa'i don to // gal te mi slu ba @3a * //
translated: The meaning is: the mere appearance that is empty of being a thing is not a valid cognition.

original: dang ldan pa tshad ma yin gyi dngos po'i rtog pa ni ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dang ldan pa tshad ma yin gyi dngos po'i rtog pa ni ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say: “A valid cognition is that which is non-deceptive, but not the conception of a thing, because inference is a valid cognition.”

original: mi slu ba'i de nyid ni lhag par zhen pa'i byas pa'i don dang 'brel pa las yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i de nyid ni lhag par zhen pa'i byas pa'i don dang 'brel pa las yin te /
translated: The non-deceptiveness of that is due to the connection with the object of conception that is produced.

original: des na gal te 'di 'dra ba rnam par dpyad nas /
analyzed: des na gal te 'di 'dra ba rnam par dpyad nas /
translated: Therefore, if one analyzes in this way,

original: de'i dngos po yod par rtogs pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i lhag par zhen pa la brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dngos po yod par rtogs pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i lhag par zhen pa la brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: the realization that its thing exists is said to be the conception that is connected with it.

original: des na shes pa yul la rag las par grub po //
analyzed: des na shes pa yul la rag las par grub po //
translated: Thus it is established that consciousness depends on an object.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gang gis zhes so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes so //
translated: “By whom” is the answer.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis te /
translated: “If” is by another.

original: gzhan gyis mi rtag pas gzhan mi rtag pa nyid ni 'thad pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi rtag pas gzhan mi rtag pa nyid ni 'thad pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is not tenable that another is impermanent because of another’s impermanence.

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //🔽byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum las shes bya las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o // byed pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum las shes bya las skyes pa'am /
translated: The nature of the object of knowledge, etc. is the philosophical position.

original: de'i rang bzhin du khas blangs na ni de mi rtag pas shes pa mi rtag pa nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du khas blangs na ni de mi rtag pas shes pa mi rtag pa nyid du gsal lo //
translated: From among the three conceptual differentiations, i.e., of activity, etc., if it is held that consciousness arises from the object of consciousness or that it has the nature of that, then, because that is impermanent, consciousness is clearly impermanent.

original: phyogs gzhan yang mi srid pas byed pa'i phyogs rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan yang mi srid pas byed pa'i phyogs rtogs par byed do //
translated: Since another position is not possible, the position of activity is understood.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But, etc. is the other’s .

original: don nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: don nyid ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The very object, etc. is the philosophical position.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni gsal pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni gsal pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: Such is the nature of manifestation.

original: shes pa po'i byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa po'i byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the activity of the knower, because the occasion is that of consciousness.

original: rang bzhin tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad na yang de nyid mi rtog pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang / tha dad na yang de nyid mi rtog pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because there is no difference in nature, and because, even if there were a difference, it would not be imagined.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But, etc. is the other’s .

original: de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa po yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa po yang ste /
translated: Likewise, the one who knows is also like that.

original: de bzhin du byed pa mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not have a nature that is different in terms of its activity.

original: 'di la bshad pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Here, the “explanation” is the philosophical theory.

original: gal te mig la rang bzhin gyis byas pa'i byed pa mi 'dra ba med pa de lta na yang nus pas byas pa ni ldog tu med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te mig la rang bzhin gyis byas pa'i byed pa mi 'dra ba med pa de lta na yang nus pas byas pa ni ldog tu med pa kho na'o //
translated: Even though the eye does not have a different activity that is due to its intrinsic nature, it is certainly not the case that it does not have an activity that is due to its potentiality.

original: gang gi phyir der zhes bya ba gzugs 'dzin pa la dbang phyug gi byed pa tha dad pa tsam gyis yin pa ltar mig gi yang de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir der zhes bya ba gzugs 'dzin pa la dbang phyug gi byed pa tha dad pa tsam gyis yin pa ltar mig gi yang de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “just as in the case of the eye” is as follows: Just as the activity of God is different in the case of the apprehension of form, so too it is not the case that the activity of the eye is the same in the case of the apprehension of form.

original: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las yin no //
translated: Rather, it is due to the eye’s positive and negative concomitance with the apprehension of form.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because of being the agent.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “It would be like that” means it would be the nature of a manifest entity.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba'i don la /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba'i don la /
translated: In this case,

original: 'dzin pa'i byed pa 'ga' zhig yang med do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i byed pa 'ga' zhig yang med do //
translated: there is no other activity of apprehending.

original: de'i phyir shes pa rtag pa'i sgo nas dbang phyug tshad mar ji @3b ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa rtag pa'i sgo nas dbang phyug tshad mar ji @3b ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could God be a valid cognition in terms of a permanent consciousness?

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “Or” refers to the opponent’s position.

original: gzhal bya yin yang don de nyid tshad mar 'gyur la rag las te /
analyzed: gzhal bya yin yang don de nyid tshad mar 'gyur la rag las te /
translated: Even though it is an object of knowledge, that object itself is a valid cognition,

original: rang nyid gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is self-illuminating.

original: 'di yang gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la ma ltos par ji snyed srid pa'i tshad dpyad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la ma ltos par ji snyed srid pa'i tshad dpyad pa yin te /
translated: This is an analysis of the extent of the possible without relying on what is accepted by others,

original: rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the locus of debate.

original: de dang 'brel ba ni shes pa po dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba ni shes pa po dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: “Related to that” means related to the knower,

original: yul dang yul can gyis so zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang yul can gyis so zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: that is, the object and the subject.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning of the philosophical position.

original: 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig nye bar sbyor ba dang yul dang yul can nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig nye bar sbyor ba dang yul dang yul can nyid kyis 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Some object is related to some subject by the relation of the object and the subject,

original: gzugs la mig bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la mig bzhin no //
translated: like the eye and form.

original: nye bar sbyor ba de yang rtag pa las bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba de yang rtag pa las bsams pa yin te /
translated: That relation is considered to be permanent,

original: log pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reversed.

original: 'on te des zhes bya ba ni don zhes lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'on te des zhes bya ba ni don zhes lhag ma'o //
translated: Or, “by that” is the remainder, “by the object.”

original: 'di yang gi na yin no zhes ston pa ni ci ltar na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gi na yin no zhes ston pa ni ci ltar na zhes bya'o //
translated: This is also a question. “How?” is stated to show that.

original: don rang nyid gsal ba'i phyir des mthong ngo zhes bya ba gsum pa'i don 'khrul pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: don rang nyid gsal ba'i phyir des mthong ngo zhes bya ba gsum pa'i don 'khrul pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because the object itself is manifest, it is said, “by that it is seen.” The meaning of the third line is confused.

original: gzhan dag rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis des mthong bar grub pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag rjes su 'gro ba tsam gyis des mthong bar grub pa ni /
translated: Others prove that “by that” means by the seer, by mere concomitance.

original: de ltar de yod na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar de yod na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Thus, if that exists” means

original: dbang phyug ni shes pa yod na zhes de ltar de don gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang phyug des mthong zhes bya bar brjod na ni nam mkha' la sogs pa yod na yang mthong bde yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni shes pa yod na zhes de ltar de don gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir dbang phyug des mthong zhes bya bar brjod na ni nam mkha' la sogs pa yod na yang mthong bde yod pa'i phyir /
translated: if the Lord exists, then the object is manifest. Because the nature of the object is manifest, it is said, “by that the Lord sees.” But if space and so on exist, then seeing exists.

original: ji ltar dbang phyug de nyid lta ba po yin /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug de nyid lta ba po yin /
translated: How can that Lord be the seer?

original: yod na'i 'dun pas nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag kyang lta ba por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod na'i 'dun pas nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag kyang lta ba por 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the assertion that if it exists, it sees, then space and so on would also be the seer, because they exist.

original: mkha' la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: mkha' la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “Space” is the opponent’s example.

original: dus dang phyogs la sogs pa la yang nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: dus dang phyogs la sogs pa la yang nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Time, direction, and so on are also illustrated by this.

original: don de ni mthong ba'i de'o //
analyzed: don de ni mthong ba'i de'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is seen.

original: de bstan pa ni ming ngo //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni ming ngo //
translated: The teaching of that is a name.🔽The tenets are expressed in the words of the teaching.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni bstan pa'i tshig la brjod la de yang dbang phyug de las yin gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las 'dod /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni bstan pa'i tshig la brjod la de yang dbang phyug de las yin gyi nam mkha' la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las 'dod /
translated: And from what is it asserted that the teaching is from that Īśvara and not from space and so on?

original: gal te nam mkha' la shes pa med pa'i phyir de las tshig ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la shes pa med pa'i phyir de las tshig ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that because there is no consciousness in space, the teaching is not from space,

original: dbang phyug bzhin du 'du ba srid pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa la shes pa ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: dbang phyug bzhin du 'du ba srid pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa la shes pa ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: then why do you not assert that consciousness is in space and so on, because it is possible that it is assembled from Īśvara?

original: de lta na 'o na de nyid dbang phyug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na de nyid dbang phyug tu 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then that itself would be Īśvara.

original: mi 'thad pas ni don tha dad bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'thad pas ni don tha dad bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since that is untenable, it would not be a different object.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa dbang phyug las tha dad par 'jog pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar gzhan gyi rnam par gnas @4a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa dbang phyug las tha dad par 'jog pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro // de ltar gzhan gyi rnam par gnas @4a * //
translated: because it follows that space and so on would not be posited as different from Īśvara.

original: pa'i sun 'byin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: pa'i sun 'byin pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus presented the refutation of the opponent’s position,

original: dbang phyug bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang tshig gi rgyu nyid dngos po la rtog par mi nus te /
analyzed: dbang phyug bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang tshig gi rgyu nyid dngos po la rtog par mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to imagine that space, etc. are the cause of words in the same way that God is,🔽because they are permanent and cannot be interrupted.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dngos po nye bar sdud pa ni /🔽rnam par kun du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dngos po nye bar sdud pa ni / rnam par kun du zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in every way” refers to the fact that the cause of words is not a real entity.🔽The phrase “this is to be understood through faith in omniscience” shows that this is to be understood through faith in the Buddha’s knowledge.

original: 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa la yang dad pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes ston pa ni don gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa la yang dad pas rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes ston pa ni don gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “what is the meaning of this?”

original: 'di ni 'das pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'das pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not past,

original: phyogs gcig 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a part of it would be past.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang yin no //
translated: The same would be true of the future.

original: spyi'i don gang yin pa de ci ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: spyi'i don gang yin pa de ci ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
translated: How could a general meaning be clarified?

original: ci'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa snang bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa snang bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the past, etc., are not perceived?

original: 'das pa nyid na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das pa nyid na zhes gsungs so //
translated: The text says, “If it were past, etc.”

original: nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: This is merely an illustration.

original: ma 'ongs pa nyid yin na zhes bya bar yang blta'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa nyid yin na zhes bya bar yang blta'o //
translated: The same would be true if it were future.

original: don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin nam shes te /
analyzed: don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin nam shes te /
translated: The meaning is that the past and future are known.

original: mi gsal ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gsal ba de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is unclear,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rang gi ngo bos snang ba ji ltar 'gyur ;
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rang gi ngo bos snang ba ji ltar 'gyur ;
translated: how could the past and future be perceived by their own nature?

original: med pa gsal na ni 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: med pa gsal na ni 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: If the nonexistent were clear, then it would be just a mistake.

original: rang gi ngo bo gsal na yang da ltar ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gsal na yang da ltar ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If its own nature were clear, then it would be just the present.

original: de lta yin dang 'das pa la sogs par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'das pa la sogs par mi 'thad do //
translated: If that were so, then the past and so on would not be tenable.

original: 'on te yang me long bzhin dbang phyug gi shes par 'pho ba'i don dmigs pa'i phyir ci ltar 'das pa la sogs par mi nyams she na /
analyzed: 'on te yang me long bzhin dbang phyug gi shes par 'pho ba'i don dmigs pa'i phyir ci ltar 'das pa la sogs par mi nyams she na /
translated: But if, like a mirror, the object that is transferred to the consciousness of God is perceived, then how could the past and so on not be impaired?

original: 'das pa la sogs pa ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: How could the past and so on be like that?

original: gal te me long gi dpe la brten nas lan 'debs par 'dod na de'i tshe me long bzhin du shes pa la yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag mi 'pho ba'i phyir de ga la rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te me long gi dpe la brten nas lan 'debs par 'dod na de'i tshe me long bzhin du shes pa la yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag mi 'pho ba'i phyir de ga la rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If you wish to reply based on the example of a mirror, then, like a mirror, the past and future are not transferred to consciousness, so how could they be realized? This is the meaning of the phrase “how could they be realized?”

original: da ltar ba yang me long du 'pho bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: da ltar ba yang me long du 'pho bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not tenable that the present is transferred to the mirror.

original: phyin ci log gi rang bzhin gyi don mthong ba'i phyir dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa der mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rang bzhin gyi don mthong ba'i phyir dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa der mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it sees the object that has the nature of error, and because it does not engage the object as obstructed.

original: des na dpe des dbang phyug kyang 'khrul pa nyid du thal ba zlog dka'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na dpe des dbang phyug kyang 'khrul pa nyid du thal ba zlog dka'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to avoid the conclusion that the example also implies that God is in error.

original: 'o na gang zhig da ltar ba me long du 'pho ba brjod pa der yang 'pho ba'i don yin /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig da ltar ba me long du 'pho ba brjod pa der yang 'pho ba'i don yin /
translated: Now, in that case, when it is said that the present is transferred to the mirror, what is the meaning of “transferred”?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rtogs pa yang ci ltar rtogs na yang da ltar ba nyid du thal lo zhes dogs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rtogs pa yang ci ltar rtogs na yang da ltar ba nyid du thal lo zhes dogs na /
translated: And if it is asked how the Bhagavat understands the past and future, since it would follow that he understands them as present,

original: de lta bu'i snang ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i snang ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The appearance is like that.

original: me long yod na zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: me long yod na zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: ” “If the mirror exists” is an illustration;

original: bzhin la sogs pa yod na'o //
analyzed: bzhin la sogs pa yod na'o //
translated: if the face, etc., exist,

original: @4b bzhin dang me long la sogs pa'i mthu de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni 'phros pa'i don te /
analyzed: @4b bzhin dang me long la sogs pa'i mthu de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid skye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid ni 'phros pa'i don te /
translated: the mere consciousness that has the aspect of that power of the face, mirror, etc., is produced. This is the meaning of the extended passage.

original: de skyon med do //
analyzed: de skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in this.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis skye ba'i chos can gyi chos dang phrad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes pa yang de dang de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis skye ba'i chos can gyi chos dang phrad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes pa yang de dang de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid skye ba yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, when the Bhagavān encounters a phenomenon that is a subject of arising, the cognition that arises has the aspect of that very cognition.

original: de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po nye bar gnas pa ni ma yin pas gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po nye bar gnas pa ni ma yin pas gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Since the past and so on do not exist at that time, how could there be an absurd consequence?

original: rnam pa dang da ltar ba ni da ltar ba nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o //🔽de'i rnam par rig pa las gzhan pa'i gzhan rig pa yang med pa'i phyir 'khrul ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang da ltar ba ni da ltar ba nyid du 'dod pa kho na'o // de'i rnam par rig pa las gzhan pa'i gzhan rig pa yang med pa'i phyir 'khrul ba nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The aspect and the present are asserted to be present.🔽Also, there is no other cognition of other objects because there is no other aspect.

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not mistaken because there is no other aspect.

original: de'i rnam pa can yang gsal ba'i tshul gyi bye brag las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mthong bar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can yang gsal ba'i tshul gyi bye brag las 'das pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mthong bar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The cognition that has that aspect is posited as seeing past and so on because of the difference in the mode of appearance.

original: ji ltar de ni don sogs dus ldan par zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar de ni don sogs dus ldan par zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: As will be explained, “It is said that the object and so on are present at the time of the cognition.”

original: des na nyes pa'i dogs pa med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nyes pa'i dogs pa med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: gzhan la ni shes pa rnam par med pa nyid kyi dngos po nyid gsal ba'i phyir da ltar ba nyid du thal bar bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni shes pa rnam par med pa nyid kyi dngos po nyid gsal ba'i phyir da ltar ba nyid du thal bar bzlog par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to avoid the conclusion that the other is present, because the entity itself is clearly manifest.

original: dngos po mi gsal na ni snang ba tsam la rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'khrul bar 'gyur bas bzlog dka'o //
analyzed: dngos po mi gsal na ni snang ba tsam la rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'khrul bar 'gyur bas bzlog dka'o //
translated: If the entity is not clearly manifest, then it is difficult to avoid the conclusion that it is mistaken, because it is posited as merely an appearance.

original: 'on te dbang phyug la yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi dngos po dang phrad nas /
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug la yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gi dngos po dang phrad nas /
translated: But if one imagines that the Lord also comes into contact with the entity of the past and future,

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i snang ba skye ba nyid 'das pa la sogs pa rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i snang ba skye ba nyid 'das pa la sogs pa rig par 'gyur te /
translated: then the cognition of the past, etc., would arise from the mere appearance of that kind,

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs nas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs nas /
translated: because another aspect is not possible.

original: snang ba rtag pa'i 'bras bu ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snang ba rtag pa'i 'bras bu ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The effect of a permanent appearance is not tenable.

original: sngar brjod ces bya ba ni rtag pa zlog pa med pa ni 'gar yang nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: sngar brjod ces bya ba ni rtag pa zlog pa med pa ni 'gar yang nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The phrase “as was previously stated” refers to the statement “Permanence is never connected to anything.”

original: de lta yin dang dbang phyug la yang 'bras bu ma yin pa'i snang ba tsam yod pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dbang phyug la yang 'bras bu ma yin pa'i snang ba tsam yod pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If that were so, then since even God would have mere appearances that are not effects, he would apprehend the past, etc.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyed phyi ma'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyed phyi ma'i don to //
translated: And it would be the same for space, etc. This is the meaning of the latter half of the verse.

original: de ltar dbang phyug gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rtogs pa sun phyung nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang phyug gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rtogs pa sun phyung nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the realization of the past and future by God,

original: da ltar ba yi don thams cad rtogs pa sun 'byin pa gal te don de don de'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽don 'di yin te shes pa dang ldan pa tshol ba zhes bya ba des bshad pa'i don nan tan bya ba'i phyir yang yin la nges pa mthong na ni de'i stobs las byung ba'i sgra nges pa'i don @5a * //
analyzed: da ltar ba yi don thams cad rtogs pa sun 'byin pa gal te don de don de'i zhes bya ba'o // don 'di yin te shes pa dang ldan pa tshol ba zhes bya ba des bshad pa'i don nan tan bya ba'i phyir yang yin la nges pa mthong na ni de'i stobs las byung ba'i sgra nges pa'i don @5a * //
translated: now the refutation of the realization of all present objects is stated: If that object is that object, etc.

original: rtogs par byed par 'gyur bas nan tan gyi rgyur rung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par byed par 'gyur bas nan tan gyi rgyur rung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: One who possesses consciousness and seeks, in order to make the meaning explained by that [consciousness] a reality, and if one sees certainty, then the sound that arises from the power of that [consciousness] will be suitable as the cause of the realization of the object with a definite meaning.

original: gang gi tshe don mthong ba'i de ma thag pa nyid du nges par ma rtogs na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don mthong ba'i de ma thag pa nyid du nges par ma rtogs na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If one does not ascertain the meaning immediately upon seeing it, then at that time

original: don thams cad mthong bas na /
analyzed: don thams cad mthong bas na /
translated: since one sees all meanings,

original: dbang phyug de'i tshe tshig gang yin pa de'i don gang zhig yin par brjod de /
analyzed: dbang phyug de'i tshe tshig gang yin pa de'i don gang zhig yin par brjod de /
translated: at that time, what is the meaning of the statement “I see all meanings”?

original: gang zhig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of “I do not see anything”?

original: des na kun mthong ba las byung ba las byung ba'i sgra ni don thams cad kyi rjod byed yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na kun mthong ba las byung ba las byung ba'i sgra ni don thams cad kyi rjod byed yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the word “all” would be the expression for all meanings.

original: des na dbang phyug mnyes par bya bas thar pa thob po zhes bya ba'i ngag la tshig rnams don nges pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig du yang rjes su sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dbang phyug mnyes par bya bas thar pa thob po zhes bya ba'i ngag la tshig rnams don nges pa med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig du yang rjes su sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the statement “One attains liberation by pleasing Īśvara” would not be established in any way, because the words have no definite meaning.

original: des na don thams cad mthong ba don med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na don thams cad mthong ba don med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless to see all meanings.

original: gal te don thams cad mthong yang nges pa'i yul can gyi brjod 'dod pas sgra brjod pa'i phyir sgra don thams cad kyi rjod byed du mi 'gyur ro //🔽de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te don thams cad mthong yang nges pa'i yul can gyi brjod 'dod pas sgra brjod pa'i phyir sgra don thams cad kyi rjod byed du mi 'gyur ro // de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it is argued that although all objects are seen, sound is not the expression of all objects because it is the expression of the object of a definite desire to speak,🔽then how could this fault not also apply to you?

original: khyed la yang nyes pa 'dir ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes dogs na brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: khyed la yang nyes pa 'dir ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes dogs na brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: If it did not, then how could this fault not also apply to you?🔽The response to this is “The desire to speak is definite.”

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:

original: brjod par 'dod pa ni skyes bu las tha dad par rtogs pa gcig pu yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ni skyes bu las tha dad par rtogs pa gcig pu yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs yin no //
translated: The desire to speak is a single cognition that is distinct from the person. This is the opponent’s view.

original: des na sngon po brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid ser po la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: des na sngon po brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid ser po la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore whatever is the desire to speak of blue is also the desire to speak of yellow and so on.

original: des na don thams cad brjod par 'dod pas sbyar ba ri rab kyi don thams cad kyi rjod byed du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na don thams cad brjod par 'dod pas sbyar ba ri rab kyi don thams cad kyi rjod byed du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it is taught that because it is the desire to speak of all objects, the syllable a would be the expression of all objects. The response to this is “The desire to speak is definite” is not tenable for a permanent entity.

original: des na tshig de las don nges pa rtogs pa nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na tshig de las don nges pa rtogs pa nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word is not ascertained from the word itself.

original: nged kyi ltar na ni skad cig ma nyid kyi don so so la tha dad par khas blangs pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na ni skad cig ma nyid kyi don so so la tha dad par khas blangs pa'i skyon med do //
translated: But according to us, there is no fault in accepting that the meaning of momentariness is different for each thing.

original: 'on te yang brjod par 'dod pa ni don so so la tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang brjod par 'dod pa ni don so so la tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: But if you do assert that the meaning of each word is different,

original: grub pa'i mtha' gnod pa ni yang gnod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gnod pa ni yang gnod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: then the contradiction with your tenet system is still a contradiction.

original: tshad mas gnod pa nyid gnod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa nyid gnod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you assert that a contradiction is only a contradiction when it is contradicted by a valid cognition,

original: de ltar na 'o na skyes bu las ma yin no zhes bya ba brjod par 'dod pa nges pa ni rtag pa la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na skyes bu las ma yin no zhes bya ba brjod par 'dod pa nges pa ni rtag pa la mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is not tenable to assert that the meaning of the word “person” is permanent, since the meaning of the word “not from a self” is ascertained as impermanent.

original: de dag ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are by nature impermanent.

original: de ltar yin dang dper na mthong ba bzhin du des kyang don 'ga' zhig yongs su bzung ba'am dor ba med pa'i phyir nye bar ma bkod pa zad do //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang dper na mthong ba bzhin du des kyang don 'ga' zhig yongs su bzung ba'am dor ba med pa'i phyir nye bar ma bkod pa zad do //
translated: If that were so, then just as in the example, it would not be established that the meaning of the word “person” is permanent, since it is not ascertained that it is permanent.

original: 'on te kho bo cag skyes bu'i rang bzhin du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'on te kho bo cag skyes bu'i rang bzhin du mi 'dod de /
translated: But if you think that we do not accept that God is the nature of a person,

original: @5b yon tan gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: @5b yon tan gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because he is a different quality,🔽then is he the effect of that or not the effect of that?🔽If he is the effect, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,

original: de lta yang de de'i 'bras bu'am 'bras bu ma yin /
analyzed: de lta yang de de'i 'bras bu'am 'bras bu ma yin /
translated: because he is the effect of that.🔽If he is not the effect, then he is permanent.🔽But if that is so, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,🔽because he is permanent.

original: 'bras bu yin na de lta na 'di yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba brjod 'dod pa nges pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin na de lta na 'di yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba brjod 'dod pa nges pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If he is permanent, then it is not tenable to say that he is the nature of a person,🔽because he is permanent.🔽If he is not the nature of a person, then it is not tenable to say that he is the creator of all things,🔽because he is not the nature of a person.🔽If he is the creator of all things, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,🔽because he is the creator of all things.🔽If he is not the creator of all things, then it is not tenable to say that he is God,🔽because he is not the creator of all things.🔽If he is God, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,🔽because he is God.🔽If he is not God, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,🔽because he is not God.🔽If he is permanent, then it is not tenable to say that he is the creator of all things,🔽because he is permanent.🔽If he is not the creator of all things, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,

original: de ltar byas pas brjod 'dod mtha' dag gis sbyar ba'i sngon po sgra'i don thams cad kyi rjod byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas brjod 'dod mtha' dag gis sbyar ba'i sngon po sgra'i don thams cad kyi rjod byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: because he is not the creator of all things.🔽If he is permanent, then it is not tenable to say that he is the nature of a person,🔽because he is permanent.

original: 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid yin na ni de rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid yin na ni de rtag pa yin la /
translated: If he is not the nature of a person, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,🔽because he is not the nature of a person.🔽If he is permanent, then it is not tenable to say that he is the creator of all things,🔽because he is permanent.🔽If he is not the creator of all things, then it is not tenable to say that he is permanent,🔽because he is not the creator of all things.

original: de lta na dbang phyug rtag pa nyid kyi brjod 'dod yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na dbang phyug rtag pa nyid kyi brjod 'dod yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If he is permanent, then it is not tenable to say that he is the nature of a person,

original: gnyi ga rtag pas na phan gdags bya dang 'dogs byed kyi dngos po nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga rtag pas na phan gdags bya dang 'dogs byed kyi dngos po nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because both are permanent, there is no entity that is the object of benefit or the benefactor.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: brjod 'dod de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod 'dod de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who desire to speak, etc.

original: gal te yon tan yin pa'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yon tan yin pa'i phyir brjod par 'dod pa tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: If they are different because they are qualities,

original: skyes bu'i rang bzhin ma yin zhing de bzhin mthong ba yang tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang bzhin ma yin zhing de bzhin mthong ba yang tha dad pa yin na /
translated: and seeing is also different,

original: de'i brjod par 'dod pa po dang lta ba po lhan cig gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i brjod par 'dod pa po dang lta ba po lhan cig gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could the one who desires to speak and the one who sees be the same?

original: gcig nyid yin na ni don gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid la lta ba po yin la 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir brjod 'dod nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na ni don gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid la lta ba po yin la 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir brjod 'dod nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If they are the same, then because they are the same entity, the one who sees would be the one who desires to speak, and because they are the same nature, the one who desires to speak would be the one who desires to speak.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin la dbang phyug gis ni reg pa med de mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin la dbang phyug gis ni reg pa med de mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the nature of those is not touched by Īśvara, because they are not of the same character.

original: de dag kyang dbang phyug gis rang bzhin ma yin pas na de'i sgo nas dbang phyug lta ba po dang brjod par 'dod pa por yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang dbang phyug gis rang bzhin ma yin pas na de'i sgo nas dbang phyug lta ba po dang brjod par 'dod pa por yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are not the nature of Īśvara, therefore Īśvara would not be the seer and the one who desires to speak.

original: des na lta ba po nyid brjod par 'dod pa po ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na lta ba po nyid brjod par 'dod pa po ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the seer is not the one who desires to speak,

original: khyed kyi de ci ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: khyed kyi de ci ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: how could that be a valid cognition for you?

original: mthong nas brjod par 'dod pas ston pa'am /
analyzed: mthong nas brjod par 'dod pas ston pa'am /
translated: If it is taught by one who desires to speak after seeing,

original: mthong ba'i rang bzhin tshad mar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i rang bzhin tshad mar 'gyur grang na /
translated: then seeing would be a valid cognition.

original: de gnyi ga yang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang med pa kho na'o //
translated: But both of those are absolutely nonexistent.

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “If you think” is as follows.

original: gal te brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'dzin pa mthong ba yang blta bar bya ba'i don 'dzin na de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'dzin pa mthong ba yang blta bar bya ba'i don 'dzin na de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the seeing that apprehends the object that is desired to be expressed also apprehends the object that is seen, then at that time this error would arise.

original: gang gi tshe dbang phyug nyid brjod par 'dod pa dang / blta bar bya ba'i don 'dzin par byed pa yin pa de'i mthong nas brjod par 'dod pas ston pa tshad ma ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang phyug nyid brjod par 'dod pa dang / blta bar bya ba'i don 'dzin par byed pa yin pa de'i mthong nas brjod par 'dod pas ston pa tshad ma ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the Lord himself desires to speak and to apprehend the object that is to be seen, how can it be that the teacher is not a valid authority, since he speaks after seeing?

original: lan @6a * //🔽du brjod par 'do dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan @6a * // du brjod par 'do dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer:

original: brjod par 'dod pa dang gzhan ma thong bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa dang gzhan ma thong bar gyur pa ste /
translated: “The desire to speak and the other are not seen.”🔽The desire to speak and the other are not seen.

original: de dag gi ngo bor ni brjod par 'dod dang gzhan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bor ni brjod par 'dod dang gzhan pa nyid do //
translated: The desire to speak and the other are of a different nature.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal bas na 'gal ba'i bdag nyid de ci ltar dbang phyug gcig gis 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal bas na 'gal ba'i bdag nyid de ci ltar dbang phyug gcig gis 'dzin pa yin //
translated: Since they are mutually exclusive, how can they be apprehended by the one Lord?

original: gzung par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa yang tha dad pa kho nar rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa yang tha dad pa kho nar rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the objects of apprehension are different, the apprehender must also be different.

original: gal te yang 'dir gzung ba tha dad kyang 'dzin pa tha dad par khas mi len na 'on ni mngon skum dang rjes su dpag par yang tha dad par mi 'gyur tho zhes thal bar ston pa ni de lta na yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang 'dir gzung ba tha dad kyang 'dzin pa tha dad par khas mi len na 'on ni mngon skum dang rjes su dpag par yang tha dad par mi 'gyur tho zhes thal bar ston pa ni de lta na yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If, on the other hand, one does not accept that the apprehender is different when the apprehended is different, then it follows that direct perception and inference would not be different.🔽The response to that is, “If that is so . . .”

original: gnyen mi mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur te /🔽gang zhig gzhan de bzhin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshul gyis gzhan grangs can gyi phyogs la brten nas dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gnyen mi mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur te / gang zhig gzhan de bzhin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshul gyis gzhan grangs can gyi phyogs la brten nas dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The response to that is, “There would be no similarity . . .”

original: gal te de yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de yang zhes bya'o //
translated: The response to that is, “If that is so . . .”

original: yang dag tu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: yang dag tu zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi ngo bos so //
translated: “In reality” means by way of an essence.

original: yang dag tu zhes bya bas ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag tu zhes bya bas ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: “In reality” means by direct perception and inference.

original: gal te du ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i de ma thag tu me rjes su 'gyur ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag rim gyis yin la /
analyzed: gal te du ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i de ma thag tu me rjes su 'gyur ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag rim gyis yin la /
translated: If fire is inferred immediately after seeing smoke, then direct perception and inference would be sequential.

original: rjes su pa pa'i dus su yang du ba la sogs pa mthong pa'i phyir lhan gcig tu 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su pa pa'i dus su yang du ba la sogs pa mthong pa'i phyir lhan gcig tu 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: And later, at the time of the effect, smoke is seen, so they do not occur simultaneously.

original: des na ci ltar 'byung pa dang 'byung pa dag gcig nyid yin snyam na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'byung pa dang 'byung pa dag gcig nyid yin snyam na /
translated: So how can the elements and the things derived from the elements be identical?

original: de ga las zhes smras so //
analyzed: de ga las zhes smras so //
translated: We reply: Why not?

original: 'di la lan rang bzhin gcig nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la lan rang bzhin gcig nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is: “They are identical in nature.”

original: cig car yang nye bar mtshon par bya ba'o //🔽tsha dam yis ni rtogs pa min //
analyzed: cig car yang nye bar mtshon par bya ba'o // tsha dam yis ni rtogs pa min //
translated: “Simultaneously” is also to be supplied.

original: zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa ste ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir dang / chos rjes su 'gro ba yang bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa med pa ste ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir dang / chos rjes su 'gro ba yang bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is not understood by the hot substance” means that there is no perception or inference to prove their identity, because the nature as explained is not established and because following a property has been refuted.

original: yang na tshad mas gnod pa nyid de zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang na tshad mas gnod pa nyid de zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Or the meaning is that they are contradicted by valid cognition,

original: so sor nges pa'i gzung ba'i rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa dang gzhan pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i gzung ba'i rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa dang gzhan pa nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the apprehended is ascertained individually and because it is contradictory to be different from conception.

original: de ltar na bzung ba tha dad pa'i phyir na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis dag bzhin du tha dad pa'i phyir dbang phyug brjod par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gi 'dzin byed ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bzung ba tha dad pa'i phyir na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis dag bzhin du tha dad pa'i phyir dbang phyug brjod par 'dod pa dang cig shos dag gi 'dzin byed ma yin te /
translated: As such, because the apprehended objects are different, the desire to express Īśvara and the other are not the apprehender, just like direct perception and inference are different.

original: des na sngar gyi nyes pa las mi grol lo //
analyzed: des na sngar gyi nyes pa las mi grol lo //
translated: Therefore, one is not freed from the previously mentioned faults.

original: des na shes pa'am brjod par 'dod pa tha dad pas ni dbang phyug thams @6b cad mkhyen pa nyid dam nye bar ston pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no snyam du bstan nas /
analyzed: des na shes pa'am brjod par 'dod pa tha dad pas ni dbang phyug thams @6b cad mkhyen pa nyid dam nye bar ston pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no snyam du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, because the desire to express or the consciousness is different, it is not tenable that Īśvara is omniscient or the teacher.

original: 'di rtag pa nyid la tshad ma yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di rtag pa nyid la tshad ma yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Having taught this, now Candrakīrti teaches that there is also no valid knowledge in the case of his permanence:

original: rtogs pa de'am gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa de'am gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That cognition or another.”

original: rtogs par byed pa de'am gzhan gyi dus tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa'i dngos po gang zhig cig gis bya bar rtogs pa de gcig kho na'o zhes bya bar bden nam ci mi bden pa nyid ston pa nyid kyis sgrub byed ngo shes pa sun phyung ba'i
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa de'am gzhan gyi dus tha dad par nye bar mtshon pa'i dngos po gang zhig cig gis bya bar rtogs pa de gcig kho na'o zhes bya bar bden nam ci mi bden pa nyid ston pa nyid kyis sgrub byed ngo shes pa sun phyung ba'i
translated: The one who understands that which is indicated as either the same or different at different times, that one alone is the knower of the one and the all. Is that true? Or is it not true? The author himself refutes the proof.

original: phyir ro // bden pa min no zhen ni de'i tshe rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig don med do //
analyzed: phyir ro // bden pa min no zhen ni de'i tshe rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig don med do //
translated: If it is not true, then the words “eternally” and “the all” are meaningless.

original: de'am gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni phal mo ches rtogs pa yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'am gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni phal mo ches rtogs pa yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ That or another” means “understood by the majority.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa ste /
translated: “ Or” means the doubt of another.

original: de gzhan gyis ma zhes mod /
analyzed: de gzhan gyis ma zhes mod /
translated: “ That or another” is certainly so.

original: rtogs pa po de rab nyid kyis ni bdag / de rnam kun zhes bya ba rtag pa dang thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du shes par byed de yang dag par nges par byed do zhi na /
analyzed: rtogs pa po de rab nyid kyis ni bdag / de rnam kun zhes bya ba rtag pa dang thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du shes par byed de yang dag par nges par byed do zhi na /
translated: “ That one” is the knower. “ The self” is the one who understands that in every way, that is, who understands it to be of the nature of the eternal and the all-knowing, etc.

original: sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The refutation:

original: de ni de lta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni de lta zhes bya ste /
translated: That is the way it is.

original: 'di la tshad ma ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no valid cognition at all in this case. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan yang de kho na'am kun brjod par thams cad rig par yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang de kho na'am kun brjod par thams cad rig par yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, in order to show that the ultimate or the conventional is not omniscience, he says:

original: rang rig nyid las gzhan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig nyid las gzhan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There is nothing other than self-awareness.

original: rang rig pa tsam la rtag pa'am thams cad rig pa nyid gal yod de /
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam la rtag pa'am thams cad rig pa nyid gal yod de /
translated: If self-awareness alone is permanent or omniscience,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma yang gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma yang gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the former and the latter are not other awarenesses.

original: des na don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the conventional,

original: rtag pa nyid dang thams cad rig pa nyid ni da ma pa'i ltos nas nod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dang thams cad rig pa nyid ni da ma pa'i ltos nas nod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because permanence and omniscience are accepted in dependence on the ultimate.

original: des ni zhugs pa zin ba'i rnam 'grel gyi cha nyid bshad pa'i phyir skabs rtsom pa ni ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni zhugs pa zin ba'i rnam 'grel gyi cha nyid bshad pa'i phyir skabs rtsom pa ni ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain the part of the Vigrahavyāvartanī that is related to this, he begins the section with “If you say…”

original: shes bya mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni rim gyis skye ba'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: shes bya mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni rim gyis skye ba'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Impermanence of the object of knowledge” is the reason for gradual arising.

original: shes par byed pa po gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: shes par byed pa po gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The one who causes the knowledge is the Lord of the occasion.

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni grub ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni grub ba'i mtha'o //
translated: The explanation is the philosophy.

original: rtogs pa skye pa dang ci ste 'brel snyam na /
analyzed: rtogs pa skye pa dang ci ste 'brel snyam na /
translated: If it is asked with what is the arising of understanding connected,

original: nam mkha' dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang zhes smos so //
translated: it is said, “space” and so on.

original: yul 'ba' zhig ni skyed byed ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang phyug kyang yin no //
analyzed: yul 'ba' zhig ni skyed byed ma yin gyi 'on kyang dbang phyug kyang yin no //
translated: It is not that only the object is the producer, but also the Lord is.

original: rtag pa dang khyab pa yin na de yang skyed byed ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab pa yin na de yang skyed byed ma yin te /
translated: If it is permanent and pervasive, it is not the producer,

original: ldog pa med pa spyod pa'i skabs su bstan zin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa spyod pa'i skabs su bstan zin pa bzhin no //
translated: like the non-cessation that has already been explained in the context of activity.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang rtag kha sgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i don du gal te rang bzhin de nyid kyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang rtag kha sgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i don du gal te rang bzhin de nyid kyi zhes smos so //
translated: In order to teach that it is a permanent illusion by another aspect, it is said, “If that very nature. . . ”

original: @7a * // ci ste rtag pa gzhan la mi ltos mod /
analyzed: @7a * // ci ste rtag pa gzhan la mi ltos mod /
translated: If it is asked, “Well, it is not dependent on another permanent thing,

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rim pas 'bras bu rim pa can du 'gyur ba la ni nyes ba med do snyam na /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rim pas 'bras bu rim pa can du 'gyur ba la ni nyes ba med do snyam na /
translated: but it is not faulty that the effect is sequential due to the sequence of the cooperating causes,”

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa dag nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa dag nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “If the cooperating causes themselves. . . ”

original: de dang cig shos kyi gnas skabs ces bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa nye ba dang mi nye ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de dang cig shos kyi gnas skabs ces bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa nye ba dang mi nye ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The phrase “in one or the other of these two states” refers to the states of being in proximity to or being distant from the cooperating causes.

original: rang ngam gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la ni rtogs pa po 'am gzu bos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang ngam gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la ni rtogs pa po 'am gzu bos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “by itself or by something else” means “by the one who understands or by the one who is impartial.”

original: tshig tsam zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug du smra ba don du gnyer ba tsam gyis sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tsam zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug du smra ba don du gnyer ba tsam gyis sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “mere words” means that the theist’s argument is merely a verbal exercise.

original: gal te rtag pa la phan gdags su med kyang /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa la phan gdags su med kyang /
translated: If the eternal self cannot be benefited,

original: des lhan cig byed pa la ci ste ma ltos snyam na /🔽de la zhes smos te rtag pa la'o //🔽des zhes bya ba ni rtag pas so //
analyzed: des lhan cig byed pa la ci ste ma ltos snyam na / de la zhes smos te rtag pa la'o // des zhes bya ba ni rtag pas so //
translated: why is it dependent on the cooperating causes?🔽The response to this question is “In that case . . . .”🔽The phrase “by that” refers to the eternal self.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The phrase “in that case” refers to the theist’s position.

original: bcom ldan 'das grub pa la sgrub par ma gyur cig snyam pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das grub pa la sgrub par ma gyur cig snyam pas /
translated: The theist says, “May the Blessed One not establish the self as something that is accomplished.”

original: sbyin pa la sogs pas zhes smras so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pas zhes smras so //
translated: The response to this is “By means of generosity and so on . . . .”

original: 'on ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar zhe na /
translated: The theist asks, “Well, then, how?”

original: chags pa dang bral ba dang zhes smras so //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba dang zhes smras so //
translated: The response is “By means of freedom from attachment . . . .”

original: de nas yang zhes bya ba ni sngar 'khor ba nyid yin pa las phyis tshad ma'i rang bzhin nyid du skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes bya ba ni sngar 'khor ba nyid yin pa las phyis tshad ma'i rang bzhin nyid du skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then again means that it is not the case that what was previously cyclic existence is later born as the nature of valid knowledge.

original: phan gdags pas ni rang bzhin 'gyur ba mtshon par byed pa po zhes ston pa ni gnod par byed pa zhes smros so //
analyzed: phan gdags pas ni rang bzhin 'gyur ba mtshon par byed pa po zhes ston pa ni gnod par byed pa zhes smros so //
translated: The one who is benefited is the one who is indicated as the revealer of the transformation of nature. The one who is harmed is the one who is indicated as the demonstrator.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'am gnod par byas pa'i rtogs pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni goms pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'am gnod par byas pa'i rtogs pa la sogs pa'i sgras ni goms pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: That refers to the one who is benefited or harmed. The words realization, etc. include cultivation, etc.

original: de ston pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po ston pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po ston pa'o //
translated: The one who demonstrates that is the one who demonstrates the antidote to attachment, etc.

original: sems can la byams pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la byams pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: Loving kindness toward sentient beings is loving kindness.

original: de la ni 'di 'dra ba'i bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pas gdungs pas nyams su ma myong ba ni de'i rgyu mtshan tshol bam yin la /
analyzed: de la ni 'di 'dra ba'i bya ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pas gdungs pas nyams su ma myong ba ni de'i rgyu mtshan tshol bam yin la /
translated: It is not the case that there is such an action for that one. The one who does not experience through being tormented by attachment, etc., is not seeking the reason for that.

original: de med pas na gnyen po goms pa med cing de med pa'i phyir ni rab tu zhib rig pa med do //
analyzed: de med pas na gnyen po goms pa med cing de med pa'i phyir ni rab tu zhib rig pa med do //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no cultivation of antidotes. Since that does not exist, there is no thorough knowledge.

original: des gzhan la ci zhig nye par ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des gzhan la ci zhig nye par ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What does it teach to others?

original: 'dis 'khor ba spro bar byed pas na 'khor ba'i smros pa ste chags pa dang sdang pa dang bde pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'khor ba spro bar byed pas na 'khor ba'i smros pa ste chags pa dang sdang pa dang bde pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since this causes the proliferation of cyclic existence, it is the proliferation of cyclic existence, i.e., attachment, hostility, pleasure, pain, etc.

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid de rtogs pa de mngon sum du byed ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid de rtogs pa de mngon sum du byed ba'o //
translated: The realization of its intrinsic reality is the realization of its intrinsic reality.

original: des na thams cad yongs su shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thams cad yongs su shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the thorough knowledge of all.

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bos sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa yin na de'i tshe 'di 'khor ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bos sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa mngon sum du byed pa yin na de'i tshe 'di 'khor ba nyid do //
translated: But if it is the realization of suffering, etc. as intrinsically real, then at that time it is cyclic existence itself.

original: 'khor ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid do //
translated: It is cyclic existence itself.

original: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin de tsam du zad pa'i @7b phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rang bzhin de tsam du zad pa'i @7b phyir ro //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of cyclic existence is just that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyams su myong na ni 'khor pa nyid du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyams su myong na ni 'khor pa nyid du zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If it is experienced, it is cyclic existence itself.”

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this.

original: ci ltab byed sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i dngos por rtogs pa gzhan 'khor par 'dod pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ltab byed sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i dngos por rtogs pa gzhan 'khor par 'dod pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang 'gyur te /
translated: Just as you maintain that the other, the object of perception such as suffering, etc., is the cause of the world, so also is God,

original: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / 'du ba yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / 'du ba yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
