translated: because there is no difference in the nature of the object of perception, and because the connection is the same.

original: bdag gi rnal 'byor pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i dngos po nyid du rtogs la gzhan ni rang gi shes pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rnal 'byor pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i dngos po nyid du rtogs la gzhan ni rang gi shes pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pas nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The yogi of the self, however, perceives the object of perception itself as the suffering of another, while the other perceives it as the self of his own consciousness.

original: gzhan 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang tshad mar mi 'gal lo zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang tshad mar mi 'gal lo zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that it is not contradictory for the one who possesses attachment, etc., to be a valid cognizer.🔽But if you say, The one who possesses attachment, etc., is not a valid cognizer,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: we reply, How is that?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ni 'di mi srid do snyam na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ni 'di mi srid do snyam na /
translated: If you say, Because it is impossible for the one who possesses attachment, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ces smras so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid ces smras so //
translated: we reply, The one who possesses attachment, etc., is not a valid cognizer.

original: mi nyams pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nyams pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not impaired means that it is a continuous state.

original: gang la dbang phyug dang 'dod chags mi 'gal ba de nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la dbang phyug dang 'dod chags mi 'gal ba de nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: that which is not inconsistent with power and attachment is valid cognition.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The conclusion is easy to understand.

original: tshul 'di de gcig pu'i yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pas thun pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul 'di de gcig pu'i yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pas thun pa yin no //
translated: This method is only for that, not for others. This is the section on faith.

original: 'on te 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But this is is the other's.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug mi srid pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug mi srid pas so //
translated: Therefore is because power is impossible.

original: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: If it is like that, etc. is the conclusion.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ched du gnyen po ston na de'i tshe gnyen po go mas pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs par byed pa do'i phyir gnyen po goms pa med pa'i phyir nges par chags pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la sogs pa'i ched du gnyen po ston na de'i tshe gnyen po go mas pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs par byed pa do'i phyir gnyen po goms pa med pa'i phyir nges par chags pa la sogs par mi 'gyur ro
translated: If the antidote is taught for the sake of power, etc., then because the antidote is understood, it would make one free from attachment, etc. Therefore, because the antidote is not cultivated, one would not definitely become attached, etc.

original: zhes grub po //
analyzed: zhes grub po //
translated: This is established.

original: des na de'i dbang phyug la sogs pa glo bur der ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: des na de'i dbang phyug la sogs pa glo bur der ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, how could that power, etc. suddenly become that?

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is explained in the verse, “Free from attachment, etc.”

original: byed pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa po'i tshig go //
translated: This is a verbal root in the causative form.

original: de ltar dbang phyug gi dbang phyug la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang phyug gi dbang phyug la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that the supremacy of God, etc. is untenable,

original: gzhan du med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid rnam par brtag par byas nas sel bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: gzhan du med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa nyid rnam par brtag par byas nas sel bar 'dod pas /
translated: the opponent, who wishes to refute the assertion that potency is not something else,

original: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: says, “Moreover,” etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi mthar bya rog gi dri bas ci zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig go //🔽gang gi zhes bya ba ni nus @8a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi mthar bya rog gi dri bas ci zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcig go // gang gi zhes bya ba ni nus @8a * //
translated: At the end of the verse, “What is the crow’s question?” is one conceptual thought.

original: pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: “ Whose” refers to the one who has potency.

original: don du gnyer ba la mchog sbyin la zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pas byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba la mchog sbyin la zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pas byed pa po yin te /
translated: “ The bestower of the boon” is the one who is the agent of the desired object.

original: bdag gis bram ze la byin te /
analyzed: bdag gis bram ze la byin te /
translated: “ I have given to the brahmin,

original: des ni ci bzhin rtogs zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: des ni ci bzhin rtogs zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: and he understands it as it is.”

original: 'on te mchog sbyin pa'i nus pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te mchog sbyin pa'i nus pa ni /
translated: Or, the bestower of the boon has potency.

original: de la nus pa de med na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de la nus pa de med na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is “If he does not have that power.”

original: re zhig 'di nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan yang ci ltar yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'di nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan yang ci ltar yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Now, what other refutation is there?

original: gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir dbang phyug la /
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa'i phyir dbang phyug la /
translated: If, because of the absence of a cause,

original: dbang phyug bu sbyin pa'i nus pa med pa de'i tshe de la mtho ris thob par byed ba la sogs pa gzhan yang ji ltar brjod de /
analyzed: dbang phyug bu sbyin pa'i nus pa med pa de'i tshe de la mtho ris thob par byed ba la sogs pa gzhan yang ji ltar brjod de /
translated: Īśvara does not have the power to give his own son, then how can he be said to give heaven, etc.?

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause.

original: dbang phyug gi nus pa'i rgyu ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi nus pa'i rgyu ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause of Īśvara’s power is not present.

original: des na gnyi ga'i nus pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga'i nus pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the power of both is absent.

original: phyogs dang po la brjod ba ni de 'dra ba'i dbang phyug byin pas rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pha ni dbang phyug de la yod pa ni gsal bar tshad ma can ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la brjod ba ni de 'dra ba'i dbang phyug byin pas rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pha ni dbang phyug de la yod pa ni gsal bar tshad ma can ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The statement about the first position is this: If the power to give such a gift as Īśvara has is not clearly established by a valid cognition, then how can it be said that he has the power to give heaven, etc.?

original: ser sna la sogs pas zin pas phyin ci log gi nyes par ston pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pas zin pas phyin ci log gi nyes par ston pa yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that he would teach the faults of error, such as miserliness, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig la 'gor 'gor nas dbang phyug byon nam de lta ma yin pas kyang rung ste nyes pa'i dbang du gyur pa ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'ga' zhig la 'gor 'gor nas dbang phyug byon nam de lta ma yin pas kyang rung ste nyes pa'i dbang du gyur pa ston te /
translated: Similarly, he teaches that one who is under the influence of faults, whether or not he is a god who has come to him again and again,

original: nus pa yod na ma nyes par byas pa la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa yod na ma nyes par byas pa la sogs pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if he has the ability, he does not depend on whether or not he has committed a fault, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis thugs su chud pa'i lam nye bar ston pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis thugs su chud pa'i lam nye bar ston pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The Lord himself teaches the path that he has realized,

original: rtogs pa po rnams kyi rjes su sgrub pa med pa dang / 'phyos pa dag gis mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa med pa dang 'phyos pa mi 'gal te /
analyzed: rtogs pa po rnams kyi rjes su sgrub pa med pa dang / 'phyos pa dag gis mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa med pa dang 'phyos pa mi 'gal te /
translated: and he does not contradict the practice of those who have realized it, nor does he contradict the practice that is desired by those who are confused.

original: des bcom ldan 'das kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lord alone is the authority.

original: don 'di yang yin te zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: don 'di yang yin te zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin pa nyid do //
translated: This is also the meaning of the verse:🔽The Lord is the supreme field of merit,🔽because he is the one who is worshipped.

original: bshad pa / 'di la /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di la /
translated: The verse is commented on:

original: rnam 'gas phan 'dogs med phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam 'gas phan 'dogs med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no benefit in any way.

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'brel par bya'o //
translated: This is connected with what precedes it.

original: mi rtag na yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la yang ste /
analyzed: mi rtag na yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la yang ste /
translated: “Even if impermanent” means “even if permanent.”

original: tshad ma med par brjod pa ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med par brjod pa ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “without valid cognition” is common to both.

original: de ltar spros nas 'jug pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: de ltar spros nas 'jug pa la sogs pa /
translated: Having thus elaborated, he says:

original: gzhan gyi tshad ma bkod na sun 'byin par 'dod pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshad ma bkod na sun 'byin par 'dod pa /
translated: “If one posits another’s valid cognition in order to refute the one who engages in this way,

original: rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni //
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni //
translated: the ability to accept

original: de la tshad ma med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la tshad ma med par 'gyur //
translated: would be without valid cognition.”

original: zhes bya ba 'di la brjod par bya ba'i lhag ma sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la brjod par bya ba'i lhag ma sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to refute the remainder of what is to be said,

original: 'on te mnyes par zhes phyogs snga ma bslang ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te mnyes par zhes phyogs snga ma bslang ba'o //
translated: he raises the opponent’s position: “But if he is pleased . . .”🔽The one who teaches the Dharma through the stages of pleasing

original: mnyes pa'i rim gyis chos ston pa des 'dod chags la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa de'i rjes su 'byin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mnyes pa'i rim gyis chos ston pa des 'dod chags la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa de'i rjes su 'byin par byed pa ste /
translated: brings about the pacification of attachment and so on.

original: @8b des na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: @8b des na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is valid cognition.

original: dbang phyug mnyes par byas pa las 'dod pa mtha' dag grub po zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug mnyes par byas pa las 'dod pa mtha' dag grub po zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement “All desires are accomplished through pleasing Īśvara” is taught by Īśvara himself.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this tenet is as follows.

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi nye bar bzung ba ji snyed pa de thams cad des bshad pa nan tan du byas pa las gyur par des na de'i tshe 'di rigs pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi nye bar bzung ba ji snyed pa de thams cad des bshad pa nan tan du byas pa las gyur par des na de'i tshe 'di rigs pa zhig na /
translated: If all that is accepted in the world were to be explained by the fact that it is the result of his teaching, then at that time it would be reasonable.

original: 'di la ni tshad ma 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni tshad ma 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But here there is no valid cognition at all.

original: des na rtogs par byed pa na /
analyzed: des na rtogs par byed pa na /
translated: Therefore, when it is to be understood,

original: des bshad pa /🔽rjes su sgrub pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des bshad pa / rjes su sgrub pa yis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he explains it.

original: des bshad pa'i lung ni blang ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis khyad par can du 'dod do //
analyzed: des bshad pa'i lung ni blang ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis khyad par can du 'dod do //
translated: By the word “established” it is said that the nature of the scripture is distinguished.

original: lung tsam gyi sgras ni tshad ma lhan cig med par bya ba med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: lung tsam gyi sgras ni tshad ma lhan cig med par bya ba med par ston pa'o //
translated: The mere word “scripture” shows that it is not to be accomplished by valid cognition.

original: lan du de ltar phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de ltar phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response, he says “in that way, mutually.”

original: de nyid bshad pa ni des bshad pa nyid kyi phyir lung ste lung gi khyad par yin la khyad par can gyi lung las kyang de bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni des bshad pa nyid kyi phyir lung ste lung gi khyad par yin la khyad par can gyi lung las kyang de bshad pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is explained: because it is explained by him, it is scripture. The scripture is distinguished. And from the distinguished scripture, he explains it.

original: gal te 'di ni dbang phyug gis bshad pa yin no zhes khyad par la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni dbang phyug gis bshad pa yin no zhes khyad par la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that this is explained by Īśvara, it is not dependent on the distinction.

original: grags pa nyid las grub pa'i phyir khyab mjug la sogs ba'i lung bzhin no //
analyzed: grags pa nyid las grub pa'i phyir khyab mjug la sogs ba'i lung bzhin no //
translated: because it is established by reputation, like the scriptures of Vyāsa and so on.

original: des phan tshun brten par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽brjod pa gal te khyab 'jug la sogs pa ltar /
analyzed: des phan tshun brten par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / brjod pa gal te khyab 'jug la sogs pa ltar /
translated: How is it that they mutually support each other?

original: dbang phyug gi ming tsam gyis lha tsam gyi lung byed pa srid pa yin na /
analyzed: dbang phyug gi ming tsam gyis lha tsam gyi lung byed pa srid pa yin na /
translated: We say: If it is possible that the scriptures are composed by the mere name of Īśvara, like Vyāsa and so on,

original: de'i tshe lung khyad par de 'dra pa ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe lung khyad par de 'dra pa ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could the scriptures have such a special character?

original: des na ji skad brjod pa'i thams cad pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid lung byed pa po yin par brjod dgos pas byed pa po de yang khyad par can gyi lung nyid lam yin no zhes bya ba mi spong ngo //
analyzed: des na ji skad brjod pa'i thams cad pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid lung byed pa po yin par brjod dgos pas byed pa po de yang khyad par can gyi lung nyid lam yin no zhes bya ba mi spong ngo //
translated: Therefore, it must be said that the one who possesses the qualities of omniscience and so on, as described, is the composer of the scriptures. Thus we do not reject the statement that the composer is the one who has the special scriptures.

original: gang gis thams cad la lta ba'i thams cad mthong ba dang / gang gis mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa'i rjes su 'dzin par byed pa de'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis thams cad la lta ba'i thams cad mthong ba dang / gang gis mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa'i rjes su 'dzin par byed pa de'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who sees all things by seeing one thing and who holds the one who is to be accomplished by desire, that whose nature is that which exists is called that.

original: phyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: phyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: Having explained the first half, he comments on the second half:

original: gal te 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If here”

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa'o //
translated: “Thus” introduces the opponent’s position.

original: mngon sum du ma grub pa'i dbang phyug la ni lan 'di brjod par mi bya'o zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma grub pa'i dbang phyug la ni lan 'di brjod par mi bya'o zhes 'brel to //
translated: This response should not be given to a non-existent Īśvara.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o /
translated: “Thus”

original: brgal zing brtag pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: brgal zing brtag pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the analysis of the objection:🔽“How is this?”🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.

original: 'di ci ltar zhes bya ba'o gal te 'byung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar zhes bya ba'o gal te 'byung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If it is by the nature of fire,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i bar ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,

original: gal te 'byung ba nyid kyis me @9a * //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba nyid kyis me @9a * //
translated: then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,

original: bsreg bya sreg na /
analyzed: bsreg bya sreg na /
translated: then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel🔽even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fire,🔽then fire would burn fuel

original: de'i tshe nam mkhas kyang sreg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nam mkhas kyang sreg par 'gyur ro //
translated: even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is by the nature of fuel,🔽then fire would burn fuel

original: 'on te rang bzhin so sor nges pa'i phyir me kho nas sreg gi /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin so sor nges pa'i phyir me kho nas sreg gi /
translated: even without contact with fuel.🔽If it is

original: nam mkhas ma yin na de'i tshe yon tan thams cad ga la yod pa'i rgyu de dang bral yang dbang phyug yon tan dang ldan bas na de 'dra ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkhas ma yin na de'i tshe yon tan thams cad ga la yod pa'i rgyu de dang bral yang dbang phyug yon tan dang ldan bas na de 'dra ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not space, then how can it have all the qualities? Even though it is devoid of the cause, since God has the qualities, he has the ability to do such things.

original: mi mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: mi mtshungs te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is, “It is not similar.”

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug go //
translated: “Another” is God.

original: gtan tshigs des na rang bzhin kho nas dbang phyug ni nus pa mtshungs pa med pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'di lan ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na rang bzhin kho nas dbang phyug ni nus pa mtshungs pa med pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba 'di lan ma yin no //
translated: The reason is that God has the ability by his very nature. This is not a response.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te lan 'di yin na'o ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te lan 'di yin na'o ;
translated: “Otherwise,” if this were the response,

original: / de'i tshe bdag nyid mngon 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: / de'i tshe bdag nyid mngon 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: then the passage “at that time, he desires himself” and so on is easy to understand.

original: dngos po rang bzhin nyid brjod do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de ltas gzhan gyis brjod pa'i rnam pa bsal bas thams cad rgyal ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin nyid brjod do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa de ltas gzhan gyis brjod pa'i rnam pa bsal bas thams cad rgyal ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the passage “The nature of things is said to be their essence” is that since the form of the response is refuted by another, all is won by the victor.

original: 'ga' zhig tu lan brjod pas zhes 'dod pa der yang de ltar zhes bya ba rnam pa 'dis gal te rtsod pa'i rnam pa de 'dra ba'i lan thebs na de'i thams cad rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu lan brjod pas zhes 'dod pa der yang de ltar zhes bya ba rnam pa 'dis gal te rtsod pa'i rnam pa de 'dra ba'i lan thebs na de'i thams cad rgyal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In some places, it is asserted that the response is stated, and in that case, this is the meaning of the phrase “in that way.” If the response to the opponent’s position is made in that way, then all of them will be victorious.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: “ Therefore” is a summary.

original: de ltar snga ma'i brjod bya lhag ma'i lan btab nas /
analyzed: de ltar snga ma'i brjod bya lhag ma'i lan btab nas /
translated: Having thus responded to the remainder of the topic of the previous chapter,

original: brtsam pa'i don gyi gzhi 'dings pa ni /
analyzed: brtsam pa'i don gyi gzhi 'dings pa ni /
translated: the basis of the topic of the present chapter is set forth.

original: gal te tshad ma yod pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yod pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ If valid cognition exists” and so on.

original: de 'di ni de ltar sbyar ba yin no //🔽rtogs pa ni de ltar yin te legs par brjod do zhes bya ba 'di de ma thag tu don 'di yang yin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de 'di ni de ltar sbyar ba yin no // rtogs pa ni de ltar yin te legs par brjod do zhes bya ba 'di de ma thag tu don 'di yang yin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is how it is applied.

original: tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gi dum bu yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gi dum bu yin la /
translated: “ Understanding” is as follows. “ Well said” is the following passage up to “this is also the meaning” and so on, up to “the meaning of ‘valid cognition does not exist.’”

original: chad gzhug nyes kyis 'khrul pa skyed pa phyis 'dri mkhan gyis gzhan du dris pa yin te /🔽mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chad gzhug nyes kyis 'khrul pa skyed pa phyis 'dri mkhan gyis gzhan du dris pa yin te / mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The questioner in the future will ask in a different way, because of the difference.

original: bshad par ni gzhan dag gis ma dpyad pa sa de kho na ltar dar ba yin no //
analyzed: bshad par ni gzhan dag gis ma dpyad pa sa de kho na ltar dar ba yin no //
translated: But others, without analyzing, spread that explanation just as it is.

original: sdod 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdad cing 'jug pa zhes bzlog pa gtsor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sdod 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdad cing 'jug pa zhes bzlog pa gtsor bstan pa'o //
translated: The words “resting” and “functioning” are taught as the reverse of “resting and functioning.”

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab la yang dbyibs zlum po srid pas /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab la yang dbyibs zlum po srid pas /
translated: The words “distinctive shape” are stated because it is possible that even subtle particles have a round shape.

original: rtsod pa byed pa ni cha shas ldan pa bzung ba'i don du khyad par zhes smos so //🔽don byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa byed pa ni cha shas ldan pa bzung ba'i don du khyad par zhes smos so // don byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The word “distinctive” is stated in order to take as the object of apprehension that which has parts.

original: don bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: don bya ba med pa'o //
translated: The words “functioning” and “not functioning”🔽are stated because of the nonexistence of functioning.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sems pa'i nye bar len pa can ma yin pa 'di dang / 'bras bu nyid dang skye ba @9b dang ldan pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sems pa'i nye bar len pa can ma yin pa 'di dang / 'bras bu nyid dang skye ba @9b dang ldan pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The words “and so on” are stated to include the nonmental appropriator, the nonresultant, and the nonarisen.

original: de la sdod nas 'jug pa dang don byed pa ni chos nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: de la sdod nas 'jug pa dang don byed pa ni chos nyid 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: The resting and functioning and the functioning are the resultant evidence for the reality of the whole.

original: lhag ma ni chos can nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni chos can nyid do //
translated: The rest are the subject.

original: dbyibs ni gnyi ga yang 'bras bu yin te /🔽dbyibs ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: dbyibs ni gnyi ga yang 'bras bu yin te / dbyibs ni chos can yin la /
translated: Shape is the effect of both.🔽Shape is the subject.

original: de dang ldan pa ni chos can yin no //🔽nye bar 'god pa yang chos kyi sgo nas sam /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni chos can yin no // nye bar 'god pa yang chos kyi sgo nas sam /
translated: The possession of shape is the subject.

original: chos can gyi sgo nas kyang bya ste /
analyzed: chos can gyi sgo nas kyang bya ste /
translated: The statement of the thesis is made either from the point of view of the property or from the point of view of the subject.

original: thams cad tshad ma'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te 'di dag 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin mod /
analyzed: thams cad tshad ma'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro // gal te 'di dag 'bras bu'i bdag nyid yin mod /
translated: This is because everything is governed by the means of valid knowledge.🔽Even if these are the effects, how is God established?

original: de de lta na yang dbang phyug ci ltar 'grub snyam nas 'bras bu las zhes smos so //
analyzed: de de lta na yang dbang phyug ci ltar 'grub snyam nas 'bras bu las zhes smos so //
translated: The statement “from the effect” is made.

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu las rgyu mi 'grub na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa rgyu gzhan las rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu las rgyu mi 'grub na de'i tshe mig la sogs pa rgyu gzhan las rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the effect were not established from the cause, then the eye, etc. would not be inferred from another cause.

original: 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: But they are.

original: des na 'bras bu las rgyu mi 'grub pa ma yin no //🔽'bras bu gtan tshegs de dag nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu las rgyu mi 'grub pa ma yin no // 'bras bu gtan tshegs de dag nyid ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the cause is established from the effect.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The proof of the effect is shown by the words “because of the existence of the effect.🔽”

original: mdong bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir yan lag gnyis kyang nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: mdong bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir yan lag gnyis kyang nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no //
translated: The two members are also merely illustrative, because they are included in the middle member.

original: des na phyogs kyi chos ni dpag par bya ba nyid du byas so //
analyzed: des na phyogs kyi chos ni dpag par bya ba nyid du byas so //
translated: Therefore, the property of the position is made the object of inference.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni rdul phra rab pa lta'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni rdul phra rab pa lta'o //
translated: The example of the dissimilar class is like the atom.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang ldan par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, all causal inferences are asserted to have pervasion by the positive and negative concomitance.

original: blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub bya 'phangs pa ste /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgrub bya 'phangs pa ste /
translated: The intelligent one is empowered by the cause, etc. is the thesis.

original: rigs pa can gna' ma'i yugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rnam 'grel 'jug pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa can gna' ma'i yugs kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rnam 'grel 'jug pa ston pa'o //
translated: Following the ancient Naiyāyikas, it teaches the introduction to the Pramaṇavārttika.

original: 'am gyi sgras ni dbang phyug byed pa po nyid dpyad par 'os pa dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par ma grub par yang sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'am gyi sgras ni dbang phyug byed pa po nyid dpyad par 'os pa dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par ma grub par yang sdud pa'o //
translated: The word “or” includes the examination of Īśvara as the agent and the unestablished distinction of shape.

original: des na bshad pa yang de kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: des na bshad pa yang de kho na ltar yin no //
translated: Therefore, the explanation is just like that.

original: lhag ma'i dpyad ni mdun du sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma'i dpyad ni mdun du sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: The remaining analysis will be considered later.

original: ma grub pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i nang du 'dus so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs phyogs kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub pa'i nang du 'dus so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the reason “the property of the subject is not established” is included in “that which is established is being established.”

original: yang don med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang don med pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, it is pointless.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba dang bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba dang bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained and will be established.

original: ma nges pa bzhin du ma grub pa ni nye bar sdud par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa bzhin du ma grub pa ni nye bar sdud par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As with the uncertain reason, the unestablished reason is not included.

original: thams cad du yang don med pa dang mi nus pa'i nyes pa gnyis kho na brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yang don med pa dang mi nus pa'i nyes pa gnyis kho na brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in all cases, only the faults of pointlessness and impossibility are mentioned.

original: des na mtha' dag pas de nyid yin yang gzhan gyi nang du bsdu ba bsams pa ci bya ste /
analyzed: des na mtha' dag pas de nyid yin yang gzhan gyi nang du bsdu ba bsams pa ci bya ste /
translated: Therefore, even if it is the case that the unestablished reason is included in the established reason, what is the point of including it in the other?

original: @10a * // don med pa kho na dngos su gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @10a * // don med pa kho na dngos su gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pointlessness is clearly the case.

original: dper na gnod bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi skyon yod kyang mi brtsi bde bzhin du yang bsdu ba la yang gus par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dper na gnod bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs la gtan tshigs kyi skyon yod kyang mi brtsi bde bzhin du yang bsdu ba la yang gus par mi bya'o //
translated: Just as the fault of the reason is not considered in the case of a position that is undermined, so too one should not be concerned with inclusion.

original: nus pa med pa yang dbye ba rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du ma grub pa la sogs pa gsum gdon mi za bar bsu dgos so //
analyzed: nus pa med pa yang dbye ba rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa gnyis kyi nang du ma grub pa la sogs pa gsum gdon mi za bar bsu dgos so //
translated: Since there are three types of ineffective karma, the three types of non-established karma and so on must be included in the two types of ineffective karma.

original: des na don med pa'i nyes pa ni gzhan kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na don med pa'i nyes pa ni gzhan kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the fault of being meaningless is only a fault of others.

original: gzhan ji ltar phyogs 'grub na gang gi sgrub pa la grub pa'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ji ltar phyogs 'grub na gang gi sgrub pa la grub pa'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that when the thesis is established, the fault of establishing the probandum is incurred?

original: thams cad las kyi mtshan nyid zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad las kyi mtshan nyid zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that all are characterized by karma.

original: de ga las zhe na /
analyzed: de ga las zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, “Because of this.”

original: las de yang yid yin gyi lus la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: las de yang yid yin gyi lus la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That karma is mental, not physical and so on.

original: des na de ni sems pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de ni sems pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore it is intention alone.

original: des na chos mngon pa las /🔽las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes bar brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na chos mngon pa las / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes bar brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore the Abhidharma states:🔽The world’s diversity arises from karma.

original: sems can kho nar byed par bstan to //
analyzed: sems can kho nar byed par bstan to //
translated: Therefore it is taught that sentient beings alone perform karma.

original: de bas na blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs par bsgrub pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs par bsgrub pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the intelligent being’s blessing is the establishment of what is already established.

original: gal te las las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te las las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: If the meaning of “from action” and so on is this,

original: las las skyes pa nyid ni mi 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las las skyes pa nyid ni mi 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not denied that the world is born from action.

original: gal te de'i sgo nas 'khor ba thams cad rgyu yin par brjod na de'i 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: gal te de'i sgo nas 'khor ba thams cad rgyu yin par brjod na de'i 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: If you say that the entire world is caused by that, what is the contradiction?

original: thams cad dbang phyug gis byin gyis brlabs pa kho na rgyu yin no zhes grub pa na grub pa la sgrub pa ci 'dra ba zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad dbang phyug gis byin gyis brlabs pa kho na rgyu yin no zhes grub pa na grub pa la sgrub pa ci 'dra ba zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: When it is established that the cause is only the blessing of God, what is the establishment of what is already established?

original: de nyid gzhan gyi lugs kyis khungs 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi lugs kyis khungs 'byin pa ni /
translated: He cites the source of the opponent’s system:

original: de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Thus, it is said.”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the world.

original: dbang phyug gis bskul pa ni pa bcug ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bskul pa ni pa bcug ba'o //
translated: “Urged by God” means “blessed by God.”

original: nges mngon par gsal ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa sems pa'i mtshan nyid las kyi ming can chos nyid las yin no //
analyzed: nges mngon par gsal ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa sems pa'i mtshan nyid las kyi ming can chos nyid las yin no //
translated: “Manifestation” means “blessing.” The nature of things is the mental state that is called “action.”

original: gzhan gyi ltar na chos yon tan gzhan yin pas de lta na yang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ltar na chos yon tan gzhan yin pas de lta na yang /
translated: According to the other, since the quality is different from the object,

original: sangs rgyas pa la grub pa sems pa'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas khyad par bsgrub par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la grub pa sems pa'i rang bzhin khas blangs nas khyad par bsgrub par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: even though it is so, he accepts that the nature of the established is the mind, and he wishes to establish a difference.

original: gal te de ltar grub kyang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do snyam pa dbang phyug gi sems pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar grub kyang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid do snyam pa dbang phyug gi sems pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is established in that way, he thinks that the established is the very establishment.

original: de ni med de zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de ni med de zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: That is not so, is the philosophical position.

original: sems pa gzhan de ni dbang phyug gi sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa gzhan de ni dbang phyug gi sems pa'o //
translated: The other mind is the mind of the Lord.

original: sgrub par byed pa don med pas smras pa ni dbang phyug pa ltos pa la gzhan gyis bsam pa med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs @10b pas bstan nas /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa don med pas smras pa ni dbang phyug pa ltos pa la gzhan gyis bsam pa med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs @10b pas bstan nas /
translated: Since the establishment is purposeless, he says that the Lord is independent of the mind of another.🔽Having taught that, he establishes the purposelessness with,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas don med pa nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas don med pa nyid gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: In that case, etc.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gal te 'bras bu la rgyu 'jug pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa rgyur 'dod cing de dag kyang sems pa'i rang bzhin yin la nges par rtogs pa'i sgra'i don yang de nyid yin na de'i tshe ;
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu la rgyu 'jug pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa rgyur 'dod cing de dag kyang sems pa'i rang bzhin yin la nges par rtogs pa'i sgra'i don yang de nyid yin na de'i tshe ;
translated: If you assert that virtue and nonvirtue are causes because they engage the cause in the effect and they are by nature intention and the meaning of the term is ascertained to be that, then at that time.🔽🔽

original: nges par rtogs par gzhan gyi bya ba ci yod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par rtogs par gzhan gyi bya ba ci yod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: If you assert that virtue and nonvirtue are causes because they cause the result, and if they are by nature intention and if the meaning of the term ascertainment is that, then what is the activity of another in ascertainment?

original: gal te sems pa tsam nges par rtogs pa'i don yin na /
analyzed: gal te sems pa tsam nges par rtogs pa'i don yin na /
translated: If the meaning of ascertainment is mere intention,

original: 'khor ba yang nges par rtogs pa can du thal lo //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang nges par rtogs pa can du thal lo //
translated: then it follows that cyclic existence would be ascertainment.

original: 'di ni de'i zhes bya ba'i sems pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin gyi dbang phyug gi ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i zhes bya ba'i sems pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin gyi dbang phyug gi ji lta ba bzhin ma yin no //
translated: This is the mere intention that is the limit of this, but it is not like the Almighty.

original: dbang phyug gi 'di la ni 'di bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi 'di la ni 'di bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the case of the Almighty, one conceives that this is to be established,

original: 'di ni 'di'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: this is its appropriation, and so on.

original: 'dis ni 'di bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par nges pa rtog par byed ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par nges pa rtog par byed ba yin no //
translated: This is to be established by this.

original: des na sems pa dang ldan par gnas par mtshungs kyang /
analyzed: des na sems pa dang ldan par gnas par mtshungs kyang /
translated: Thus, although they are similar in abiding with intention,

original: yon tan khyad par can dang ldan pa'i dbang phyug sgrub par brtson pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can dang ldan pa'i dbang phyug sgrub par brtson pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are striving to achieve a powerful being who possesses special qualities.

original: sgrub par byed pa don med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa don med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the striving be pointless?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i stobs kyis grub pa yod kyang don med par rtsod pa'i skabs ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i stobs kyis grub pa yod kyang don med par rtsod pa'i skabs ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa na /
translated: Even if there is an effect due to the power of striving, there is no occasion for arguing that it is pointless.

original: dpe ma grub ces brjod pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni de lta na yang dpe ma grub bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe ma grub ces brjod pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni de lta na yang dpe ma grub bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “the example is not established” is clarified by the words “even so, the example is not established.”

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan bcom dor nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan bcom dor nas /
translated: Even so means even though you have rejected the intelligent creator.

original: dbang phyug khas len pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang phyug khas len pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that you accept a powerful being.

original: dpe ma grub pa nyid ston pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sems pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba nas thub pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa nyid ston pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i sems pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba nas thub pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: To show that the example is not established, he says “the pot, etc., are not conscious” up to “there would be no sage.”

original: 'dis ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de la gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de la gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is contradictory because there is no reason for it, since there is no similar instance.

original: yang na ldog pa khyab par ma bstan pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam la ltos nas ldog pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na ldog pa khyab par ma bstan pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam la ltos nas ldog pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is an uncommon inconclusive reason, because the absence of the reason in the dissimilar instance is based on the mere non-observation of the reason in the dissimilar instance, without teaching the pervasion of the absence.

original: des na sgrub par byed pa'i stobs las rten pa gsal ba yin no ;
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa'i stobs las rten pa gsal ba yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the existence of the reason in the similar instance is based on the power of the proof.

original: /'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan mthun phyogs sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: /'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan mthun phyogs sgrub pa'o //
translated: But refers to another, the proof of the similar instance.

original: bcug nas zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gis so //
analyzed: bcug nas zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gis so //
translated: Having placed means having placed by God.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na thams cad shes pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na thams cad shes pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: Why? Because of omniscience.

original: dbang phyug gi thams cad shes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi thams cad shes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that God is omniscient.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don nyid 'chad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don nyid 'chad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: The meaning of the verse is explained as thus, etc.

original: @11a * // nges par rtogs mi nus pa ni yul thams cad do //
analyzed: @11a * // nges par rtogs mi nus pa ni yul thams cad do //
translated: All objects are not able to be ascertained.

original: gal te yang rdza mkhan rang gi bya ba'i nye bar len pa sogs pa /
analyzed: gal te yang rdza mkhan rang gi bya ba'i nye bar len pa sogs pa /
translated: Even if the potter were to know a little about the objects of his activity, etc.,

original: don cung zad shes pa yin pa de lta na yang ma lus par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don cung zad shes pa yin pa de lta na yang ma lus par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: he would not know them in their entirety.

original: 'dis yang dag par sbyin pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'dis yang dag par sbyin pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: This does not constitute knowledge of the intrinsic identity of giving.

original: / phan 'dogs byed ma lus par shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / phan 'dogs byed ma lus par shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it constitute knowledge of all that is helpful,

original: chos la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not understand Dharma, etc.

original: dbang phyug gis ni thams cad shes pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa la rdza mkhan skul bar byed pa po zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis ni thams cad shes pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa la rdza mkhan skul bar byed pa po zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is because God knows everything that he is posited as the instigator of the potter, etc., with regard to pots, etc.

original: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not so, he says.

original: byed pa po sgrub pas zhes bya ba ni thams cad grub pa por thams cad shes pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur pa thabs gzhan med pa'i thams cad byed pa po nyid kyang thams cad shes pa de nyid las yin no zhes rnam par gnas pa na thams cad
analyzed: byed pa po sgrub pas zhes bya ba ni thams cad grub pa por thams cad shes pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur pa thabs gzhan med pa'i thams cad byed pa po nyid kyang thams cad shes pa de nyid las yin no zhes rnam par gnas pa na thams cad
translated: The passage beginning “The establishment of the agent” means that the establishment of omniscience as the agent of all is not accomplished by any other means. The agent of all is also just that omniscience itself. When it is established in this way, then

original: byed pa po nyid dang / kun shes pa nyid gnyis phan tshun rten pa chen por 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: byed pa po nyid dang / kun shes pa nyid gnyis phan tshun rten pa chen por 'gyur ro ;
translated: omniscience and the agent of all become mutually dependent.

original: / des na gcig kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: / des na gcig kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, neither is established. This is the idea.

original: gal te dbang phyug dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug dam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that the supreme Lord is the agent of all,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad byed pa po ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad byed pa po ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: not otherwise, then he would not be the agent of all.

original: skul bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa bskul ba'i sgo nas bum pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: skul bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa bskul ba'i sgo nas bum pa la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: “The instigator” is the agent of such things as a pot by way of instigating a potter, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba thams cad shes pa nyid dang bral ba na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba thams cad shes pa nyid dang bral ba na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if he were devoid of omniscience,

original: de'i phyir phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pa gcig kyang mi 'grub pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub byas stong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun rten pa'i nyes pa gcig kyang mi 'grub pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub byas stong ngo //
translated: Therefore, since the fault of mutual dependence is not established even once, the example is empty of the probandum.

original: 'di'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni srid pa tsam gyi yul yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni srid pa tsam gyi yul yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that omniscience is not the object of mere possibility,

original: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Moreover…”

original: ci'i phyir 'jug par ni mi byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jug par ni mi byed ce na /
translated: Why does he not engage in it?

original: spyod pa dang ldan pa ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod pa dang ldan pa ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, “One who is endowed with conduct…”

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa la ni 'jug par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa la ni 'jug par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not engage in non-virtuous conduct.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug go //
translated: “That” refers to Īśvara.

original: log par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: log par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni chos ma yin pa byed pa'o //
translated: “Wrong engagement” means to do what is not Dharma.

original: don 'di yin te thams cad shes pa yin na thams cad grub pa bzod par dka' ba'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal du lta ba'i skye bo la brtse ba kho nar rigs kyi /
analyzed: don 'di yin te thams cad shes pa yin na thams cad grub pa bzod par dka' ba'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal du lta ba'i skye bo la brtse ba kho nar rigs kyi /
translated: The meaning is this. If he were omniscient, it would be reasonable that he would have compassion for beings who see the difficult-to-bear suffering of cyclic existence, which is the result of everything.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa la bskul bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa la bskul bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it would not be reasonable that he would incite them to non-virtuous conduct.

original: 'on te de'i bsam ba rtogs par sus nus she na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i bsam ba rtogs par sus nus she na /
translated: But who can understand his intention?

original: kye ma dad pa 'di ni shin du @11b che ste /
analyzed: kye ma dad pa 'di ni shin du @11b che ste /
translated: Oh, this faith is very great!🔽Even butchers, etc. should be objects of it.

original: shan pa la sogs pa yang yul du gyis shig / thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan la the tshom za yang 'di dbang phyug dam pa nyid yin par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: shan pa la sogs pa yang yul du gyis shig / thams cad shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan la the tshom za yang 'di dbang phyug dam pa nyid yin par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Even though one doubts the qualities of omniscience, etc., how could he be the highest Lord?

original: bsam pa ma rtogs par ni thams cad shes pa the tshom za ba yang mi ldog go //
analyzed: bsam pa ma rtogs par ni thams cad shes pa the tshom za ba yang mi ldog go //
translated: Without understanding the intention, even the doubt about omniscience is not removed.

original: des na bum pa la sogs par byed par nus pa ma yin pas skabs nyams so //
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs par byed par nus pa ma yin pas skabs nyams so //
translated: Therefore, since he is not able to make pots, etc., the occasion is lost.

original: des na rtsa ba nyid shor ro zhes brjod pa na de ci ltar tshad ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba nyid shor ro zhes brjod pa na de ci ltar tshad ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the root itself is lost. How can that be a valid cognition?

original: de 'dra ba'i rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no such kind of analysis.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa med pas the tshom yang grub pa'i phyir de srid pa'i tha snyad du nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa med pas the tshom yang grub pa'i phyir de srid pa'i tha snyad du nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no complete analysis, doubt is also established. Therefore, it is not possible for that to be a conventional existence.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But is another's.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i nye bar bstan pa byed pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i nye bar bstan pa byed pas so //
translated: “Therefore” means because of the teaching of the holy one.

original: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “That is not so” is the conclusion.

original: chos ma yin pa yang zhes pa ni chos 'ba' zhig la ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa yang zhes pa ni chos 'ba' zhig la ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Even in the case of an unrighteous act” means not only in the case of a righteous act.

original: re zhig dang por zhes bya bar ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig dang por zhes bya bar ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “First of all” will be explained.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis te des na sdig pa la rang dbang du 'jug pa mi byed de snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis te des na sdig pa la rang dbang du 'jug pa mi byed de snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: “If” is from the other side, thinking that one should not engage in sin under one’s own power.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “In that case” is the reply.

original: de'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs nas dbang phyug rtogs par byed pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs nas dbang phyug rtogs par byed pa nyams pa'o //
translated: The power of his karma would be impaired if he were to be perceived as a lord.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs kyang mi 'os pa mi byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs kyang mi 'os pa mi byed do //
translated: One who is perceived as having power would not do what is improper even if blessed by another.

original: des na 'di ni de'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs kyang skye bo'i sdig pa la mi 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di ni de'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs kyang skye bo'i sdig pa la mi 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if blessed by his karma, he would not engage in the sin of a person.

original: las gang gis khyod kyis brlabs nas sdig pa la 'jug par byed pa'i las de yang zhes go sla'o //🔽'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: las gang gis khyod kyis brlabs nas sdig pa la 'jug par byed pa'i las de yang zhes go sla'o // 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The karma by which you are empowered to engage in evil is also karma, as is easy to understand.🔽But if you think that karma is not the cause of the world,

original: byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skye bo ni rang nyid chos ma yin pa byed pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽de las gzhan pa'i dbang phyug bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang skye bo ni rang nyid chos ma yin pa byed pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o // de las gzhan pa'i dbang phyug bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bzhin no //
translated: then the world would not be produced by karma, but people would engage in nonvirtue on their own.🔽But that is not the case, just like the case of the Lord.

original: de yang snying po med de zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de yang snying po med de zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: That is not the case, because the world is not produced by the Lord.

original: gang gis skye bo rnams sdig pa byed pa 'gog par byed par dbang phyug gzhan la rnam pa 'dra ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis skye bo rnams sdig pa byed pa 'gog par byed par dbang phyug gzhan la rnam pa 'dra ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The Lord has no power to stop people from engaging in evil.

original: des na de dag gis chos ma yin pa'i byed pa de'i 'bras bu myong du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag gis chos ma yin pa'i byed pa de'i 'bras bu myong du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he makes them experience the results of their own nonvirtuous actions.

original: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'i blo dang ldan par 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'i blo dang ldan par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted that the Lord has a mind that transcends the entire world.

original: des na de ni sdig pa byed pa dgag par nus pa nyid do //🔽de ltar yin yang chos ma yin pa byed pa med pa'i phyir de'i @12a * //
analyzed: des na de ni sdig pa byed pa dgag par nus pa nyid do // de ltar yin yang chos ma yin pa byed pa med pa'i phyir de'i @12a * //
translated: Therefore, it is able to prevent the performance of evil.🔽Even though this is so, it does not experience the result of that evil, because it does not perform evil.

original: 'bras bu myong bar byed pa ma yin snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu myong bar byed pa ma yin snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: 'on te 'di nus pa med pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di nus pa med pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But if it is powerless, this is the opponent’s view.

original: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'i zlog pa la nus pa med pa kho na'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'i zlog pa la nus pa med pa kho na'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen that it is powerless to prevent the performance of evil.

original: sdig pa'i dbang phyug gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dbang phyug gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: It is not at all subject to the reversal or continuation of the power of evil.🔽This is the thought.

original: lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste nus pa med pa yin na'o //
analyzed: lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste nus pa med pa yin na'o //
translated: In response, if it is powerless, this is the response.

original: ci dang 'dra bar ma byas she na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar ma byas she na /
translated: If it is powerless, how is it not like evil?

original: sdig bzhin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdig bzhin zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is like evil.

original: dper na dam pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid med par khas blangs ba'i phyir skye bo rnams kyi sdig pa nyid des ma byas pa bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan la yang des byas par yid ches pa ci yod /
analyzed: dper na dam pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid med par khas blangs ba'i phyir skye bo rnams kyi sdig pa nyid des ma byas pa bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan la yang des byas par yid ches pa ci yod /
translated: For example, just as people do not believe that a sin is committed by someone who does not have the ultimate, so too, why would they believe that the effect is produced by that?

original: des na sdig pas 'khrul pa'i phyir 'dis 'bras bu la ma khyab pas na dam pa'i don dang ldan pa chos la sogs pa yang de las yin pa ci ste khas len /
analyzed: des na sdig pas 'khrul pa'i phyir 'dis 'bras bu la ma khyab pas na dam pa'i don dang ldan pa chos la sogs pa yang de las yin pa ci ste khas len /
translated: Therefore, since the effect is not pervaded by that, because of the delusion of sin, why accept that the ultimate, such as Dharma, is also from that?

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni thar pa dang yon tan gzhan du gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni thar pa dang yon tan gzhan du gzung ngo //
translated: The term “etc.” includes liberation and other qualities.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ster ba la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni gzhan la chos ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ster ba la'o //
translated: “ In this case” means in the case of giving an effect that is not Dharma to another.

original: de'i tshe bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa nye bar ston pa tshad mar ci ltar khas len te ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa nye bar ston pa tshad mar ci ltar khas len te ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, how could one accept that the demonstration of truth and falsity is valid? It is not at all. This is the meaning.

original: khyed tshad ma dang ldan pa chen po yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: khyed tshad ma dang ldan pa chen po yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: You are the great ones who possess valid cognition. This is the connection.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pas skul bar byed pa po yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pas skul bar byed pa po yin na yang ngo //
translated: If that is so, then even if it is the instigator of virtue and vice,

original: bdag nyid ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the self would possess the qualities of permanence and so on.🔽Anticipating this qualm, he responds:

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu nas 'gog pa ni gal te srog chags thams cad kyi bdag kun 'bras bu thams cad kyi byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu nas 'gog pa ni gal te srog chags thams cad kyi bdag kun 'bras bu thams cad kyi byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: If the self of all living beings were not the creator of all effects,

original: ri la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sems can 'ga' zhig gi ched du bsam pa'i bya ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sems can 'ga' zhig gi ched du bsam pa'i bya ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then the activity of some sentient being would not be observed for the sake of any effect, such as a mountain.

original: gal te de ltar rtogs na de'i tshe yang dbang phyug de'i thams cad kyi byed pa po ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtogs na de'i tshe yang dbang phyug de'i thams cad kyi byed pa po ste /
translated: If you understand it that way, then at that time, that Īśvara would be the creator of all.

original: byed pa por smra ba gang du dgos te /
analyzed: byed pa por smra ba gang du dgos te /
translated: What need is there to speak of him as the creator?

original: de ltar ma dmigs pa ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma dmigs pa ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that nonobservation is common to all.

original: lag pa'i rtsom pa la sogs pa ni pha rol bo rang nyid kyis 'dod pa ma yin pas 'dod pa tsam yod do zhes brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: lag pa'i rtsom pa la sogs pa ni pha rol bo rang nyid kyis 'dod pa ma yin pas 'dod pa tsam yod do zhes brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: The activity of the hand and so on is not asserted by the opponent. Therefore it is said that it exists merely as an assertion.

original: de yang sun phyung ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang sun phyung ba yin te /
translated: This is also refuted,

original: mi rigs pa'i bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because we see that the activity is improper.

original: de'i phyir de byin gyis brlabs pa tsam gyis 'bras bu thams cad skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de byin gyis brlabs pa tsam gyis 'bras bu thams cad skye ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is only the mere fact that remains: “All effects arise from the mere blessing of that.”

original: dngos po'i nus pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba tsam zhig lus pa yin @12b no ;
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba tsam zhig lus pa yin @12b no ;
translated: Because the power of things is inconceivable.

original: de lta na ni 'o na lta ba'i dra bas bcings pa'i bdag thams cad nyid kyis thams cad byed pa la chad pa ci yod de /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na lta ba'i dra bas bcings pa'i bdag thams cad nyid kyis thams cad byed pa la chad pa ci yod de /
translated: If that is so, then what is the nihilism in the assertion that all selves bound by the net of views create everything?

original: 'dir yang dngos po'i nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes ni brjod par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos po'i nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro zhes ni brjod par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because here it is possible to say that the power of things is inconceivable.

original: nus pa gzhi nges pa can du dmigs pa na gzhan du dogs pa na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: nus pa gzhi nges pa can du dmigs pa na gzhan du dogs pa na mi 'thad do //
translated: When the power of a thing is observed to be restricted to a particular basis, it is not tenable to suspect that it is otherwise.

original: 'di ni mun par lag pa noms pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni mun par lag pa noms pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because this is like groping for something in the dark.

original: gnod byed med pa las gzhan du rnam par rtog pa la yang dgag pa ci yod /
analyzed: gnod byed med pa las gzhan du rnam par rtog pa la yang dgag pa ci yod /
translated: What is the point of the negation of conception that it is otherwise, when there is no evidence to the contrary?

original: de lta yin yang bdag mang pos ri la sogs pa gcig byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin yang bdag mang pos ri la sogs pa gcig byed par 'gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, then many selves would make one mountain, etc.

original: thun mong gi las kyi skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtog par yang 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi las kyi skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtog par yang 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: because they are produced by a common karma.🔽If that is so, then this conception would be limited.

original: de lta na rtog pa 'di mtha' zhig tu 'gyur ro zhe na ri la sogs pa mang po rnams kyang bdag gcig gis byed do zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho nar yang 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta na rtog pa 'di mtha' zhig tu 'gyur ro zhe na ri la sogs pa mang po rnams kyang bdag gcig gis byed do zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho nar yang 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: But if one self makes many mountains, etc., then this conception would be limited.

original: gnyi ga la yang gnod pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang gnod pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition that contradicts either of these two conceptions.

original: ri la sogs pa gcig kho nas byas so zhes nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa gcig kho nas byas so zhes nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not certain that one mountain, etc. is made by one self.

original: gzhan dag rnam pa ci zhig ltar byed pa po gcig yod par nges pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sel ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam pa ci zhig ltar byed pa po gcig yod par nges pa'i dogs pa bsu nas sel ba ni /
translated: Others, anticipating the question, “In what way is it certain that one maker exists?”

original: 'on te gzhan dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: answer, “Or, if another is made by one, etc.”

original: gal te thams cad la byed pa po gcig sgrub pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad la byed pa po gcig sgrub pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
translated: If one proves that there is one maker for all, what is the advantage?

original: byed pa po 'di zhes smos so //
analyzed: byed pa po 'di zhes smos so //
translated: The answer is, “This maker is called God.”

original: de las mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to accomplish the goal that you most desire,🔽

original: bsnyen cing bkur bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsnyen cing bkur bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should serve and honor him in order to accomplish the desired goal.

original: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa tsam gyis bsnyen par 'os pa ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad mkhyen pa tsam gyis bsnyen par 'os pa ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that it is not proper to serve him merely because he is omniscient,

original: kun shes pa tsam gyis zhes smras so //
analyzed: kun shes pa tsam gyis zhes smras so //
translated: he says that it is proper to serve him because he is omniscient and because he is the bestower of the highest gift.

original: thams cad byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir mchog sbyin la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir mchog sbyin la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa'o //
translated: Since he is not the agent of all, he does not have the ability to bestow the highest gift, etc.

original: kun mkhyen yin yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun mkhyen yin yang zhes bya ba ni thams cad byed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though he is omniscient means even though he has the quality of being the agent of all, etc.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no purpose.

original: dgos pa chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is little purpose.

original: ji ltar dgos pa chung snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar dgos pa chung snyam na /
translated: How is there little purpose?

original: bu ram dar ba byed pa po //
analyzed: bu ram dar ba byed pa po //
translated: The maker of molasses is not the maker of cloth.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.🔽One should rely on the one who is omniscient and the bestower of the highest gift, not on the one who is not omniscient and not the bestower of the highest gift.

original: 'di rigs pa dang mi rigs pa 'dres pa la grags pa yin no //🔽de nyid gsungs pa ni /🔽don dang don byed la 'chel zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rigs pa dang mi rigs pa 'dres pa la grags pa yin no //🔽de nyid gsungs pa ni /🔽don dang don byed la 'chel zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who is omniscient and the bestower of the highest gift is the Buddha, not others.

original: rtog pa yin na ni gzhan la phan pa kho na rigs na /
analyzed: rtog pa yin na ni gzhan la phan pa kho na rigs na /
translated: If it is a conceptual thought, then it is only proper to benefit others.

original: de ni phan pa 'ga' zhig res 'ga' byed la don ma yin pa ni sna tshogs pa byed pas 'dres pa'i bya ba can yin te /🔽des @13a * //
analyzed: de ni phan pa 'ga' zhig res 'ga' byed la don ma yin pa ni sna tshogs pa byed pas 'dres pa'i bya ba can yin te / des @13a * //
translated: But it sometimes benefits a few, and it causes various kinds of harm. Thus, it is a confused agent.

original: 'di la phan pa chung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di la phan pa chung ba kho na'o //
translated: It is only a slight benefit to this world.

original: de'i phyir mchog sbyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du thams cad byed pa po gcig don du gnyer ba ni don med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog sbyin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du thams cad byed pa po gcig don du gnyer ba ni don med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is meaningless to strive for a single agent who would perform all actions for the sake of omniscience, the fruit of giving the highest gift. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar byed pa po 'di gtso bo ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsal nas tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma'i don brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po 'di gtso bo ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsal nas tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma'i don brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Having thus refuted the statement that this agent is the principal one, etc., in order to state the meaning of the earlier verse, he says:

original: kun shes nyid du grub na /🔽thams cad byed par nus pa yin zhing thams cad byed par nus pa yin na ni /
analyzed: kun shes nyid du grub na / thams cad byed par nus pa yin zhing thams cad byed par nus pa yin na ni /
translated: If omniscience is established,🔽then one is able to perform all actions.🔽And if one is able to perform all actions,

original: thams cad byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: thams cad byed pa po yin la /
translated: then one is the agent of all.

original: thams cad byed pa po yin na yang thams cad shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad byed pa po yin na yang thams cad shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor lor 'gyur ro //
translated: If all are agents, then all are omniscient, and so the wheel turns.

original: sngar ni go rims kyi khyad par la nges pa la ltos pa kho nas phan tshun rten par brjod la /
analyzed: sngar ni go rims kyi khyad par la nges pa la ltos pa kho nas phan tshun rten par brjod la /
translated: Previously, we said that the order of the two is mutually dependent, only because of the need for certainty.

original: de lta na dngos po la ltos nas kyang gzhan gyis smras pa nyid las 'khor lor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na dngos po la ltos nas kyang gzhan gyis smras pa nyid las 'khor lor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, even in dependence on things, the wheel turns, just as the opponent has said.

original: thams cad kyi byed pa po gcig 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi byed pa po gcig 'dod pa yin te /
translated: One asserts that the one agent is all-knowing,

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pas ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pas ni /
translated: otherwise he would not be omniscient.

original: thams cad shes pa yod pas thams cad byed pa po'i bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
