analyzed: thams cad shes pa yod pas thams cad byed pa po'i bya ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he has taught that the one who knows all is the agent of all.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa thams cad shes pa ma yin pa yang bum pa la sogs pa'i byed pa por mthong na /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa thams cad shes pa ma yin pa yang bum pa la sogs pa'i byed pa por mthong na /
translated: Another refutation is this: If one sees that potters and so on, who are not omniscient, are agents of pots and so on,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dpe de nyid las ro la sogs pa la yang thams cad rig pa'i byed pa po ci ltar 'grub ste /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dpe de nyid las ro la sogs pa la yang thams cad rig pa'i byed pa po ci ltar 'grub ste /
translated: How could it be established that the agent of all cognitions is the nature of such things as the pot, and also such things as taste?

original: thams cad rig pa ma yin pa kho nar 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad rig pa ma yin pa kho nar 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is established that it is not the agent of all cognitions.

original: gal te 'di 'dra ba'i khyad par dang 'gal ba ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad la rnyed par sla ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'dra ba'i khyad par dang 'gal ba ni rjes su dpag pa thams cad la rnyed par sla ba yin nam /
translated: If it is easy to find a contradiction with such a distinction in all inferences,

original: byed pa po thams cad rig pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so zhes kyang mi brjod pas /
analyzed: byed pa po thams cad rig pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so zhes kyang mi brjod pas /
translated: it is not said that all agents must be the agent of all cognitions.

original: gang gis khyad par dang 'gal bar dogs par 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gang gis khyad par dang 'gal bar dogs par 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you think, “By what is there a fear of contradicting a distinction?”

original: de lta zhe na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta zhe na zhes smos so //
translated: The response is, “If that is so . . . .”

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis 'bras bu tsam la blo dang ldan pa ma khyab pa'i phyir dpe la mthong ba tsam gyis khyab par grub bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis 'bras bu tsam la blo dang ldan pa ma khyab pa'i phyir dpe la mthong ba tsam gyis khyab par grub bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Because the intelligent are not pervaded by mere effects, as will be explained, it is accepted that the pervasion is established by mere seeing in the example.

original: mthong ba de ni thams cad rig pa ma yin pa la yang yod do //
analyzed: mthong ba de ni thams cad rig pa ma yin pa la yang yod do //
translated: That seeing exists even for one who is not the agent of all cognitions.

original: des dpe'i rjes su 'brangs nas brtags pa ni /
analyzed: des dpe'i rjes su 'brangs nas brtags pa ni /
translated: The argument following the example:

original: gal te thams cad rig pa ma grub pa na de'i tshe gnyug ma'i dbang phyug grub pa nyams so //
analyzed: gal te thams cad rig pa ma grub pa na de'i tshe gnyug ma'i dbang phyug grub pa nyams so //
translated: If it is not established that everything is known, then the establishment of the intrinsic Almighty is undermined.

original: dpe la mthong ba tsam sgrub bam /
analyzed: dpe la mthong ba tsam sgrub bam /
translated: Is it established by mere perception in the example?

original: de lta ma yin 'bras bu la sogs @13b pa la thams cad shes pas khyab pa ma grub pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga ni blo dang ldan pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin 'bras bu la sogs @13b pa la thams cad shes pas khyab pa ma grub pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga ni blo dang ldan pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: Or is it not so? The non-establishment of the pervasion that everything is known by the effect, etc. is the same for the intelligent one.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug 'di byed pa po med pa nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni dogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug 'di byed pa po med pa nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni dogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, this Almighty is not to be suspected in space, etc. without an agent.

original: 'bras bu byed pa po mthong ba rnams la yang rdza mkhan la sogs pa yin pa po dge'o//
analyzed: 'bras bu byed pa po mthong ba rnams la yang rdza mkhan la sogs pa yin pa po dge'o//
translated: In the case of seeing the effect, the potter, etc. are the agent.

original: ri la sogs pa gzhan la yang las nyid nus pa'i phyir dbang phyug ni dgos pa med do //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa gzhan la yang las nyid nus pa'i phyir dbang phyug ni dgos pa med do //
translated: In the case of others, such as mountains, etc. the action itself is not possible, so Almighty is not necessary.

original: las kyi nus pa ni gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: las kyi nus pa ni gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te /
translated: The possibility of action must be accepted without doubt.

original: de lta ma yin na phan 'dogs byed nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni rang gi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phan 'dogs byed nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni rang gi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, he would not be the benefactor.

original: ci ltar byed pa po yin zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi thams cad dbang phyug gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar byed pa po yin zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi thams cad dbang phyug gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How could he be the agent?

original: gal te las kyi nus pa khas blangs pas ri la sogs pa la dbang phyug spong na de'i tshe rdza ma la yang rdza mkhan don med do //
analyzed: gal te las kyi nus pa khas blangs pas ri la sogs pa la dbang phyug spong na de'i tshe rdza ma la yang rdza mkhan don med do //
translated: If you deny Īśvara’s authorship of the pot, etc. on the grounds that you do not perceive his creative power, then the potter would be useless in the creation of the pot, etc.

original: de la ma mthong ba zhes bya bas ni nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la ma mthong ba zhes bya bas ni nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that you do not perceive his power in the creation of the mountain, etc.,

original: de ni ma yin te 'bras bu de lta bu la ni byed pa po'i nus pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir na spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te 'bras bu de lta bu la ni byed pa po'i nus pa mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir na spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because the creative power of the agent is established by direct perception in the creation of such effects as the pot, etc., and therefore it cannot be denied.

original: ri la sogs pa la ni de ltar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa la ni de ltar ma mthong ngo //
translated: But you do not perceive such power in the creation of the mountain, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, we infer that Īśvara is the creator of the world.

original: 'di la sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa /
analyzed: 'di la sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa /
translated: We have already explained that the power of the proof

original: phyis sems par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: phyis sems par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: is to be considered later.

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i nyes pa 'di ni zhar las byung ba yin te ;
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i nyes pa 'di ni zhar las byung ba yin te ;
translated: This fault of the doctrine is a digression,

original: 'di yang bstan bcos su ni dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang bstan bcos su ni dpyad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is to be examined in the treatise.

original: gzhan bum pa la sogs pa la dbang phyug don med par brjod par mi bzod nas /
analyzed: gzhan bum pa la sogs pa la dbang phyug don med par brjod par mi bzod nas /
translated: But the opponent cannot tolerate the statement that God is purposeless with respect to other things, such as pots,

original: gal te shes kyang bzhes smras so //
analyzed: gal te shes kyang bzhes smras so //
translated: and so he says, “Even if he knows, he creates.

original: khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ” The refutation is, “Because there is no difference.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni shes kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni shes kyang ngo //
translated: ” “Just as” means “even if he knows.

original: gzhan gyi bsams pas bskul bar mi rigs pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsams pas bskul bar mi rigs pa nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: ” Anticipating the objection that it is not reasonable to impel others, he says,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But if he impels.

original: kun du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ” “All” means

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa 'bras bu la mkhas pa gang yin pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa 'bras bu la mkhas pa gang yin pa'i yang ngo //
translated: all those who are skilled in the effects of their actions, such as potters.🔽“How could he be known as all-knowing by creating everything as an impeller?

original: bskul ba'i sgo nas thams cad byed pa po nyid kyis bdag thams cad shes pa nyid du ci 'grub bya ba'i snyam pa'i 'bras bu'i blos /
analyzed: bskul ba'i sgo nas thams cad byed pa po nyid kyis bdag thams cad shes pa nyid du ci 'grub bya ba'i snyam pa'i 'bras bu'i blos /
translated: ” The thought of the effect is, “How could he be known as all-knowing by creating everything as an impeller?

original: don med kyang skul bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don med kyang skul bar byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ” The meaning is that he impels even though it is purposeless.

original: lan du de ni de ltar gang gis shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de ni de ltar gang gis shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: “By whom is that known?”

original: rang gi tshig tu brjod pa tsam mo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig tu brjod pa tsam mo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is mere talk.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover,

original: sun 'byin pa bzhin no //🔽'on te gang zhi rang nyid nges @14a * //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa bzhin no // 'on te gang zhi rang nyid nges @14a * //
translated: like a refutation.

original: par brtags nas 'jug pa de'o //
analyzed: par brtags nas 'jug pa de'o //
translated: But if it is that which engages after examining itself,

original: blo yang dbang phyug gi mthu las de 'dra bar gyur pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: blo yang dbang phyug gi mthu las de 'dra bar gyur pa yin no snyam na /
translated: then the mind is like that due to the power of God.

original: kun gyi blo nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: kun gyi blo nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: The reply is: “The mind of all.”

original: rdza mkhan mkhas par mthong ba ni dgag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdza mkhan mkhas par mthong ba ni dgag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The seeing of a skilled potter is not to be refuted.

original: 'on kyang de'i dbang phyug nyid las yin no zhes gzhan bskul yang slar gso bar byed de snga ma bzhin tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i dbang phyug nyid las yin no zhes gzhan bskul yang slar gso bar byed de snga ma bzhin tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: But even if one imputes another, that it is from God, it is still a restatement, and it is not a valid means of knowledge, just as before.

original: 'on te re zhig rdza mkhan la lhan cig skyes pa'i mngon shes ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te re zhig rdza mkhan la lhan cig skyes pa'i mngon shes ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is that a potter does not have innate superknowledge,

original: byis pa la sogs pa'i tshe yang yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa la sogs pa'i tshe yang yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that he would have it even in childhood and so on.

original: des na de'i res 'ga' ba de yang ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gi nus pa las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de'i res 'ga' ba de yang ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gi nus pa las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, that which is sometimes seen is due to the potency of that which is not seen.

original: de nyid dbang phyug yin no snyam na /🔽rgyu ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid dbang phyug yin no snyam na / rgyu ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, that is God.🔽The meaning of “the cause” is that which is the agent.🔽The meaning of “the expert” is that which is the agent.

original: byed mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don byed pa po nyid gang yin pa de ni 'jim pa dang / dbyig pa dang 'khor lo la sogs pa de ltar tshogs pa yin no zhes rgan po rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa las yin no //
analyzed: byed mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don byed pa po nyid gang yin pa de ni 'jim pa dang / dbyig pa dang 'khor lo la sogs pa de ltar tshogs pa yin no zhes rgan po rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa las yin no //
translated: The elders have taught that the collection of clay, stick, wheel, etc. is the cause of the pot.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bstan pa med kyang bya ba'i rim pa mthong ba las de 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bstan pa med kyang bya ba'i rim pa mthong ba las de 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that even without being taught, one can apprehend the agent from seeing the sequence of the action.

original: nye bar ston pa po nyid la nye bar bstan pa ga las yin zhes na /
analyzed: nye bar ston pa po nyid la nye bar bstan pa ga las yin zhes na /
translated: How can the agent be taught by the elders?

original: de las gzhan pa'i nye bar ston pa'i thad las so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nye bar ston pa'i thad las so //
translated: It is taught by the elders who are other than the agent.

original: de bzhin thog ma med pa'i phyir snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dbang phyug rtag pas ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin thog ma med pa'i phyir snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dbang phyug rtag pas ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, since there is no beginning, the later stages arise from the earlier stages, and since they are completely perfected, what is the use of a permanent Almighty?

original: des na 'jug pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'jug pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus, all engagement is like that is the conclusion.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni rang bsdad cing bsdad cing 'dug pa yin la /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni rang bsdad cing bsdad cing 'dug pa yin la /
translated: Potters, etc. are engaged in their work while sitting down.

original: ste'u la sogs pa yang bzo bya bar 'dod pas yin zhing /
analyzed: ste'u la sogs pa yang bzo bya bar 'dod pas yin zhing /
translated: Axles, etc. are desired to be made by those who wish to make them.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa ni las kyi mthu las yin no ;
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa ni las kyi mthu las yin no ;
translated: Atoms, etc. are due to the power of karma.

original: ; de bzhin du don bya ba byed pa la sogs pa yang dbang phyug gis bskul ba las ma yin no zhes bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ; de bzhin du don bya ba byed pa la sogs pa yang dbang phyug gis bskul ba las ma yin no zhes bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, the performance of benefits, etc. are not due to the instigation of Almighty. This should be understood as explained.

original: dbang phyug thams cad kyi byed pa po ma yin mod /
analyzed: dbang phyug thams cad kyi byed pa po ma yin mod /
translated: Almighty is not the creator of all,

original: gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: but Primordial Matter, etc. are.

original: de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says,

original: rig pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of that very knowledge.

original: gtso bo yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du skyes bu gdod ma nas yod pa dang / dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa lung las ji ltar brtags pa rnams ni byed pa por nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtso bo yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du skyes bu gdod ma nas yod pa dang / dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa lung las ji ltar brtags pa rnams ni byed pa por nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the person is not ascertained to be the agent, because he is not born with the nature of the three qualities, and because of the scriptures such as the Haryakarnâ Sûtra.🔽Although the three reasons stated explicitly have been refuted, still, the difference in shape is mentioned again.🔽The word “also” refers to the fact that it is endowed with the nature of the three qualities.

original: dngos su brjod pa'i gtan tshigs gsum sun phyung zin kyang da yang dbyibs kyi khyad par la @14b brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos su brjod pa'i gtan tshigs gsum sun phyung zin kyang da yang dbyibs kyi khyad par la @14b brjod pa ni /
translated: In the root text, the word “shape” is used because the word “sound” is a secondary meaning based on shape.🔽Since it is proper to take the mere property as the reason,🔽the word “shape” is used.🔽The meaning is that the person is not ascertained to be the agent, because he is not born with the nature of the three qualities, and because of the scriptures such as the Haryakarnâ Sûtra.🔽Although the three reasons stated explicitly have been refuted, still, the difference in shape is mentioned again.

original: dbyig dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbyig dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “also” refers to the fact that it is endowed with the nature of the three qualities.🔽In the root text, the word “shape” is used because the word “sound” is a secondary meaning based on shape.🔽Since it is proper to take the mere property as the reason,

original: rtsa bar dbyibs kyi khyad par ldan pa'i sgra byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa bar dbyibs kyi khyad par ldan pa'i sgra byas pa'i phyir /
translated: the word “shape” is used.🔽The meaning is that the person is not ascertained to be the agent, because he is not born with the nature of the three qualities, and because of the scriptures such as the Haryakarnâ Sûtra.🔽Although the three reasons stated explicitly have been refuted, still, the difference in shape is mentioned again.🔽The word “also” refers to the fact that it is endowed with the nature of the three qualities.🔽In the root text, the word “shape” is used because the word “sound” is a secondary meaning based on shape.

original: chos tsam gtan tshigs su nges par gzung du 'os pas na /
analyzed: chos tsam gtan tshigs su nges par gzung du 'os pas na /
translated: Since it is proper to take the mere property as the reason,

original: dbyibs dang ldan pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: dbyibs dang ldan pa zhes smos so //
translated: the word “shape” is used.🔽The meaning is that the person is not ascertained to be the agent, because he is not born with the nature of the three qualities, and because of the scriptures such as the Haryakarnâ Sûtra.

original: de yin dang gang dang gang dbyibs yin pa'am /
analyzed: de yin dang gang dang gang dbyibs yin pa'am /
translated: Although the three reasons stated explicitly have been refuted, still, the difference in shape is mentioned again.🔽The word “also” refers to the fact that it is endowed with the nature of the three qualities.🔽In the root text, the word “shape”

original: dbyibs dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dang de ni blo dang ldan pas sngon du songs ba yin te zhes gnyi ga yang skyes bu'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bur 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs dang ldan pa gang yin pa de dang de ni blo dang ldan pas sngon du songs ba yin te zhes gnyi ga yang skyes bu'i 'bras bu'i 'bras bur 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus both are asserted to be the effect of a person.

original: 'bras bu yin yang gtan tshigs ma yin par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin yang gtan tshigs ma yin par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be that it is an effect but not a reason?

original: dbyibs thams cad ces gsungs so //🔽bar 'dir dbang phyug du smra ba la glag thod pa'i grangs can sun dbyung ba'i phyir nye bar dgod pa ni /
analyzed: dbyibs thams cad ces gsungs so // bar 'dir dbang phyug du smra ba la glag thod pa'i grangs can sun dbyung ba'i phyir nye bar dgod pa ni /
translated: It is said that all shapes are preceded by an intelligent agent.🔽Here, in order to refute the Sāṃkhya who propounds Īśvara, it is stated:

original: de la ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is the reason that some things are created by an intelligent agent,🔽and some things are not created by an intelligent agent?

original: sems pa'i rgyu dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems pa can gyi rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa'i rgyu dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems pa can gyi rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not related to the cause of volition, meaning it does not possess a cause that is volitional.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sems pa ma yin pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sems pa ma yin pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus means it possesses a cause that is not volition.

original: gal te gcig sems pa med pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin pas bum pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yin no zhes bya ba go ga las she na /
analyzed: gal te gcig sems pa med pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa yin pas bum pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yin no zhes bya ba go ga las she na /
translated: If one thing possesses a cause that is not volition, how can it be understood that a pot and so on are also like that?

original: gtso bo zhes bya bas zhes smos so //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya bas zhes smos so //
translated: The word primarily is added.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba mtha' dag sems pa med pa'i rang bzhin can gtso bos bcug pa yin pa de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba mtha' dag sems pa med pa'i rang bzhin can gtso bos bcug pa yin pa de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since the entire manifest world is the creation of the unconscious, primary nature, therefore, pots, etc. are also like that.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa rdza mkhan la sogs pas byed par ma dmigs sam /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa rdza mkhan la sogs pas byed par ma dmigs sam /
translated: If you think that pots, etc. are not perceived to be created by potters, etc.

original: des de skad ci ste brjod snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: des de skad ci ste brjod snyam du dogs na /
translated: Why does he say that?

original: ji ltar shing las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar shing las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, just as from a tree.

original: 'di ni shing sems pa med pa'i rgyu can du bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni shing sems pa med pa'i rgyu can du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the tree is the cause of the unconscious.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa nyid du ston pa ni de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang mtshungs pa nyid du ston pa ni de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The similarity of pots, etc. is shown by in the same way, etc.

original: 'jim gong la yang bum pa'i rang pa'i rang bzhin du bum pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim gong la yang bum pa'i rang pa'i rang bzhin du bum pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: Since the nature of the pot is in the lump of clay, the pot itself is the cause of the pot.

original: 'o na rdza mkhan ci dgos snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rdza mkhan ci dgos snyam na /
translated: If you think, What is the use of the potter?

original: rdza mkhan dag la sogs pa ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: rdza mkhan dag la sogs pa ni zhes smras so //
translated: It is said, potters, etc.

original: dper na rang gi bu lon khyer mkhan la gtad pa'i rdzas nor bdag gis blang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dper na rang gi bu lon khyer mkhan la gtad pa'i rdzas nor bdag gis blang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: For example, a man who has given a deposit to a debtor takes back the deposit.

original: dbang po'i tshogs tsam gyi nye bar mkho ba yin bde bzhin du gnas pa'i bum pa nyid mngon par gsal ba la yang rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang nye bar mkho ba kho na'o //🔽de bzhin du lus dang kha dog dbyibs dag ni zhes bya ba yang nye bar @15a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs tsam gyi nye bar mkho ba yin bde bzhin du gnas pa'i bum pa nyid mngon par gsal ba la yang rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang nye bar mkho ba kho na'o // de bzhin du lus dang kha dog dbyibs dag ni zhes bya ba yang nye bar @15a * //
translated: In the same way, the potter, etc. are only useful for the manifestation of the pot, etc. which are already existing.

original: mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: In the same way, the body and color-shape, etc. are only useful for the manifestation of the consciousness, etc.🔽The word “etc.”

original: blo la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma lus pa yang yin no //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma lus pa yang yin no //
translated: refers to the mind, etc.🔽From a cause similar to itself,

original: skyed byed de dang 'dra ba las zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang 'dra ba kho na las so //
analyzed: skyed byed de dang 'dra ba las zhes bya ba ni rgyu de dang 'dra ba kho na las so //
translated: i.e., from a cause which is similar to the effect.

original: rnam par dpyad par bya ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad par bya ba brjod pa ni /
translated: The author states the problem:

original: rdza mkhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gnas pa nyid mngon par gsal ba yin no snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gnas pa nyid mngon par gsal ba yin no snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: The potter, etc.🔽are only useful for the manifestation of the pot, etc. which are already existing.

original: gal te gnas pa nyid mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci yod de /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa nyid mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci yod de /
translated: What is the certainty that the manifestation is of an existing thing?

original: mi mkhas pa gal te snga na med pa skyed par byed na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa gal te snga na med pa skyed par byed na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If the unwise one thinks, “What is the fault if one generates that which did not exist previously?”

original: shing gis bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: shing gis bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He says, “The seed of a tree, etc.”

original: sa bon rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sa bon la nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i shing gi dbyibs de dang rigs mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sa bon la nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i shing gi dbyibs de dang rigs mi mthun pa'o //
translated: “The seed of a different type” means that which is not the same type as the shape of the tree that is present as the nature of the potential of the seed.

original: gal te skyes bus snga na med pa skyed par byed na de'i tshe wa da'i sa bon gyis kyang shing sha ba'i dbyibs ci ste mi skyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te skyes bus snga na med pa skyed par byed na de'i tshe wa da'i sa bon gyis kyang shing sha ba'i dbyibs ci ste mi skyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If a person generates that which did not exist previously, then why does the seed of a mango tree not generate the shape of a śirīṣa tree? This is the meaning.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug tu smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug tu smra ba'i'o //
translated: “If” refers to the Sāṃkhya.

original: dbyibs zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i cha byad do //
analyzed: dbyibs zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i cha byad do //
translated: “Shape” refers to the form of a pot.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi'o //
translated: “No” refers to the Sāṃkhya.

original: de 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because it is just like that” means because it is just the nature of a pot.

original: de nyid yid smras pa ni 'jim gong gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid yid smras pa ni 'jim gong gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.

original: dper na zhes bya ba 'di ma grub par dogs pa ni de yang ci ltar zhes bya ba ste nus pa yod do zhes bya ba de'o //🔽yod pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //🔽rgyu'i sa bon med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi rgyu shing nus pa'i rang bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba 'di ma grub par dogs pa ni de yang ci ltar zhes bya ba ste nus pa yod do zhes bya ba de'o // yod pa de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o // rgyu'i sa bon med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi rgyu shing nus pa'i rang bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.

original: de la tshig le'ur byas pa dang po rnam par 'grel pa ni sa bon gyi rgyu'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽de ni zhes bya ba ni sa bon no //
analyzed: de la tshig le'ur byas pa dang po rnam par 'grel pa ni sa bon gyi rgyu'i zhes bya ba'o // de ni zhes bya ba ni sa bon no //
translated: The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.

original: gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni /🔽dbang phyug ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni / dbang phyug ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.

original: dbyibs kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes 'grel to //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes 'grel to //
translated: The word “just” in the verse means that the clay pot is not produced from the lump of clay.🔽The word “just” in

original: 'di la bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa nyid shes byed du dran par byed pa ni rigs mi mthun pa'i shing gi rgyu'i sa bon gang yin pa de las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa nyid shes byed du dran par byed pa ni rigs mi mthun pa'i shing gi rgyu'i sa bon gang yin pa de las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The response that has already been stated should be recalled as the reason here: because it does not arise from a seed that is a cause of a tree of a different type.

original: 'di nyid sgrub pa ni dbang phyug de'i rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'o //🔽rdza mkhan gyi zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la brten nas so //🔽'jim gong las zhes bya ba ni nye bar len par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'di nyid sgrub pa ni dbang phyug de'i rgyu yin na zhes bya ba'o // rdza mkhan gyi zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la brten nas so // 'jim gong las zhes bya ba ni nye bar len par 'gyur bas so //
translated: This very [response] is the proof: if that is the cause of that,🔽[the response] is: because it arises from a lump of clay that is a cause of a pot,🔽and because it arises from a lump of clay that is a cause of a pot.

original: rdza mkhan la yang bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la yang bum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of a pot, etc. is this:

original: yang na rdza mkhan bum pa ma yin @15b mod /
analyzed: yang na rdza mkhan bum pa ma yin @15b mod /
translated: Even though a potter is not a pot,

original: de ltar na yang bum pa de la nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs las bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang bum pa de la nus pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs las bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs byung ba yin te /
translated: nevertheless, a pot arises from the shape of a pot, etc. that exists as a nature with the capacity [to produce a pot] in that [potter].

original: rgyu'i gcig de la ni nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu yod pa yin no zhes bya bas ni kho bo cag gi phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i gcig de la ni nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu yod pa yin no zhes bya bas ni kho bo cag gi phyogs yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause that is one does have an effect that is of the nature of a potency.

original: mjug sdud pas ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pas ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is stated by “Therefore.

original: de la byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni med pa'i skyed pa byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la byed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni med pa'i skyed pa byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ” There is no agent whatsoever means that there is no agent that produces what does not exist.🔽One who desires to enjoy it means one who desires to enjoy the pot, etc.,

original: de'i longs spyod par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa skyes bu'i longs spyod par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa skyes bu'i longs spyod par 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that is, a person such as a potter.

original: 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of engagement means because of activity.

original: dbang phyug du smra ba dag gi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug du smra ba dag gi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The anticipation of the objection of the theists is stated by “Or, the person.

original: 'on te skyes bu'i zhes bya ste blo dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can tha snyad pa'i skyes bu dag go //
analyzed: 'on te skyes bu'i zhes bya ste blo dang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can tha snyad pa'i skyes bu dag go //
translated: ” The person is the nature of intelligence, the sense faculties, etc., and is conventional.

original: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba gcig med na de'i tshe dbyibs dang mdog la sogs pa sus bstan ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral ba gcig med na de'i tshe dbyibs dang mdog la sogs pa sus bstan ces sbyar ro //
translated: If there were no one free from attachment and so on, then who would have revealed the shape, color, and so on?

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: gang zhig dbyibs dang mdog la sogs pa ci 'dra ba 'dod pa de la gtso bos de bstan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig dbyibs dang mdog la sogs pa ci 'dra ba 'dod pa de la gtso bos de bstan par bya ba yin la /
translated: The Lord would have revealed to someone who desired a certain shape, color, and so on.

original: 'dod pa de yang 'ga' zhig gis so sor nges pa la bstan pas na nye bar gnas kyang goms pa las de kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa de yang 'ga' zhig gis so sor nges pa la bstan pas na nye bar gnas kyang goms pa las de kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: That desire would be revealed to someone in particular, and it would be accomplished by training.

original: ma bstan na ni goms pa med pa'i phyir gtso bos ci zhig bstan ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma bstan na ni goms pa med pa'i phyir gtso bos ci zhig bstan ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it were not revealed, then what would the Lord have revealed, since there would be no training?

original: grangs can gyi bsam pa ni dbang phyug gis bstan pa las so sor nges pa las 'dod pa ma yin mod goms pa las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: grangs can gyi bsam pa ni dbang phyug gis bstan pa las so sor nges pa las 'dod pa ma yin mod goms pa las gyur pa yin te /
translated: The Sāṃkhya idea is that the desire is not revealed by Īśvara to someone in particular, but it arises from training.

original: dper na ltad mo pa rnams kyi 'dod pa thog ma med pa'i nye bar bstan pa las /
analyzed: dper na ltad mo pa rnams kyi 'dod pa thog ma med pa'i nye bar bstan pa las /
translated: For example, the desire of spectators arises from the beginningless revelation of a spectacle.

original: de ltar sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams kyis gar ni dga' bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / res 'ga' res 'ga' mthong ba las ni yang dang yang du blta 'dod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'khor ba'i skyes bu rnams kyi yang blta 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don du blo la sogs pa rnam par /'gyur ba'i khyad par de dang de dag ston par byed
analyzed: de ltar sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams kyis gar ni dga' bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba dang / res 'ga' res 'ga' mthong ba las ni yang dang yang du blta 'dod par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'khor ba'i skyes bu rnams kyi yang blta 'dod pa bzlog pa'i don du blo la sogs pa rnam par /'gyur ba'i khyad par de dang de dag ston par byed
translated: The word also is for the purpose of including the other two moods.

original: pa yin no / zhes bya ba'o //🔽skyes bu rnams kyis 'dod pa de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: pa yin no / zhes bya ba'o // skyes bu rnams kyis 'dod pa de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: The word indeed is for emphasis.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.

original: de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis gtso bo sems dpa' med pa go ci ltar 'jug snyam na /🔽mi shes phyir na'o me ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis gtso bo sems dpa' med pa go ci ltar 'jug snyam na / mi shes phyir na'o me ni zhes smras so //
translated: The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.

original: bshad zin pa'i sems pa med pa rgyu yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i sems pa med pa rgyu yin pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.

original: de rgyu zhes @16a * //
analyzed: de rgyu zhes @16a * //
translated: The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.

original: bya ba ni don rnams kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni don rnams kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word indeed is for the purpose of including the other two moods.🔽The word thus is for the purpose of including the other two moods.

original: 'on te gcig gi rgyu sems pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par dmigs mod /
analyzed: 'on te gcig gi rgyu sems pa'i rang bzhin ma yin par dmigs mod /
translated: But if the cause of one is not observed to be the nature of consciousness,

original: thams cad kyang de kho na ltar yin no zhes bya ba go ga las snyam na /
analyzed: thams cad kyang de kho na ltar yin no zhes bya ba go ga las snyam na /
translated: how can it be understood that all are like that?

original: don rnams rgyu ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: don rnams rgyu ni zhes smras so //
translated: The meaning of the statement is this:

original: sems pa med pa'i rgyu ni mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems pa med pa'i rgyu ni mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause of things is not illogical.

original: gal te thams cad kyi rgyu rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi rgyu rtogs pa dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: If the cause of everything is consciousness,

original: de'i tshe ra la sogs ba'i ril ma la sogs pa zlum por byas pa la dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe ra la sogs ba'i ril ma la sogs pa zlum por byas pa la dgos pa ci yod /
translated: then what is the purpose of making a lump of clay, etc.🔽round, etc., if it is not for the sake of consciousness?

original: dgos pa med par ni rtogs pa med pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med par ni rtogs pa med pa dang ldan pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not for the sake of consciousness does not occur.

original: des na rgyu ni sems pa kho nar 'thad do //
analyzed: des na rgyu ni sems pa kho nar 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the cause is only consciousness.

original: de ltar grangs can gyi lugs la brten nas dbang phyug bkag na grangs can rang gi lugs bzang po yin par rlom na de ltar na gtso bo nyid rgyur 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: de ltar grangs can gyi lugs la brten nas dbang phyug bkag na grangs can rang gi lugs bzang po yin par rlom na de ltar na gtso bo nyid rgyur 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: If you refute God on the basis of the Sāṃkhya system, and if you think that the Sāṃkhya system is good, then the primary nature itself would be the cause.

original: gtso bo sems pa med kyang rgyu yin pa ni mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gtso bo sems pa med kyang rgyu yin pa ni mi 'thad do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show that it is illogical for the primary nature, which is not conscious, to be the cause.

original: de la 'di skad brjod de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad brjod de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te rjes 'gro zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bar khas len zhes bya ba'i don /
analyzed: gal te rjes 'gro zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro bar khas len zhes bya ba'i don /
translated: If you accept that the effect is subsequent to the cause, then the meaning is that the effect is subsequent to the cause.

original: de skabs kyis de'i rang bzhin can gyi rgyu grub par bya pa'i don du zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de skabs kyis de'i rang bzhin can gyi rgyu grub par bya pa'i don du zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the meaning is that the cause that has the nature of that effect is established.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rnams dngos po yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rnams dngos po yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since pleasure and so on are things,

original: de nyid de'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: de nyid de'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid rgyur ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: why do you not accept that the nature of that thing is the cause of that effect?

original: skyes bu rnams kyang sems pa can dang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir sems pa'i rang bzhin nam dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu yang de dag la ci mi 'dod /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyang sems pa can dang dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir sems pa'i rang bzhin nam dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu yang de dag la ci mi 'dod /
translated: Since men are sentient beings and things, why do you not accept that the nature of consciousness or the nature of a thing is the cause of them?

original: de ltar gtso bo'i rgyur khas blangs nas ha cang thal ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo'i rgyur khas blangs nas ha cang thal ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having accepted that the primal substance is the cause, you are guilty of the absurd position of solipsism.

original: da ni de'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes ston pa ni yang dag par na zhes smras so //
analyzed: da ni de'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes ston pa ni yang dag par na zhes smras so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it is not the cause, he says, in reality.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa thams cad gtso bo der 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa thams cad gtso bo der 'dus pa'o //
translated: All shapes and so on are included in that primal substance.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nus kun rang bzhin can gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nus kun rang bzhin can gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word all is used to indicate the nature of the cause.

original: 'di ni rtag ba nyid la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag ba nyid la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin no //
translated: This is merely an illustration of permanence, etc.

original: lan du mthong min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan du mthong min zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is not perceived, etc.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i gtso bo de ni de 'dra ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba tshad mas 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i gtso bo de ni de 'dra ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba tshad mas 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable to say that primordial matter, which is beyond the senses, is the cause of that.

original: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The word that refers to the nature of permanence, etc.

original: de la re zhig rtag pa ma yin zhes ston pa ni 'bras bu 'bras bu gzhan las te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig rtag pa ma yin zhes ston pa ni 'bras bu 'bras bu gzhan las te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show that primordial matter is not permanent, he says the effect of an effect, etc.

original: gang 'bras bu yin pa de ni 'bras bu gzhan sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: gang 'bras bu yin pa de ni 'bras bu gzhan sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: That which is an effect has another effect preceding it,

original: dper na 'bras bu gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu gzhan bzhin no //
translated: like another effect.

original: 'di @16b thams cad kyang 'bras bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di @16b thams cad kyang 'bras bu nyid yin no //
translated: All of this is an effect.

original: des na gtso bo rtag pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gtso bo rtag pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, primordial matter is not permanent.

original: rgyu med pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The word cause is used to indicate the nature of the cause.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu med pa'i rgyu ma dmigs pa des na dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brangs ba nyid kyis gtso bo rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu med pa'i rgyu ma dmigs pa des na dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brangs ba nyid kyis gtso bo rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin no ;
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of a cause that is causeless, therefore, by following the nature of the object, the primal substance is posited as the cause.

original: / gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i tshul gyis 'di grub pa yin no zhes bstan ba'i phyir rtog pa'i sgra byas so //
analyzed: / gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i tshul gyis 'di grub pa yin no zhes bstan ba'i phyir rtog pa'i sgra byas so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is established by the method of proof that is well known to others, the word “only” is used.

original: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brangs pa kho nas rgyu med pa'i gtso bo sa rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog par dogs pa ni 'on te tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brangs pa kho nas rgyu med pa'i gtso bo sa rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog par dogs pa ni 'on te tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that the primal substance is posited as the cause only by following the nature of the object is expressed in the words, “But if they are different.”

original: gang gis de skad brjod pa de ltar mthong bas yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de skad brjod pa de ltar mthong bas yod dam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is it seen in that way by which it is said to be so?”

original: bum pa kham phor la sogs pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: bum pa kham phor la sogs pa zhes smras so //
translated: it is said, “The pot, the dish, and so on.”

original: lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, “That also is not so.”

original: snying stobs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa rnams so //
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa rnams so //
translated: The words “sattva and so on” refer to sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: skyes bu rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag rnams so //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams zhes bya ba ni bdag rnams so //
translated: “Persons” means selves.

original: rnam pa ci yang rung bar gzhung gzugs par 'dod nas 'o na zhes smras so //
analyzed: rnam pa ci yang rung bar gzhung gzugs par 'dod nas 'o na zhes smras so //
translated: Having wished to compose a treatise in some way, he says, “Well then . . . ”

original: snying stobs la sogs pa dang skyes bu rnams dang ri la sogs pa rnams dngos kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu kho nar yod pa yin la /
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa dang skyes bu rnams dang ri la sogs pa rnams dngos kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu kho nar yod pa yin la /
translated: Since the nature of things is the cause of the existence of sattva, etc., and of the existence of mountains, etc., it is the nature of things alone that exists.

original: de nyid ni dbang phyug du 'dod do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dbang phyug du 'dod do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: It is just that which is asserted to be God.

original: yon tan gsum sogs rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rnag bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gsum sogs rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rnag bzhin nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The nature of sattva, etc.” means the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: / ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir ma grub ce na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: dngos po nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not the case that it is the cause of the existence of sattva, etc., and of the existence of mountains, etc.

original: dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “A thing is a thing” and so on has been explained.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: 'ji ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ji ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “From the nature of clay, etc.”

original: 'ji ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'ji ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad sdud pa'o //
translated: The phrase such things as clay includes all entities.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras ba'o //
translated: The phrase in that case indicates the opponent's position.

original: 'bras bu de dang de la ltos nas rgyu'i rang bzhin de dang der rjes su 'jug pa na yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du 'dod ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang de la ltos nas rgyu'i rang bzhin de dang der rjes su 'jug pa na yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du 'dod ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase in that case, the nature of the cause is determined by the effect means that the nature of the cause is determined by the effect in the sense that the cause is said to have the nature of the three qualities in dependence upon this or that effect.

original: lan du de ni med de zhes smras so //
analyzed: lan du de ni med de zhes smras so //
translated: The response is No, because . . .

original: 'bras bu ngo bos zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin gyi rnam pa kun gyis min te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bos zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin gyi rnam pa kun gyis min te /
translated: The phrase the nature of the effect means that the nature of the effect is determined by the existence or nonexistence of the cause, but not by all of its aspects.

original: rnam pa dang nus pa la sogs bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang nus pa la sogs bas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not determined by its aspects, its potentiality, etc.

original: 'di ni mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na'o zhes ston ba ni me sogs gzhan du gyur ba las gzhan @17a * //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na'o zhes ston ba ni me sogs gzhan du gyur ba las gzhan @17a * //
translated: The phrase this is established by perception shows that this is established by perception. The phrase from the transformation of fire, etc.

original: du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to the transformation of the cause.

original: bshad ba ni gang zhig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ba ni gang zhig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation is that which is produced from this . . .

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni 'bras bu ste de'i rgyu ni de yin no //🔽rgyu gang gis rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni gang gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni 'bras bu ste de'i rgyu ni de yin no // rgyu gang gis rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ni gang gis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: That which is the effect is the “that” .🔽That which is the cause of that is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rnam pa dang nus pa'i rjes su 'jug ba'i bdag nyid de'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de lta yin na nyes ba ci yod snyam na /🔽de lta yin dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rnam pa dang nus pa'i rjes su 'jug ba'i bdag nyid de'i 'bras bu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de lta yin na nyes ba ci yod snyam na / de lta yin dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.🔽That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pas 'bras bu nyid yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pas 'bras bu nyid yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes 'brel lo //
translated: That which is the cause of the effect is the cause of that.

original: gang zhig mi 'gyur zhe na /🔽me las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /🔽de la 'dra ba med pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig mi 'gyur zhe na /🔽me las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /🔽de la 'dra ba med pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: That which is the cause of

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent's response is But... and so on.

original: me la sogs pa der yang ngo //
analyzed: me la sogs pa der yang ngo //
translated: The response is Fire and so on...

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'i khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni me dang du ba la sogs pa nyid la 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'i khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni me dang du ba la sogs pa nyid la 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The response is If... and so on. The response is Because there is no pervasion. The reason is that error is seen in fire and smoke and so on.

original: gang gi 'khrul ba de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'khrul ba de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent's response is But... and so on.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is In that case...

original: des na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa med par thal ba'o //
analyzed: des na thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa med par thal ba'o //
translated: The response is Therefore... and so on. The response is Because there would be an infinite regress. The response is Because there would be no basis.

original: ci ste gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: ci ste gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rtag go zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: If it is argued, It is permanent because it is an object of knowledge,

original: glog la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa tshad mas mthong ba'i phyir ma nges par rnam par gnas pa med par ci ltar thal zhe na /
analyzed: glog la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa tshad mas mthong ba'i phyir ma nges par rnam par gnas pa med par ci ltar thal zhe na /
translated: how can it be said that there would be no basis because of the uncertainty of error, since error in lightning and so on is seen by valid cognition?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: skabs su bab pa la yang tshad mas gnod pa spang bar dga' ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la yang tshad mas gnod pa spang bar dga' ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is pleasing to refute the harm of valid cognition in the present context.

original: / de ltar gtso bo'i rgyu yin par gsal bar sgrub pa na /
analyzed: / de ltar gtso bo'i rgyu yin par gsal bar sgrub pa na /
translated: Thus, when it is clearly established that the Lord is the principal cause,

original: grangs can la brten gzhan med pa'i phyir las rgyu nyid khas len pa'i dogs ba ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdu nas zlog par byed pa ni /
analyzed: grangs can la brten gzhan med pa'i phyir las rgyu nyid khas len pa'i dogs ba ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsdu nas zlog par byed pa ni /
translated: since there is no other recourse for the Sāṃkhya, he fears that he will have to accept that karma is the cause. Therefore, he gathers up his position and refutes it with “If you say that the world . . .”

original: de ni gang las grub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gang las grub ces bya ba'o //
translated: “From what is that established?”

original: 'o na khyed kyis kyang las las 'jig rten sna tshogs bsgrubs pa yin no zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed kyis kyang las las 'jig rten sna tshogs bsgrubs pa yin no zhes khas blang bar mi bya'o snyam na /
translated: “Well then, you also accept that the various worlds are established from karma.”

original: 'di ni re zhig bzhag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig bzhag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: “This is set aside for the time being.”

original: tshu rol mdzes pa la gcig pu ma gtogs pa'i rgol ba thams cad las smra ba ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir na bdag gcig pu las dri bar bya ba ma yin no //🔽de la rjes su 'gro ba tshol ba'am /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa la gcig pu ma gtogs pa'i rgol ba thams cad las smra ba ni thun mong yin pa'i phyir na bdag gcig pu las dri bar bya ba ma yin no // de la rjes su 'gro ba tshol ba'am /
translated: Since the assertion that the world is established from karma is common to all opponents except the proponents of intrinsic nature, the question is not to be asked of me alone.🔽In that regard, I do not seek to follow the Sāṃkhya,

original: @17b lung gi rjes su 'gro ba ni bdag la yang ring ba ma yin no //
analyzed: @17b lung gi rjes su 'gro ba ni bdag la yang ring ba ma yin no //
translated: nor do I follow scripture.

original: de las lhag par khas len na ni tshad ma'i stobs la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de las lhag par khas len na ni tshad ma'i stobs la ltos pa yin no //
translated: If you accept something beyond that, then you must rely on the power of valid knowledge.

original: de ni dpyad zin pa'i phyir 'di ni bzhag go //
analyzed: de ni dpyad zin pa'i phyir 'di ni bzhag go //
translated: Since this has already been analyzed, we will set it aside for now.

original: de ltar grangs can zhar las bsal nas rtsa ba dbang phyug du smra ba nyid sel ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar grangs can zhar las bsal nas rtsa ba dbang phyug du smra ba nyid sel ba ni /
translated: Having thus refuted the Sāṃkhya off-topic, he now refutes the very idea of Īśvara as the creator.

original: gzhan brjod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan brjod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, “Another says . . .”

original: ya rabs gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug las so //
analyzed: ya rabs gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug las so //
translated: “Another, the righteous” means one who is other than Īśvara.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: “If” is a refutation.

original: de med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la ma sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: de med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la ma sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa ste /
translated: “That does not exist” means that there is no fear of suffering from suffering.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yin kyang snyam du zhe bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yin kyang snyam du zhe bzhag pa'o //
translated: “Even though there is attachment and so on” is a hypothetical supposition.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med ce na bsgoms pa'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba la yang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa med ce na bsgoms pa'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: “But how can there be no suffering and fear of suffering even in those who are not free from attachment?” He says, “Through meditation.”

original: bdag med pa'i bsgoms pa rab kyis mthar thug par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i bsgoms pa rab kyis mthar thug par 'gyur /
translated: The culmination of the meditation on selflessness is the attainment of the path of seeing.

original: tsan dan dang ste'u mnyam pa la ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mes reg kyang gdung ba med na bsam pa tsam gyis lta ci smos des na 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: tsan dan dang ste'u mnyam pa la ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mes reg kyang gdung ba med na bsam pa tsam gyis lta ci smos des na 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa med do //
translated: If sandalwood and teak were equal, then even if they were touched by the fire of the hells, etc., they would not be burned, much less by mere thought. Therefore, one who is free from passion has no fear of suffering or the cause of suffering.

original: rtsed mo la sogs pa'i don du 'jug pa'i rnam par dpyod pa'i stobs kyis bsal to //
analyzed: rtsed mo la sogs pa'i don du 'jug pa'i rnam par dpyod pa'i stobs kyis bsal to //
translated: It is refuted by the power of analysis, which is engaged for the sake of play, etc.

original: de ni de ltar nyid 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa med bar rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de khyad par can du 'phags par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni de ltar nyid 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa med bar rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis de khyad par can du 'phags par gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it is just so by nature, that it becomes superior without cultivation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di de khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa 'di de'i rang bzhin yin na 'gro'i rang bzhin du yang 'gyur bas dbang phyug gis ci bya /
analyzed: 'di de khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa 'di de'i rang bzhin yin na 'gro'i rang bzhin du yang 'gyur bas dbang phyug gis ci bya /
translated: If this has the nature of being superior, then it would also have the nature of being inferior. What would God do?

original: pha rol pos smras pa /
analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: rang bzhin 'di ni dbang phyug de gcig pu'i yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di ni dbang phyug de gcig pu'i yin no zhe na /
translated: This nature belongs only to that God.

original: lan du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is “If, etc.”

original: 'di nyid rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas sun phyung ba'i gzhan yang zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas sun phyung ba'i gzhan yang zhes gsungs so /
translated: This very same [position] is refuted in another way.

original: tha mal pa'i dbang phyug khyad par can gyis rjes su gzung bas dbang phyug thob pa 'di ni re zhig mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i dbang phyug khyad par can gyis rjes su gzung bas dbang phyug thob pa 'di ni re zhig mthong ba yin no //
translated: The attainment of Īśvara by being favored by an ordinary Īśvara is seen.

original: de yang de bas lhag pa'i dbang phyug las yin zhing de bzhin du mi dang lhan cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yin na yang rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i dbang phyug ga la yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang de bas lhag pa'i dbang phyug las yin zhing de bzhin du mi dang lhan cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yin na yang rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i dbang phyug ga la yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is due to a greater Īśvara, and so on, in a series of beings, but how can there be an essentially existent Īśvara?

original: de lta na 'on tha ma dbang phyug gang yin pa de ni gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'on tha ma dbang phyug gang yin pa de ni gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then the last Īśvara is one who benefits others,

original: phan gdags par bya ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: but not one who is benefited, and so he would always exist.

original: brgya byin tshangs @18a * //
analyzed: brgya byin tshangs @18a * //
translated: Indra and Brahmā, etc.

original: pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: pa zhes smos so //
translated: are mentioned.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: gang dag mi la brten nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa khyad par can gyi chos dang ldan pa'i tha snyad la brten pa de dag kyang bsod nams dang ye shes la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can du byung ba gong nas gong du 'phel
analyzed: gang dag mi la brten nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa khyad par can gyi chos dang ldan pa'i tha snyad la brten pa de dag kyang bsod nams dang ye shes la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can du byung ba gong nas gong du 'phel
translated: Those who, in dependence on humans, are designated as having special qualities, such as Indra and Brahma, are only established as the increasing and enhancing of the special qualities of merit, wisdom, and so on.

original: bar bsgrub pa kho na yin gyi dbang phyug bzhin du rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar bsgrub pa kho na yin gyi dbang phyug bzhin du rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not permanent like Ishvara.

original: des na brgya byin dang tshangs pa la yon tan khyad 'byung srid na ste /
analyzed: des na brgya byin dang tshangs pa la yon tan khyad 'byung srid na ste /
translated: Therefore, if it is possible for Indra and Brahma to have special qualities,

original: shugs kyis 'phangs pas de'i rgyu srid na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shugs kyis 'phangs pas de'i rgyu srid na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is indirectly implied that it is possible for their cause to exist.

original: de'i tshe dbang phyug nyid kyang de bzhin du yon tan khyad par du byung ba phul du phyin bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang phyug nyid kyang de bzhin du yon tan khyad par du byung ba phul du phyin bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, since Ishvara himself would also obtain the highest special qualities in the same way,

original: rtag pa ma yin gyis slar la gzhan bzhin du 'khor ba nyid du 'gyur srid do //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin gyis slar la gzhan bzhin du 'khor ba nyid du 'gyur srid do //
translated: he would not be permanent. Rather, like others, he would be possible as cyclic existence.

original: gzhan gyis 'on te de yang med nyid na zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'on te de yang med nyid na zhes smras te /
translated: Another says, “But if that also does not exist…”

original: yon tan phul du byung ba de yang med na'o //
analyzed: yon tan phul du byung ba de yang med na'o //
translated: and that excellence is not there.

original: dbang phyug thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma'i tshul la ltos nas yang gi sgra byas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma'i tshul la ltos nas yang gi sgra byas so //
translated: The word again is used in the verse in reference to the previous method, in the phrase having attained lordship, etc.

original: lan du yon tan khyad par can grub pa med pa des na 'di 'khor ba nyid du 'gyur gyis dbang phyug ni ma yin te ji skad brjod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan du yon tan khyad par can grub pa med pa des na 'di 'khor ba nyid du 'gyur gyis dbang phyug ni ma yin te ji skad brjod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: In response, since there is no establishment of a special excellence, this would be cyclic existence, not lordship, because it is not endowed with the qualities as described.

original: 'di ni bzhad gad dang bcas bas bsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni bzhad gad dang bcas bas bsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: This is refuted with a smile:🔽What is that? and so on.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gang zhig dpe mthong ba yon tan phul du byung bas 'di la dbang phyug yin pa bsnyon pa des dpe ma mthong ba ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa gzhan du 'ang bzod dam ci ste mi bzod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // gang zhig dpe mthong ba yon tan phul du byung bas 'di la dbang phyug yin pa bsnyon pa des dpe ma mthong ba ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa gzhan du 'ang bzod dam ci ste mi bzod pa nyid do //
translated: What is that? and so on.

original: 'di nyid dpe sngon du song bas ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid dpe sngon du song bas ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: gong nas gong du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gi'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gi'o //
translated: The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of transformation” refers to Īśvara.

original: rang bzhin la zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan la'o //🔽de'i rjes su 'brang ba ni yon tan 'phel bar byas ba'i rjes su 'gro ba gang yin ba ste dpe yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan la'o // de'i rjes su 'brang ba ni yon tan 'phel bar byas ba'i rjes su 'gro ba gang yin ba ste dpe yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the nature” refers to the different states.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.

original: 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis rab tu 'gyur ba la bsnyon pa'o //🔽dpe med ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gis rang bzhin gyis grub pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dngos po la yid ches pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'brangs nas zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis rab tu 'gyur ba la bsnyon pa'o // dpe med ba'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gis rang bzhin gyis grub pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i dngos po la yid ches pa ci yod /
translated: The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.🔽The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.

original: ji ltar gang dbang phyug yin pa de ni yon tan 'phel bas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gang dbang phyug yin pa de ni yon tan 'phel bas byas pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature is followed by the increase of the quality.

original: dper na dbang po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “in the sense of being a cause of the subsequent state” refers to the fact that the nature

original: rab kyis mthar phyin bar gnas pa yang dbang phyug yin no zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba 'dis dam pa'i skye @18b bo'i tshogs kyi rjes su 'jug par byas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni gang du mthong bas na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma med pa can du bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: rab kyis mthar phyin bar gnas pa yang dbang phyug yin no zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba 'dis dam pa'i skye @18b bo'i tshogs kyi rjes su 'jug par byas pa dang / rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni gang du mthong bas na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma med pa can du bstan pa yin no /
translated: This is the proof that the assembly of holy beings is to be followed, and that the intrinsically real is taught to be without a valid cognition, because it is not seen anywhere.

original: sgrub par byed pa 'di la gzhi ma grub par ni mi brtsad de /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa 'di la gzhi ma grub par ni mi brtsad de /
translated: This proof is not disputed as being without a basis,
