original: gzhan gyi lugs las phan tshun 'gal ba tsam brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro ;🔽/ gal te dbang phyug du 'dod na yon tan 'phel bas byas par 'dod dgos pas rtags ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs las phan tshun 'gal ba tsam brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro ; / gal te dbang phyug du 'dod na yon tan 'phel bas byas par 'dod dgos pas rtags ma yin no //
translated: because it is merely asserted to be mutually contradictory with the other system.🔽If one asserts that the lord is the cause of the increase of the qualities, then it is not a reason, because it must be asserted that he is the cause of the increase of the qualities.

original: 'on te yon tan 'phel bas byas par mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'on te yon tan 'phel bas byas par mi 'dod na ni de'i tshe dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bas so //
translated: But if one does not assert that he is the cause of the increase of the qualities, then at that time he would not be a lord.

original: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang rgyu ma dmigs pa khas blangs pa la ltos nas thal bar grub pa'i rang bzhin can 'di gnyis ni 'di 'dra ba'i don khas blang bar mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di gtsor byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dang rgyu ma dmigs pa khas blangs pa la ltos nas thal bar grub pa'i rang bzhin can 'di gnyis ni 'di 'dra ba'i don khas blang bar mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di gtsor byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two consequences, which have the nature of a reason based on effect and non-observation of a cause, are primary in the sense that they are not able to accept such an object.

original: khyab pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: khyab pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is there pervasion?

original: yon tan 'phel ba gcig med na yang dbang phyug med pa'i phyir dang / de yod na yang yod pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa'i phyir ro thams cad du de ltar 'gyur ba la ltos pas kyang ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yon tan 'phel ba gcig med na yang dbang phyug med pa'i phyir dang / de yod na yang yod pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pa'i phyir ro thams cad du de ltar 'gyur ba la ltos pas kyang ci zhig bya /
translated: Because even if one of the qualities increases, there is no God, and because even if it exists, it exists, and because the relation of cause and effect is established. What is the use of always considering it in that way?

original: de lta yin na yang gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis the tshom gyis dkrugs pas bsgrub bya spong ba de thams cad mthong ba med par rang bzhin gyis grub pa bzod pa ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis the tshom gyis dkrugs pas bsgrub bya spong ba de thams cad mthong ba med par rang bzhin gyis grub pa bzod pa ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if that is the case, what is the use of accepting that which is to be established, which is disturbed by doubt due to discordant factors, by all who are without sight?

original: des na nyes pa snga ma las mi 'grol lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na nyes pa snga ma las mi 'grol lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that one is not freed from the previous fault.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: “Therefore” concludes the argument.

original: byed pa pos zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'phel ba'i mthu las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa pos zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'phel ba'i mthu las skyes pa'o //
translated: “By the agent” means that it arises from the power of the increase of the qualities.

original: khas blangs nas dgag pa smras pa ni gang zhig rgyu'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa te /
analyzed: khas blangs nas dgag pa smras pa ni gang zhig rgyu'i yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa te /
translated: The refutation of the assertion is this: that which does not possess the qualities of a cause

original: gang la rgyu'i byed pa med pa'i skyes bu de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la rgyu'i byed pa med pa'i skyes bu de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that which is not a person, that is, that which does not have the activity of a cause.

original: rnam par 'grel pa ni khyad par las khyad par du mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa ni khyad par las khyad par du mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: The explanation is this: because the difference is seen as a difference from the cause,

original: gang zhig de bskyed pa la mngon par brtson pa'i khyad par de las so //
analyzed: gang zhig de bskyed pa la mngon par brtson pa'i khyad par de las so //
translated: that which is generated from that difference is the cause of the person.

original: shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyed phyi ma 'chad ba'o //🔽'dis ni dbyibs khas blangs nas 'dod pa'i khyad par ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyed phyi ma 'chad ba'o // 'dis ni dbyibs khas blangs nas 'dod pa'i khyad par ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
translated: “Very different” and so on is the explanation of the second half of the verse.🔽This shows that the difference asserted by the opponent is not established.

original: de nyid ni med do zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni med do zhes ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show that that very difference does not exist, it says, “Moreover, if the shape of the parts. . . .”

original: de la dbyibs med pa ni rdul phra rab byed pa kho na yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dag ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon gnyis pa ni ma grub pas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dbyibs med pa ni rdul phra rab byed pa kho na yin pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dag ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skyon gnyis pa ni ma grub pas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The second fault, that the atoms are not a dissimilar example because they are only the shape of the composite, is not included because it is not established.

original: ji ltar brjod ces bya bas ni rdul phra rab @19a * //🔽rnams 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod ces bya bas ni rdul phra rab @19a * // rnams 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: By how? he means that the atoms are the effect.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rdul phra rab rnams 'bras bu yin pa dang / gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rdul phra rab rnams 'bras bu yin pa dang / gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid spong ba'o //
translated: By or else... he rejects the nonestablishment of the reason, because they are the effect.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i don ni ma grub pa nyid gtso bo'i skyon yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i don ni ma grub pa nyid gtso bo'i skyon yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the tenet is that nonestablishment is the chief fault.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa spong ba'o //
translated: By or else... he rejects the nonestablishment.

original: rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni yul de dang de non par skyes pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni yul de dang de non par skyes pas so //
translated: By that nature he means that it arises in the sense of occupying that place.

original: de ltar brjod de zhes bya ba ni dbyibs su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod de zhes bya ba ni dbyibs su brjod pa'o //
translated: By thus... he means that it is described as shape.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: By if that is so... he means the reply.

original: 'di ni nyes pa gzhan bkal pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa gzhan bkal pa yin te /
translated: This is a different fault.🔽The example is not similar.

original: mi mthun pa'i dpe med pa ni gnas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dpe med pa ni gnas pa kho na'o //
translated: The state of affairs is just as we have stated it.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga spong ba'o //
translated: Or, the word “or” means that both are rejected.🔽The shape is said to be the cause of the error, not the effect.🔽The refutation is this: “If that is so, then the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made in this way.🔽The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.

original: de lta bur 'khrul ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyis dbyibs su brjod kyis 'bras bu nyid kyis ni ma yin pas de kho na ltar sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sun 'byin pa ni de lta na ni'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bur 'khrul ba skyed par byed pa nyid kyis dbyibs su brjod kyis 'bras bu nyid kyis ni ma yin pas de kho na ltar sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // sun 'byin pa ni de lta na ni'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.

original: 'di dbyibs 'di 'dra bar byas so zhes 'jig rten 'khrul par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'di dbyibs 'di 'dra bar byas so zhes 'jig rten 'khrul par 'gyur mod /
translated: The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.

original: dbang phyug ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.

original: gzhan dag gis khas blangs par ni rtog ce na zhes pa'i dogs pa 'di ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis khas blangs par ni rtog ce na zhes pa'i dogs pa 'di ni 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning of the word “or” is that the world would be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.

original: dbang phyug gi dbyibs logs shig par mi mthong yang 'di la 'jig rten dbyibs su rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes nges par brtags nas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi dbyibs logs shig par mi mthong yang 'di la 'jig rten dbyibs su rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes nges par brtags nas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the world would not be in error in saying that the shape is made by God.🔽The meaning of the word “or” is

original: phyed phyi mas ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi mas ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: The second half of the verse is the refutation.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: rang gis nam yang ma rtogs pa'i dbyibs ci ltar byed ces rtsod pa na /
analyzed: rang gis nam yang ma rtogs pa'i dbyibs ci ltar byed ces rtsod pa na /
translated: When the opponent argues, “How can one make a shape that one has never perceived?,”

original: gzhan gyis blangs pa'i zhes bya ba'i lan ci yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyis blangs pa'i zhes bya ba'i lan ci yin /
translated: what is the reply, “Because it is accepted by others”?

original: rang gis ma dmigs pas ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis byed nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gis ma dmigs pas ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tsam gyis byed nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one cannot make something by merely accepting it from others, without perceiving it oneself.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “ But if” is a hypothetical.

original: dum bu'i yan lag can gyi sgo nas rdul phra rab kyis brtsams pa'i yan lag can ni re zhig yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dum bu'i yan lag can gyi sgo nas rdul phra rab kyis brtsams pa'i yan lag can ni re zhig yod pa yin no //
translated: The opponent might say, “The whole that is composed of parts, such as the parts of a pot, exists.

original: de yang dum bu'i yan lag can rnams ldan pa med par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de yang dum bu'i yan lag can rnams ldan pa med par mi 'grub bo //
translated: And that whole is not established without the parts.🔽And the whole that is composed of parts is established by the statement of the parts.

original: rtsom par byed pa de dag nyid kyi ldan pa de ni brjod pa des na dbyibs ni grub ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rtsom par byed pa de dag nyid kyi ldan pa de ni brjod pa des na dbyibs ni grub ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the shape of the parts is established.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa'i skyon gyis go skabs med do snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa'i skyon gyis go skabs med do snyam na /
translated: Therefore, the fault that you ascribe to us does not apply to us.”

original: lan du 'di ni phyi nas brtag bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: lan du 'di ni phyi nas brtag bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: The response, “This should be investigated later,” is in the context of the Lokāyatas.

original: da ni yang na the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni yang na the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the remainder of the Commentary on Valid Knowledge, “Or else there is doubt.”

original: dpe'i @19b tshig bsnan nas skabs 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: dpe'i @19b tshig bsnan nas skabs 'byed pa ni /
translated: The addition of the word “or else” introduces the context.

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Or else” means “or else.”

original: dpe la zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la'o //
analyzed: dpe la zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la'o //
translated: “In the example” means in the example of the dissimilar reason.

original: the tshom za ba ni gtan tshigs nges pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: the tshom za ba ni gtan tshigs nges pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: “Doubt” means the reason is not ascertained.

original: mi mthun pa'i dpe la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dpe la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists in the dissimilar example as well.

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom za ba'i rgyu mtshan bsgrub pa'i don du the tshom gyis sgras brjod ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom za ba'i rgyu mtshan bsgrub pa'i don du the tshom gyis sgras brjod ba yin no //
translated: This is expressed by the word “doubt” for the purpose of establishing the reason for doubting the probandum.

original: rnam par 'grel pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That very thing” is the commentary.

original: ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa ste /
translated: “It is just not ascertained” means the reason is not ascertained.

original: mi mthun pa'i dpe dbang phyug la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dpe dbang phyug la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists in the dissimilar example, Īśvara.

original: gal te gtan tshigs gsum dngos su bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs gsum dngos su bshad pa yin la /
translated: If the three reasons are actually stated,

original: skabs su bab pa ni dbyibs yin na ;
analyzed: skabs su bab pa ni dbyibs yin na ;
translated: and the present context is shape,

original: de ni lus med pa'i dbang phyug la yod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ni lus med pa'i dbang phyug la yod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: then shape does not exist for a powerful being who is devoid of a body,🔽so how could that be indeterminate for him?

original: des na de ci ltar de ma nges pa yin zhes dogs pa sel bas /
analyzed: des na de ci ltar de ma nges pa yin zhes dogs pa sel bas /
translated: To dispel that doubt,

original: de las gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don dang dbyibs ma grub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don dang dbyibs ma grub pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: the meaning of “it is not by anything else” is stated, and “because shape is not established” is stated.

original: don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the nature of performing a function” is an example.

original: bsdad nas 'jug pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bsdad nas 'jug pa yang ngo //
translated: It also refers to engaging while remaining.

original: 'on te dbang phyug de la don bya ba byed pa nyid med pa kho na ba des na 'di yang ci ltar ma nges pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug de la don bya ba byed pa nyid med pa kho na ba des na 'di yang ci ltar ma nges pa yin snyam na /
translated: But if powerful beings do not perform functions at all, then how could this be indeterminate for them?

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de ni zhes gsungs te don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de ni zhes gsungs te don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “that nature” refers to the nature of performing a function.

original: gal te dbang phyug kyang gzhan kho nas bskul bar bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug kyang gzhan kho nas bskul bar bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t powerful beings also impelled by something else?

original: des na ci ltar don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ma nges ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ma nges ba yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how is it that it is not ascertained because it performs a function?

original: dbang phyug de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang phyug de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “That God is not seen . . .”

original: 'di yang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as a contradiction of what is accepted.

original: 'on te 'di ni rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar brjod pa nyid do //
translated: “ But if he is himself . . .” and so on is just what was said earlier.

original: 'on kyang khyad par bsgrub pa'i don du rjes su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par bsgrub pa'i don du rjes su brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, it is stated again for the sake of establishing a distinction.

original: lan du rdza mkhan la sogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lan du rdza mkhan la sogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response, it is said, “Potters and so on . . .”

original: gzhan gyis dogs pa ni de dag gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dogs pa ni de dag gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Others doubt this, saying, “By them”

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pas so //
translated: means by potters and so on.

original: lan du nus pa nyid du mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du nus pa nyid du mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response, it is said, “Their ability is seen.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ste /
translated: “ But if . . .” is a response.

original: dbang phyug rjes su dpag pas mthong ba ni nus pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug rjes su dpag pas mthong ba ni nus pa yod pa yin no //
translated: “ God is seen through inference” means that he is able.

original: des ni rjes su dpag pas dbang phyug gzhan rjes su dpog na nus pa yin gyi rdza mkhan gyi nus pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des ni rjes su dpag pas dbang phyug gzhan rjes su dpog na nus pa yin gyi rdza mkhan gyi nus pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: “ If you infer God through inference, he is able, but the ability of potters and so on is not.”

original: sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni dbang phyug la yang dbang phyug gzhan rjes su ma dpags na nus pa med par thug pa med de dbang phyug gzhan dang gzhan rjes su @20a * //🔽dpag pas so //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni dbang phyug la yang dbang phyug gzhan rjes su ma dpags na nus pa med par thug pa med de dbang phyug gzhan dang gzhan rjes su @20a * // dpag pas so //
translated: The refutation is this: If one does not infer another God, then God is reduced to being powerless, because of the inference of another and another God.

original: de ltar dbang phyug gzhan dang gzhan dpog pa ni gcig kyang dbang phyug ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar dbang phyug gzhan dang gzhan dpog pa ni gcig kyang dbang phyug ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the inference of another and another God is that even one God is not God,

original: gzhan la rag las pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because he operates in dependence on another.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang yang na dpe la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang yang na dpe la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: In another way, he says, “Or else, there is doubt about the example,” in order to explain the meaning of that.

original: dbyibs yod med de ltan yang de la ltos na rdul phra rab chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ma yin no zhes tshegs su bcad pa phyed kyis don to //
analyzed: dbyibs yod med de ltan yang de la ltos na rdul phra rab chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ma yin no zhes tshegs su bcad pa phyed kyis don to //
translated: Even though the shape exists or does not exist, the atom is not a homogeneous example, with respect to that, as the first half of the verse shows.

original: 'di ni dpe rdul phra rab la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dpe rdul phra rab la the tshom za ba yin zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the doubt about the example, the atom.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no valid cognition that establishes it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab nyid kyi phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab nyid kyi phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: “For that very reason” means “for the very reason that it is a subtle particle.”

original: rnam pa de lta zhes bya ba ni med pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta zhes bya ba ni med pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: “In that way” means “in the nature of nonexistence.”

original: cha med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab ni tshad ma 'gas kyang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: cha med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab ni tshad ma 'gas kyang rtogs pa med do //
translated: A subtle particle that has the nature of being partless is not perceived by any valid cognition.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pas rdul phra rab sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pas rdul phra rab sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating the qualm, “There is a valid cognition that establishes a subtle particle,” he says,

original: 'on te 'di skad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di skad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “But if you say…”

original: lan ni rdul brgyad pa las zhes bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: lan ni rdul brgyad pa las zhes bya ba'i'o //
translated: The response is “Eight particles…”

original: de ltar rags pa nyid kyis mthong bzhin pa'i rags pa'i snga ma rjes su dpog par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar rags pa nyid kyis mthong bzhin pa'i rags pa'i snga ma rjes su dpog par 'gyur mod /
translated: Thus, it is reasonable to infer a previous coarse object that is seen as coarse.

original: gzhan gyi blta bya'i mthar 'dod pa dgu pa brgyad pas pha rol rdul bdun pa la sogs pa yod do zhes ga las rtogs /
analyzed: gzhan gyi blta bya'i mthar 'dod pa dgu pa brgyad pas pha rol rdul bdun pa la sogs pa yod do zhes ga las rtogs /
translated: But how do you know that there is another object of seeing, such as a group of seven particles, that is beyond the eight particles that are asserted to be the limit of the smallest particles?

original: gzhan gyi las ni gal te rjes dpag las zhes bya ba ste bshad zin pa las so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi las ni gal te rjes dpag las zhes bya ba ste bshad zin pa las so //
translated: The action of another is if it is from inference, as explained.

original: de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Other than that is the philosophical position.

original: rdul phra rab rtogs pa las /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rtogs pa las /
translated: From the understanding of the subtle particle,

original: pha rol ma rtogs pa ga las /
analyzed: pha rol ma rtogs pa ga las /
translated: how can the other be understood?

original: de ltar na ni rjes su dpag pa brgyud pas na rdul phra rab mi grub bo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni rjes su dpag pa brgyud pas na rdul phra rab mi grub bo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is thought that since inference is indirect, the subtle particle is not established.

original: gal te 'bras bu rags pa las phra mo dpag par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rags pa las phra mo dpag par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the subtle is not to be inferred from the coarse effect,

original: des na gal te rdul brgyad kyi brtsams pa rags pa yang yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te rdul brgyad kyi brtsams pa rags pa yang yin na /
translated: then if the coarse composed of eight particles is also not to be inferred,

original: de'i tshe des phra mo rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe des phra mo rtogs par byed do //
translated: at that time the subtle is to be understood by that.

original: de lta yin dang ji srid de dang des rdul phra rab kyi bar du rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang ji srid de dang des rdul phra rab kyi bar du rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then as long as that and that are to be understood up to the subtle particle,

original: gang gis rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang 'jug pas rdul phra rab mi 'grub par 'gyur ba rdul phra rab las gzhan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i skabs gang la yod snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gang gis rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang 'jug pas rdul phra rab mi 'grub par 'gyur ba rdul phra rab las gzhan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i skabs gang la yod snyam du dogs na /
translated: If one thinks that the occasion for the application of inference other than that of the atom is not established because of the nonestablishment of the atom,

original: 'di rdul brgyad po'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di rdul brgyad po'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the root text declares, “The eight atoms of the atom of form.”

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang rdul phra rab gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dang rdul phra rab gnyis pa'o //
translated: “Other” means the two atoms of the atom of form.

original: ci'i phyir @20b grangs yongs su ma chad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir @20b grangs yongs su ma chad ce na /
translated: Why is the number not fixed?

original: rdul phra rab mthong ba yin na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab mthong ba yin na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text declares, “If the atom were seen.”

original: 'on te rgyu rdul brgyad pa de rags pa yin pa des na de ni rdul gnyis par yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu rdul brgyad pa de rags pa yin pa des na de ni rdul gnyis par yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: But if the eight causes of the atom are coarse, then it is not even two atoms,

original: rdul phra rab tu lta ci smos /
analyzed: rdul phra rab tu lta ci smos /
translated: let alone an atom.

original: des na go bar byed pa ni rags pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin la /
analyzed: des na go bar byed pa ni rags pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the coarse is the cause, not the other,

original: de yang grub pa kho na bas /
analyzed: de yang grub pa kho na bas /
translated: and since that is established,

original: ma grub pa'i nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: the fault of nonestablishment does not arise.

original: sun 'byin pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is stated in the root text:🔽“When the atom is not established, the coarse is not established.”

original: gang gi tshe rdul gnyis ba la sogs pa ma mthong ba de'i tshe gang la ltos na rdul brgyad par rags pa yin rjes su dpag bya la ltos na ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdul gnyis ba la sogs pa ma mthong ba de'i tshe gang la ltos na rdul brgyad par rags pa yin rjes su dpag bya la ltos na ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: When two atoms and so on are not seen, then what is it that is inferred to be coarse when one sees the eight atoms?

original: thug pa med par zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: thug pa med par zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is that there is an infinite regress.

original: don 'di yin te rag las pa nyid kyis gzhan rjes su dpog la rjes su dpag pas gzhan grub pa las kyang rigs pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: don 'di yin te rag las pa nyid kyis gzhan rjes su dpog la rjes su dpag pas gzhan grub pa las kyang rigs pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: The point is this: one infers another on the basis of dependence, and since it is reasonable that one is established by the inference of another,

original: ji srid gzhan rjes su dpag pa de srid rags pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ji srid gzhan rjes su dpag pa de srid rags pa ma yin la /
translated: as long as one infers another, it is not coarse.

original: ji srid rags pa ma yin pa de srid kyang gzhan rjes su dpag pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid rags pa ma yin pa de srid kyang gzhan rjes su dpag pa med do //
translated: And as long as it is not coarse, one does not infer another.

original: des na phan tshun rten ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na phan tshun rten ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since they mutually depend on each other,

original: rags pa nyid ma nges pas na /
analyzed: rags pa nyid ma nges pas na /
translated: coarseness is not ascertained.

original: des ngos po nyid tsam gzhan rjes su dpog pa yin gyi 'bras bu nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des ngos po nyid tsam gzhan rjes su dpog pa yin gyi 'bras bu nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one infers only mere existence of another, not its being an effect.

original: des na rdul phra rab tu 'dod pa las kyang gzhan rjes su dpog pa de las gzhan rjes su dpog pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal lo ;
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab tu 'dod pa las kyang gzhan rjes su dpog pa de las gzhan rjes su dpog pa'i phyir thug pa med par thal lo ;
translated: Therefore, since the inference of the other is from the inference of the other, the consequence is an infinite regress.

original: ; de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ; de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: rjes dpag la ni ltos bcas pas //
analyzed: rjes dpag la ni ltos bcas pas //
translated: Because inference is dependent,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not established.

original: des na gang dang gang du rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag tu 'dod pa de dang der rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis 'gog pa'i phyir rdul phra rab gnas ba med do //
analyzed: des na gang dang gang du rdul phra rab rnam par gzhag tu 'dod pa de dang der rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis 'gog pa'i phyir rdul phra rab gnas ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since the other inference is refuted by another inference in every case where the atom is posited, the atom does not endure.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag rnam pa gzhan du rtul phra rab rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag rnam pa gzhan du rtul phra rab rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: But if, in another way, others posit the atom,

original: lta bar bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid rdul phra rab yin no //
analyzed: lta bar bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid rdul phra rab yin no //
translated: the nature of the object of vision is the atom.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na mthar thug par 'gyur ba ni ste gang las chung ba'i blta bya gzhan med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na mthar thug par 'gyur ba ni ste gang las chung ba'i blta bya gzhan med pa ste /
translated: When? At the ultimate point, that is, from which there is no other object of vision smaller than it.

original: rdul brgyad pa zhes bsnyad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul brgyad pa zhes bsnyad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is, the one called the octet of atoms.

original: 'o na ni de chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o na ni de chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But then it is not a dissimilar example.

original: de ltar chos mthun pa'i bsgrub pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la the tshom za ba'i rnam pa gnyis bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar chos mthun pa'i bsgrub pa dang / chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la the tshom za ba'i rnam pa gnyis bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the two types of doubt with regard to a proof by the method of identity and a dissimilar example,

original: da ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni mi srid do zhes bya ba skabs su bab pa'i sun 'byin pa ci ste btang snyoms su dgongs nas /
analyzed: da ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni mi srid do zhes bya ba skabs su bab pa'i sun 'byin pa ci ste btang snyoms su dgongs nas /
translated: now, why is it that the author of the treatise has not stated the refutation that is relevant to the present context, namely, that the result that is desired by the opponent is impossible in any way?🔽He has not stated it because he is indifferent to it.

original: @21a * // yang the tshom dra ba yin zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'grel pas gal te rdul phra rab zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @21a * // yang the tshom dra ba yin zhes bya ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'grel pas gal te rdul phra rab zhes gsungs so //
translated: He explains the root text, “If the atom is the cause of the visual cognition of a visible form, then the visual cognition would not be the cognition of a visible form,”

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud nas rdul phra rab de dag nyid kyis brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud nas rdul phra rab de dag nyid kyis brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the visual cognition is produced by a series from one atom to another.

original: rdul phran rnams ni grub ce na yang de'i bsgrub par bya ba blta bar bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes gnas dang gnas su spro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phran rnams ni grub ce na yang de'i bsgrub par bya ba blta bar bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhes gnas dang gnas su spro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the atoms are established, the object to be established, the visible form, and so on, is established by them.

original: de'i phyir 'di khas blangs pas ci bya /🔽rdul phra rab rnams kyis brtsams pa'i yan lag can ni 'thad pa yang ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di khas blangs pas ci bya / rdul phra rab rnams kyis brtsams pa'i yan lag can ni 'thad pa yang ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, what is the use of accepting it?🔽And it is not tenable that the whole is composed of the atoms.

original: phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is what is shown by the words “If it were to touch in one part, etc.”

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: rdul phra rab phan tshun 'dres pa dag gis brtsams pa'i rdul bum pa'i tshogs kyis ldan pas yan lag can bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab phan tshun 'dres pa dag gis brtsams pa'i rdul bum pa'i tshogs kyis ldan pas yan lag can bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The whole, which is composed of atoms that touch one another, is established as being possessed of a collection of atoms.

original: de la de dag rnams bdag nyid thams cad dam phyogs gcig gis reg par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de la de dag rnams bdag nyid thams cad dam phyogs gcig gis reg par 'gyur grang na /
translated: In this regard, do they touch with their entire selves or with a part?

original: phyogs dang po la ni rdul phra rab thams cad gcig gi 'dul par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu yan lag can mi srid do //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni rdul phra rab thams cad gcig gi 'dul par 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu yan lag can mi srid do //
translated: In the first case, since all the atoms would be the same, such a whole is impossible.

original: 'on te gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is the second case,

original: phyogs gcig gis ni reg na de /🔽de ci ltar rdul phran yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis ni reg na de / de ci ltar rdul phran yin par 'gyur /
translated: then if it touches with a part,🔽how could it be an atom?

original: ci ste rdul phran ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rdul phran ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is not an atom,

original: thams cad phyogs ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad phyogs ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: all in every direction.

original: 'o na te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “ But if” is the opponent’s position.

original: lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “That is not so. ”

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams ma reg par yang ldan pa de skyes na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams ma reg par yang ldan pa de skyes na /
translated: If the atoms were to combine without touching,

original: de'i tshe ldan pa de nyid yin mod ces blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ldan pa de nyid yin mod ces blta bar bya ste /
translated: then that combination would be just that,

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because the atoms would not change.

original: yang na de nyid ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab nyid de gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na de nyid ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab nyid de gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or, “that itself” means that the atoms themselves would not change.

original: de lta yin mod mi 'thad pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin mod mi 'thad pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: But if that is so, what is wrong with that?

original: ji ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: “ How? ”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “ But if” is the opponent’s position.

original: rdul phra rab der yan lag can gzhan yod pa des rdul phra rab de la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blor 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab der yan lag can gzhan yod pa des rdul phra rab de la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blor 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If the other extended object were in the atom, then the cognition of that atom would be of one form.

original: lan du brtags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du brtags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “because of the imagination. ”

original: gal te zhig na ni thal pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te zhig na ni thal pa 'dir mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it were to be destroyed, then this consequence would not occur.

original: gal te kho bo cag la sogs pa dag gis rdul phra rab mthong bar mi nus pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te kho bo cag la sogs pa dag gis rdul phra rab mthong bar mi nus pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it the case that we and others are not able to see the subtle particle?🔽So why is it said in this way?

original: des na de skad ci ste brjod ces dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de skad ci ste brjod ces dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he explains, “If, etc.”

original: 'on te de dag gnyi ga ni zhes bya ba @21b ni rdul phra rab dang yan lag can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on te de dag gnyi ga ni zhes bya ba @21b ni rdul phra rab dang yan lag can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “If both of them” refers to the subtle particle and the possessor of parts.

original: lan du 'phro 'du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du 'phro 'du zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response, he says, “If they were to be dispersed,” etc.

original: yan lag rnams la yan lag can gyi'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnams la yan lag can gyi'o //
translated: The possessor of parts is in the parts.

original: ci ltar yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis po so sor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ltar yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis po so sor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “How?” means that the two are individually realized.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan ni de lta yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan ni de lta yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Another refutation is “If that were so, etc.”

original: yan lag can dang rdul phra rab dag dbang phyug gis so sor mthong na'o //
analyzed: yan lag can dang rdul phra rab dag dbang phyug gis so sor mthong na'o //
translated: The possessor of parts and the subtle particles are seen individually by God.

original: gzhan du ni mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni mthong ba zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par mthong ba'o //
translated: “Otherwise, it is seen” means that it is seen without distinction.

original: 'on te bdag cag la ltos na ni 'phrod pa 'du ba can yin la /
analyzed: 'on te bdag cag la ltos na ni 'phrod pa 'du ba can yin la /
translated: But if we consider ourselves, we are the ones who are meeting.🔽

original: dbang phyug la ltos nas ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa de'i tshe yang skyes bu so so la dngos po tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di shin tu legs pa zhig go //
analyzed: dbang phyug la ltos nas ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa de'i tshe yang skyes bu so so la dngos po tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di shin tu legs pa zhig go //
translated: But if you think that the various things are in contact with us, but not with God, then it is very good to say that the various things are different in relation to each individual person.

original: gzhan du mthong ba gcig po 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du mthong ba gcig po 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa med do //
translated: Otherwise, it is not reasonable to say that the one perception is mistaken.

original: gal te rdul phra rab gnas pa nyid la tshad mar grub par rtsol ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab gnas pa nyid la tshad mar grub par rtsol ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the existence of atoms is established by the authority of the scriptures?

original: des na rdul phra rab sun 'byin pa'i go skabs ga la yod ce na bden te /
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab sun 'byin pa'i go skabs ga la yod ce na bden te /
translated: How then can there be an opportunity to refute the atoms?

original: rnam 'grel mdzad pas 'di gzhan du ma gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam 'grel mdzad pas 'di gzhan du ma gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: It is true, but the author of the Pramānﬁ avārtika did not discuss this elsewhere.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rnam pa 'di yang rig pa tsam du 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rnam pa 'di yang rig pa tsam du 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs te /
translated: So, thinking that this might be a reason for establishing that this aspect is merely consciousness,

original: 'di'i don du bsams nas skabs su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don du bsams nas skabs su brjod pa yin no //
translated: I have mentioned it here.

original: dngos po nyid du ni phyi rol rig pa ma yin pas nyid kyis rnam par rig pa tsam du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid du ni phyi rol rig pa ma yin pas nyid kyis rnam par rig pa tsam du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since external objects are not cognized as entities, therefore, the establishment of vijñaptimātra is proven.

original: de ltar yin dang dbang phyug re ba na shin du rgyang ring ba'i phyir skabs ma shor la /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang dbang phyug re ba na shin du rgyang ring ba'i phyir skabs ma shor la /
translated: If it were so, then the hope of the theist would be very far away, since the opportunity would be lost.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe 'chad pa ni 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe 'chad pa ni 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of the dissimilar example is because it is a result.

original: yan lag ldan pas yan lag can brtsams pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang ma 'brel lo zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag ldan pas yan lag can brtsams pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de yang ma 'brel lo zhes ston pa ni /
translated: As for what was said, “The possessor of parts is initiated by the possession of parts,” that is also irrelevant.

original: rags pa cha shas ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rags pa cha shas ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He demonstrates this in the line, “The coarse has parts.”

original: gang dang gang rags pa de thams cad cha shas ldan pa sngon du song ba yin no zhes bya ba'i khyab pa ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang dang gang rags pa de thams cad cha shas ldan pa sngon du song ba yin no zhes bya ba'i khyab pa ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the pervasion is not established, that is, that whatever is coarse is necessarily preceded by the possession of parts.

original: gal te 'jim gong la sogs pa la dmigs par ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'jim gong la sogs pa la dmigs par ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: If it is asked how it is not established that the coarse is observed in a lump of clay and so on,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, “If it is coarse,” and so on.

original: dper na lag pas 'jim pa blangs nas gong bur sbyor bar mthong ba de bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba la ni de'i cha shas gzhan gyis bsdus pa'am rang nyid 'dus pa ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na lag pas 'jim pa blangs nas gong bur sbyor bar mthong ba de bzhin du myu gu la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba la ni de'i cha shas gzhan gyis bsdus pa'am rang nyid 'dus pa ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, just as one sees the hand taking up the clay and forming it into a lump, in the same way, in the generation of the sprout, etc. , one does not see the other parts of the sprout being collected or itself being collected.🔽This is the meaning of the statement.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “thus” clarifies that.

original: shing wa d'a @22a * //🔽de la yan lag ldan pa ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: shing wa d'a @22a * // de la yan lag ldan pa ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: The word “tree” is a synecdoche for the parts of the tree.🔽How could it have parts? It could not!

original: gang gi tshe mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, “How could it not have parts?”🔽The word “if” is used.

original: yan lag rnams sngon yod min na ste med pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnams sngon yod min na ste med pa'i tshe'o //
translated: If the parts did not exist before, that is, if they did not exist,

original: gal te sngar yan lag rnams med kyang ldan pa ni yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te sngar yan lag rnams med kyang ldan pa ni yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: one might think that even though the parts did not exist previously, the possessor would exist.

original: yan lag yod pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yan lag yod pa rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word “existing” is used.🔽How could it have a possessor?

original: yan lag can yang ga la yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsom par byed pa'i ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag can yang ga la yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsom par byed pa'i ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “at all” is used because the possessor does not exist.

original: mun khung gi bar ni gti mug chen pos bsgribs ba rnams so //
analyzed: mun khung gi bar ni gti mug chen pos bsgribs ba rnams so //
translated: The word “darkness” refers to those who are obscured by great delusion.

original: bdag cag gis de kho na bstan pa'i rgyu de las ni zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba lhan cig byed pa can gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu chung ngu las so //
analyzed: bdag cag gis de kho na bstan pa'i rgyu de las ni zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba lhan cig byed pa can gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu chung ngu las so //
translated: “From that cause” means from the small cause of the appropriated aggregates that are co-present with the unseen.

original: kho bo cag thams cad ces sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag thams cad ces sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: “We” should be supplied.

original: rigs pa smra ba kho bo cag ces bya bar bsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa smra ba kho bo cag ces bya bar bsam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the one who speaks rationally is meant by “we.”

original: de lta na ci ltar nges par 'grub /
analyzed: de lta na ci ltar nges par 'grub /
translated: If that is so, how is it established?

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “But” refers to the opponent’s position.

original: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs 'dus par ma mthong yang 'jim gong la 'jim pa 'dus pa mthong ba'i dpes yod par 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs 'dus par ma mthong yang 'jim gong la 'jim pa 'dus pa mthong ba'i dpes yod par 'grub po zhe na /
translated: Even though one does not see the aggregation of subtle particles, it is established that it exists by the example of seeing the aggregation of clay in a clay pot.

original: sun 'byin pa ni sgron ma'i dpe zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni sgron ma'i dpe zhes gsungs so //
translated: The refutation is stated in the example of the lamp.

original: dper na mun khung na gnas pa'i byis pa sgron mas gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: dper na mun khung na gnas pa'i byis pa sgron mas gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is like the way a child in the dark is illuminated by a lamp.

original: grangs can lta ba zhes bya ba ni gal te dpe tsam gyi bsgrub bya 'grub na'o //
analyzed: grangs can lta ba zhes bya ba ni gal te dpe tsam gyi bsgrub bya 'grub na'o //
translated: “If the Sāṃkhya view” means if the probandum is established by mere example.

original: de lta yin na skyon ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin na skyon ci yod snyam na /
translated: If that is so, what is the fault?

original: de'i phyir zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore,🔽

original: grangs can gyi lta ba 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can gyi lta ba 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because the Samkhya view has been refuted,🔽why would it be far away?

original: ci'i phyir 'di thag ring por 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di thag ring por 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, why would it be far away?

original: sgron ma la sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is, because of the lamp, etc.

original: des na sems pa med pas gsal ba'i phyir ci ltar dbang phyug sgrub byed yin /
analyzed: des na sems pa med pas gsal ba'i phyir ci ltar dbang phyug sgrub byed yin /
translated: Therefore, since it is clear that it is not an agent, how could it be established as God?

original: 'on te sgron ma la yang sems pa can gyis byin gyis brlabs pa kho na mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin pas des ji ltar dbang phyug sgrub byad ma yin par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te sgron ma la yang sems pa can gyis byin gyis brlabs pa kho na mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin pas des ji ltar dbang phyug sgrub byad ma yin par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But if the lamp is only empowered by an agent, it is made manifest, so how could that not establish God?

original: de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is, that also, etc.

original: lan ni sngar btab po zhes bya ba ni nus pa nyid du mthong ba ji ltar nus pa ma yin ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lan ni sngar btab po zhes bya ba ni nus pa nyid du mthong ba ji ltar nus pa ma yin ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The response has already been given, as in, how could what is seen as potency not be potency?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar blo tsam sgrub na gtan tshigs thams cad grub pa dang / khyad par can dbang phyug la yang dpe ma grub pas na khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa dang / ci ltar mthong ba bzhin rtogs pa na yang 'dod pa la gnod pa'i 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar blo tsam sgrub na gtan tshigs thams cad grub pa dang / khyad par can dbang phyug la yang dpe ma grub pas na khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa dang / ci ltar mthong ba bzhin rtogs pa na yang 'dod pa la gnod pa'i 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: When one realizes it just as it is seen, it is contradictory to what is desired.

original: dbang phyug de nyid kyis @22b kyang ma nges pa dang / dbyibs kyang med pas ma grub pa dang / shing la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ma nges pa dang / dbang phyug byed pa po yin pa la yang dpyad mi bzod pa des na zhes mjug sdud pa'o //🔽de de de dang de las yin //
analyzed: dbang phyug de nyid kyis @22b kyang ma nges pa dang / dbyibs kyang med pas ma grub pa dang / shing la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ma nges pa dang / dbang phyug byed pa po yin pa la yang dpyad mi bzod pa des na zhes mjug sdud pa'o // de de de dang de las yin //
translated: Since even Īśvara himself is indefinite, since shape is also nonexistent, it is not established. Since it is mistaken with respect to trees and so on, it is indefinite. Since even Īśvara being a creator is not tenable when analyzed, that is the summary.🔽That from that and from that

original: zhes bya ba ni de dang de las de dang de skyes so zhes tha snyad kyis te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dang de las de dang de skyes so zhes tha snyad kyis te ;
translated: This is a convention that that arises from that and from that.

original: 'bras bu'i tshogs rnams sems pa can gcig la nges pa nyid ma yin na dbang phyug gi gtam yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tshogs rnams sems pa can gcig la nges pa nyid ma yin na dbang phyug gi gtam yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the collection of effects is not ascertained in one sentient being, then there is no talk of Īśvara.

original: de ltar min na zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig la byed pa po sems pa can mthong ba tsam gyis thams cad la /
analyzed: de ltar min na zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig la byed pa po sems pa can mthong ba tsam gyis thams cad la /
translated: If it is not like that, then if one sees a sentient being as an agent in one place, then one would infer that sentient beings are agents everywhere,

original: 'gras bu nyid la sogs pa tsam mthong ba'i phyir byed pa po sems pa can /
analyzed: 'gras bu nyid la sogs pa tsam mthong ba'i phyir byed pa po sems pa can /
translated: because one sees only the effect and so on.

original: rjes su dpog na de'i tshe ser po yang dkar po yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpog na de'i tshe ser po yang dkar po yin te /
translated: In that case, yellow would be white,

original: dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir dkar po gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir dkar po gzhan bzhin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is an entity, like another white thing.

original: thal ba 'di spang pa'i don du gzhan gyis /
analyzed: thal ba 'di spang pa'i don du gzhan gyis /
translated: In order to eliminate this absurd consequence, the opponent says,

original: mngon sum gnod pas min zhe na zhes smras so //
analyzed: mngon sum gnod pas min zhe na zhes smras so //
translated: “It is not so because it is undermined by perception.”

original: dngos po nyid yin pa la ni ser po dkar po nyid du dpog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin pa la ni ser po dkar po nyid du dpog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is an entity, yellow is not inferred to be white,

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is undermined by perception. This is what it means.

original: de 'dir zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: de 'dir zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: Here, “this” refers to the philosophical position.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa de dbang phyug rjes su dpag pa 'dir med ces tshad ma gang la rtogs te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa de dbang phyug rjes su dpag pa 'dir med ces tshad ma gang la rtogs te /
translated: The objection that direct perception contradicts this is not a problem for the inference of God.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan ba la gnod pa mthong na de'i mtshan nyid can gzhan la yang gnod pa dogs pa mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / rtsva la sogs pa la skyes bu med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan ba la gnod pa mthong na de'i mtshan nyid can gzhan la yang gnod pa dogs pa mi ldog pa'i phyir dang / rtsva la sogs pa la skyes bu med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one sees that something is contradicted when it possesses a certain characteristic, one cannot avoid suspecting that something with that characteristic is contradicted in other cases as well. And one sees that there is no person in grass and so on.

original: 'on te de las ma mthong ba'i byed pa po yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de las ma mthong ba'i byed pa po yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is an agent who is not seen in that,

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyis med na mi 'byung ba grub pa khas blangs pas na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa gnyis kyis med na mi 'byung ba grub pa khas blangs pas na /
translated: then since you accept that direct perception and nonperception establish a necessary connection,

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal bas ltar btung ba dang cig shos khas blangs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / khas len na yang ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung par med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal bas ltar btung ba dang cig shos khas blangs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / khas len na yang ldog pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung par med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not tenable that you accept that the person is essentially different from the aggregates, because the person would not exist by its own nature. And if you accept that, then the person cannot be established as the referent of the notion of “I.”

original: 'on te khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na skyes phur ba ltar rung ba las ldog pa grub pa nyid kyis ma mthong ba sems pa med pa la ldog pa 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na skyes phur ba ltar rung ba las ldog pa grub pa nyid kyis ma mthong ba sems pa med pa la ldog pa 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: But if you think that when the pervasion is apprehended, the non-seeing of the mind is established by the mere establishment of the opposite of the possible, then the opposite is established for the mindless.

original: de lta na ni 'o na rtsva la sogs pa la ni gnod pa la sogs par gnas so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rtsva la sogs pa la ni gnod pa la sogs par gnas so //
translated: If that were so, then it would be established that the mind exists in grass and so forth.

original: 'dir yang mthong ba'i sems pa can ldog pa grub pa nyid ma mthong ba'i sems pa can ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang mthong ba'i sems pa can ldog pa grub pa nyid ma mthong ba'i sems pa can ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here too, the establishment of the opposite of the mind that sees is for the sake of the opposite of the mind that does not see.

original: rnyed na ni 'jug la gong @23a * //
analyzed: rnyed na ni 'jug la gong @23a * //
translated: If it were found, it would engage, and if not, it would cease.

original: na ni ldog pa zhes bya bar ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: na ni ldog pa zhes bya bar ni mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not reasonable to say that.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga la yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'i phyir gnod pa tshad mas ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga la yang mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'i phyir gnod pa tshad mas ma grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since neither is contradicted by perception, the contradiction is not established by valid cognition.

original: 'di tsam gyis gsal bar yin yang gzhan gyis smras pa ni rigs pa can de'i dbang phyug rjes su dpog pa la gnod pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir na de'i gnod pa nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis gsal bar yin yang gzhan gyis smras pa ni rigs pa can de'i dbang phyug rjes su dpog pa la gnod pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir na de'i gnod pa nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: Although this much is clear, what others say is that the contradiction in the inference of that īśvara of the Naiyāyikas is not established because the non-observation of the contradictory is not established.

original: bdag gis gnod pa ma mthong ba de tsam gyis gnod pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gis gnod pa ma mthong ba de tsam gyis gnod pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “Just because I do not see harm, it is not the case that there is no harm.”

original: lan du rigs pa can khyod kyis gnod pa mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: lan du rigs pa can khyod kyis gnod pa mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o ;
translated: The response: “You logicians, your non-observation characterized by non-apprehension is not a valid cognition.

original: ; tshad mas khas blangs na ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: ; tshad mas khas blangs na ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with accepting it as a valid cognition?

original: gal te khyod kyis ma dmigs pa'i ma mthong ba tshad ma yin na de'i tshe dbang phyug kyang ma dmigs pa'i phyir de yang 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis ma dmigs pa'i ma mthong ba tshad ma yin na de'i tshe dbang phyug kyang ma dmigs pa'i phyir de yang 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If your non-apprehension characterized by non-observation were a valid cognition, then because God is also not apprehended, he would also be refuted.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa las grub pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa las grub pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, “That is not so, because God is established by inference,”

original: 'di ni snying po med de ma dmigs pa tsam las the tshom du 'gyur na rje su dpag pa'i go skabs yod kyi de las khyad par gcig tu nges par grub na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni snying po med de ma dmigs pa tsam las the tshom du 'gyur na rje su dpag pa'i go skabs yod kyi de las khyad par gcig tu nges par grub na ni ma yin no //
translated: that is pointless, because if mere non-apprehension were a valid cognition, there would be an opportunity for inference, but if one were established as a definite single category, that would not be the case.

original: 'on te dbang phyug med par grub pa la ni ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug med par grub pa la ni ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But if the nonexistence of God is established, then not seeing is not a valid means of knowledge, because there is doubt.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa la 'jug go snyam na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa la 'jug go snyam na /
translated: Therefore, one should engage in inference.

original: 'o na ni gnod pa med pa las kyang ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni gnod pa med pa las kyang ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: But then, even when there is no contradiction, not seeing is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: de lta na yang dbang phyug ci ltar 'grub /
analyzed: de lta na yang dbang phyug ci ltar 'grub /
translated: But in that case, how is God established?

original: des na gnod pa dang gnod pa med pas byas pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod pa dang gnod pa med pas byas pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference in the effect of contradiction and noncontradiction.

original: des na lhan cig 'byung pa tsam mthong ba las thams cad thams cad la rjes su dpog pa zhes bya ba ni legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na lhan cig 'byung pa tsam mthong ba las thams cad thams cad la rjes su dpog pa zhes bya ba ni legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is well established that the mere simultaneous occurrence of the two is seen, and that everything is inferred from everything.

original: du ba la me bzhin du sems pa tsam sems pa can gyi khyad par gyis ni 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa la khyab pa tshad mas ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: du ba la me bzhin du sems pa tsam sems pa can gyi khyad par gyis ni 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa la khyab pa tshad mas ma grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: But the pervasion of the effect, etc., by mere cognition, like smoke by fire, is not established by a valid means of knowledge due to the difference of the cognizer.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, “Moreover, etc.”

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni don bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni don bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: “Entity” means an object that performs a function.

original: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa gzhan dag kyang nye bar mtshon par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa gzhan dag kyang nye bar mtshon par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, other proofs are also to be illustrated.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su dbog par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su dbog par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a proof?

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: He says, “because of the desire of the person, etc.”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod pas gtan tshigs bsgrub bya ba sgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug @23b na ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dod pas gtan tshigs bsgrub bya ba sgrub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug @23b na ;
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if the reason were to be engaged in proving the probandum because of desire,

original: de'i tshe dbang phyug las bzlog pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang phyug las bzlog pa yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, the opposite of God would be established.

original: ji ltar dbang phyug med par thal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug med par thal zhe na /
translated: How does it follow that God does not exist?

original: de yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes smos te /
translated: He says, “that also,” i.e.,

original: dbang phyug med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dbang phyug med pa yang ngo //
translated: the nonexistence of God.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar khyad par 'dzin pa khas blang pa bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar khyad par 'dzin pa khas blang pa bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one must certainly accept the distinction.

original: khyab pa rtog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: khyab pa rtog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That pervasion is also of two kinds:

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las sam /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las sam /
translated: from perception and inference, or

original: bzlog na gnod pa can gyis tshad mas so //
analyzed: bzlog na gnod pa can gyis tshad mas so //
translated: from a valid cognition that contradicts the opposite.

original: de la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation in terms of perception and non-perception is “but . . . ”

original: gang ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gang ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gang ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Whatever” means “whatever kind. ”

original: de 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'das pa na byed pa po dang bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba ni 'das pa na byed pa po dang bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: “Just that” is a past participle.

original: 'dis ni nges pa'i 'bras bu ni go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni nges pa'i 'bras bu ni go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: This shows that the effect of the ascertainment is the understanding,🔽and that the cause of the ascertainment is the object of understanding.

original: nges pa'i rgyu ni go bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes spyi chen po spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu ni go bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes spyi chen po spangs pa yin no //
translated: This is the rejection of the great generality.

original: 'di nyid rnam 'grel la sbyor ba ni zhes bshad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam 'grel la sbyor ba ni zhes bshad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The application to the Pramānﬁ avārtika is “is explained. ”

original: dbyibs la sogs pa ci 'dra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa ci 'dra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “Whatever shape, etc. ”

original: dbyibs la sogs pa de las byin gyis rlob pa po sems pa dang ldan pa rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa de las byin gyis rlob pa po sems pa dang ldan pa rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The inference of the possessor of the shape, etc. , who is endowed with intention is just the reasoning.

original: ci 'dra ba yang yin la /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba yang yin la /
translated: It is just that kind.

original: byin gyis rlob pa po yang de yin pa de yod pa dang / med pa'i rjes su 'jug par dbyibs la sogs ba grub na ni dbyibs la sogs pa de las /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa po yang de yin pa de yod pa dang / med pa'i rjes su 'jug par dbyibs la sogs ba grub na ni dbyibs la sogs pa de las /
translated: and it is also the one who is empowered.🔽If the shape, etc. were established as the one who is empowered, then the one who is empowered would be inferred from that shape, etc.

original: byin gyis rlob pa po de 'dra ba rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa po de 'dra ba rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is the very reasoning.

original: 'dir ni bum pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan la ni khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni bum pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan la ni khyab pa yin la /
translated: Here, the pot, etc. are pervaded by another aspect,

original: ri la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba las ni rjes su dpag par rtsom pa'i phyir tshad ma'i rjes su 'brangs pa ga la yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba las ni rjes su dpag par rtsom pa'i phyir tshad ma'i rjes su 'brangs pa ga la yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: but the mountain, etc. are not pervaded by another aspect. Therefore, how can there be a follower of valid cognition who begins to infer from the mountain, etc.? This is the meaning.

original: de lta na 'o na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sgra mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then this also is not an inference: “Sound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot.”

original: rigs shin tu mi 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rigs shin tu mi 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is a very dissimilar type.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa nye bar mtshon byar byas nas mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa 'bras bu ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam khyad par gyis rnam par ma bcad pa'i spyi ni mi rtag pa tsam gyis khyab
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa nye bar mtshon byar byas nas mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa 'bras bu ma yin pa las ldog pa tsam khyad par gyis rnam par ma bcad pa'i spyi ni mi rtag pa tsam gyis khyab
translated: Because when one posits a vase as the exemplification, the conceptual cognition that arises after direct perception does not ascertain the mere exclusion of being non-effect, which is the universal not distinguished by a specific difference, as being pervaded by mere impermanence.

original: par shes par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: par shes par 'dod pa na /
translated: If one asserts that it is known to be pervaded by impermanence,

original: gal te bzlog pa la gnod pa'i rjes su dpag pa sbyar bar nus na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid kyang rjes su dpog gi gzhan @24a * //🔽du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te bzlog pa la gnod pa'i rjes su dpag pa sbyar bar nus na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid kyang rjes su dpog gi gzhan @24a * // du ni ma yin no //
translated: then if one is able to apply an inference that contradicts the opposite, at that time impermanence is inferred, but not otherwise.

original: skabs su ni ci ltar me'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'di med na sngar ma dmigs pa'i du ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi tshe 'di dmigs pa na dmigs pa des 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs su ni ci ltar me'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po 'di med na sngar ma dmigs pa'i du ba'i dngos po gzhan gyi tshe 'di dmigs pa na dmigs pa des 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In this context, when this thing that is the characteristic of fire is absent, if this other thing, smoke, which was not previously observed, is observed, then by observing that, it is given that it is the effect.

original: khyab pa khyad par can gyis sbyin la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa khyad par can gyis sbyin la brten pa yin no //
translated: It is pervaded by the specific difference of being based on that.

original: de bzhin du de 'dra ba'i skyes bu'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du de 'dra ba'i skyes bu'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i'am /
translated: In the same way, the thing that is the characteristic of such a person,

original: sems pa can tsam med na /
analyzed: sems pa can tsam med na /
translated: If there were no sentient beings,

original: ci ltar yongs su mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa med la /
analyzed: ci ltar yongs su mthong ba'i bum pa la sogs pa med la /
translated: then there would be no pot, etc., which are perceived.

original: de yod na ni yod pa de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i khyad par la khyab pa grub kyi 'bras bu tsam la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod na ni yod pa de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i khyad par la khyab pa grub kyi 'bras bu tsam la ni ma yin te /
translated: But if there are sentient beings, then the pervasion is established with respect to the specific effect, because it exists as the effect of that. But it is not established with respect to the mere effect,

original: sems pa can gyi byed pa'i sngon rol du 'bras bu tsam ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa can gyi byed pa'i sngon rol du 'bras bu tsam ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that the mere effect is absent prior to the activity of the sentient being.

original: me'i bya ba'i snga rol du ni du ba tsam log pa grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: me'i bya ba'i snga rol du ni du ba tsam log pa grub pa nyid do //
translated: But it is established that the mere smoke is absent prior to the activity of the fire.

original: des na 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid sgrub par byed pa yin gyi 'bras bu tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid sgrub par byed pa yin gyi 'bras bu tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the specific effect is established, but not the mere effect.

original: du ba la yang lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa nang gi dbye ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: du ba la yang lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa nang gi dbye ba yod do zhe na /
translated: But there are internal divisions of smoke, such as that which arises from leaves, etc.

original: yod mod gal te de dag kyang mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas gzhan las ldog ba nyid kyi sgo nas 'dzin na de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod de /
analyzed: yod mod gal te de dag kyang mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas gzhan las ldog ba nyid kyi sgo nas 'dzin na de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod de /
translated: Granted, but if those are also apprehended by conceptual thought that occurs after perception, through the exclusion of other, then what is the problem?

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis du ba tsam la khyab par rtogs pa'i mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis du ba tsam la khyab par rtogs pa'i mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, as previously explained, the non-reversal of the cognition of pervasion with respect to mere smoke is not possible.

original: skabs su bab pa ni khyab pa rtogs pa med ces bstan zin to //
