analyzed: skabs su bab pa ni khyab pa rtogs pa med ces bstan zin to //
translated: And it has been shown that there is no cognition of pervasion in the present case.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshong dus su phyin pa'i bum pas kyang de 'dra ba'i bzo brjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshong dus su phyin pa'i bum pas kyang de 'dra ba'i bzo brjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the pot that is brought to the market is inferred to have a maker of that kind, but not a maker who is a god, etc.

original: ri la sogs pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i rnam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a maker who is a god, etc.

original: shin du rigs mi mthun pa'i lha khang la sogs pa'i go bar byed pa ni khyab ba so sor bzung ba'i 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: shin du rigs mi mthun pa'i lha khang la sogs pa'i go bar byed pa ni khyab ba so sor bzung ba'i 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: The cognition of a temple, etc., which are very dissimilar, is the result of the separate apprehension of the pervasion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe bzo rig pa khyad bar can rjes su dpog gi bum pa byed pa'i bzo dang ldan pa ma yin no //🔽gal te ri la sogs pa la yang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid rjes su dpog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i tshe bzo rig pa khyad bar can rjes su dpog gi bum pa byed pa'i bzo dang ldan pa ma yin no // gal te ri la sogs pa la yang khyad par dang ldan pa nyid rjes su dpog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, at that time, a special knowledge of the arts is inferred, but not the possession of the art of making pots.🔽If it is argued that even in the case of a mountain, etc., the possession of a special feature is inferred,

original: gal te lha'i khang pa gzhan bzhin du ri gzhan la byed pa mthong na ni 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te lha'i khang pa gzhan bzhin du ri gzhan la byed pa mthong na ni 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: if the making of another mountain is seen, like another temple, then it would be so.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi khyab pa bzung na ni 'bras bu'i rigs khyad par can sems pa can dang 'brel pa 'grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu tsam las ni rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi khyab pa bzung na ni 'bras bu'i rigs khyad par can sems pa can dang 'brel pa 'grub pa'i phyir 'bras bu tsam las ni rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the pervasion is grasped by perception, then the special type of effect related to the sentient being is established, and so there is no inference from mere effect.

original: rtsva la sogs pas 'khrul pa yang spang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pas 'khrul pa yang spang bar mi nus so //
translated: And the error of grass, etc. cannot be avoided.

original: 'di ltar mngon @24b sum dang mi dmigs pa'i byed pa ni ba ltar rung ba'i rang bzhin med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon @24b sum dang mi dmigs pa'i byed pa ni ba ltar rung ba'i rang bzhin med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the operation of perception and non-apprehension is such that it does not occur without the presence of a suitable object.

original: bltar rung ba'i lus can sems pa can gyi khyad par kho na dang / khyab pa rtogs par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i lus can sems pa can gyi khyad par kho na dang / khyab pa rtogs par bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, the pervasion is to be understood only in regard to a sentient being, a body that is suitable to be seen, and a special quality.

original: bltar rung ba ni rtsva la sogs pa skye bo la ma dmigs pa grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bltar rung ba ni rtsva la sogs pa skye bo la ma dmigs pa grub pa kho na'o //
translated: And the suitability to be seen is established only in regard to a person, not in regard to grass, etc.

original: 'on te bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa tsam dang khyab pa 'dzin par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa tsam dang khyab pa 'dzin par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: But if it is held that the pervasion is grasped in regard to mere possession of thought, which is devoid of the special quality of suitability to be seen,

original: de'i tshe mngon sum la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not based on perception.

original: gal te mi mthong ba'i sems pa can srid par byas nas 'khrul ba spang na de'i sems pa can med pa la 'bras bu med par sems pa na srid pa 'di gar song na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthong ba'i sems pa can srid par byas nas 'khrul ba spang na de'i sems pa can med pa la 'bras bu med par sems pa na srid pa 'di gar song na /
translated: If you assume that the existence of a conscious being is not perceived, and then deny error, then when you think that the nonexistence of a conscious being is without effect, where does this existence go?

original: gang gis ldog pa 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis ldog pa 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: Where is its cessation established?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The nature of cause and effect is such that they are invariably concomitant and invariably homogeneous.

original: gal te de rdza mkhan ldog pa nyid la sems pa can ldog par brjod na /
analyzed: gal te de rdza mkhan ldog pa nyid la sems pa can ldog par brjod na /
translated: If you say that the cessation of the potter is the cessation of the conscious being,

original: rtsva la sogs pa skyes pa la yang de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur bas 'khrul pa ga la spong ;
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa skyes pa la yang de bzhin du thal bar 'gyur bas 'khrul pa ga la spong ;
translated: then the same consequence would apply to the production of grass, etc. How could you avoid error?

original: des na sems pa can gyi byed pa ni bum pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa nyid la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na sems pa can gyi byed pa ni bum pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa nyid la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the activity of a conscious being should be said to be the production of a pot, etc.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi khyab pa 'dzin pa'i byed ba bltar rung ba'i rang bzhin kho na la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi khyab pa 'dzin pa'i byed ba bltar rung ba'i rang bzhin kho na la ltos pa yin la /
translated: If the activity of the perception of the pervasion is dependent only on the nature of the visible,

original: bltar rung ba yang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa spangs pa kho nas yin gyi /
analyzed: bltar rung ba yang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa spangs pa kho nas yin gyi /
translated: then the visible is only excluded by the exclusion of the nature.

original: khyab pa med par thal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: khyab pa med par thal ba'i phyir //
translated: because there would be no pervasion.

original: yul dang dus kyis bskal pa spangs pas ni ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yul dang dus kyis bskal pa spangs pas ni ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: It is not that the mind is excluded from the object and time,

original: rgod pa la sogs pa la blos khyab par ji ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: rgod pa la sogs pa la blos khyab par ji ltar rtogs te /
translated: but how can the mind be aware of the pervasion of agitation, etc.?

original: gzhan gyi rgyud ni rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud ni rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the continuum of another is naturally excluded.

original: gang las ldog pa 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod pa'i sems log pa na rgod pa'i sems ldog pa'i tshe sems gzhan ldog par yang ji ltar rtogs she na ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las ldog pa 'grub par 'gyur ba 'dod pa'i sems log pa na rgod pa'i sems ldog pa'i tshe sems gzhan ldog par yang ji ltar rtogs she na ma yin te /
translated: When the mind that is the opposite of agitation, etc. is established, how can the mind be aware of the cessation of another mind when the mind of agitation ceases?

original: rang rig pa'i spyod yul nyid kyis blo gzhan la yang ba ltar rung ba nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i spyod yul nyid kyis blo gzhan la yang ba ltar rung ba nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the object of self-awareness is not suitable to be excluded from another mind.

original: gang zhig khyab pa 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i rang rig ba de nyid gzhan du med do zhes bya ba 'dis ci bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig khyab pa 'dzin pa la zhugs pa'i rang rig ba de nyid gzhan du med do zhes bya ba 'dis ci bya ste /
translated: What is the use of saying that self-awareness, which engages in apprehending the pervasion, does not exist in another?

original: me la yang khyab pa 'dzin pa mngon sum de nyid ni me gzhan la yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me la yang khyab pa 'dzin pa mngon sum de nyid ni me gzhan la yang yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The direct perception that apprehends the pervasion in fire does not exist in another fire.

original: mthong ba'i tha snyad kyi sgrub byed de 'dra ba'i mngon sum gyi yul nyid ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i tha snyad kyi sgrub byed de 'dra ba'i mngon sum gyi yul nyid ni mtshungs pa kho na'o //
translated: The object of direct perception, which is the basis for the convention of seeing, is exactly the same in both cases.

original: khyad par ni 'di yin te /🔽rigs pa ni nam yang rang @25a * //
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yin te / rigs pa ni nam yang rang @25a * //
translated: The difference is this:

original: rig pas blta bar bya ba nyid las 'da' ba med la /
analyzed: rig pas blta bar bya ba nyid las 'da' ba med la /
translated: The reason is never beyond being seen by reflexive awareness.

original: me ni re 'ga' rung ba tsam gyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: me ni re 'ga' rung ba tsam gyis kyang dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin no //
translated: But fire is sometimes the object of a sense consciousness even when it is not directly perceptible.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mngon sum la ltos pa'i blta bar bya ba ni gnyi ga la yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mngon sum la ltos pa'i blta bar bya ba ni gnyi ga la yod do //
translated: Therefore, both have the quality of being seen in relation to their own direct perception.

original: 'pho ba'i me ni de 'dra ba'i mngon sum du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i me ni de 'dra ba'i mngon sum du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: But the fire of a firebrand is not directly perceptible in that way.

original: des na de bcad pa'i don kho nar gsal zhing 'bar ba'i gzugs kyis me khyab byed du nges par bya ba yin no //🔽gang zhig gi sa bkab par thal ba de ltar sems kyi rigs rig pa ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na de bcad pa'i don kho nar gsal zhing 'bar ba'i gzugs kyis me khyab byed du nges par bya ba yin no // gang zhig gi sa bkab par thal ba de ltar sems kyi rigs rig pa ma yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that fire is the pervader by the form of the firebrand, which is clearly seen and is the object of the elimination of that.🔽There is no one who is not aware of the reason that the firebrand appears to be moving.

original: 'dod pa'i sems bka' ba'i dus su sems gzhan ma bkab mod /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems bka' ba'i dus su sems gzhan ma bkab mod /
translated: When the mind that desires to see the firebrand is covered, it is true that another mind is not covering it.

original: 'dod pa'i sems med na rgod pa med pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rgyud gzhan grub po //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems med na rgod pa med pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rgyud gzhan grub po //
translated: If there is no desire-realm mind, there is no agitation. Just that much establishes the existence of another mind.

original: sems tsam nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di cis bya ste /
analyzed: sems tsam nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di cis bya ste /
translated: What is the reason for saying that it is not ascertained that there is only mind?

original: khyad par grub na spyi 'bad pa med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par grub na spyi 'bad pa med par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a specific instance is established, the general rule is established without effort.

original: yang na dbang phyug rjes su dpog pa bzhin gzhan gyi rgyud rjes su dpag pa yang mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang phyug rjes su dpog pa bzhin gzhan gyi rgyud rjes su dpag pa yang mi 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: Or, like the inference of God, the inference of another mind is not tenable.

original: de la ni kho bo cag gis khas blangs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la ni kho bo cag gis khas blangs pa tsam yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: In that case, we have no fault, because we merely accept it.

original: de'i phyir gal te blo dang ldan pa bltar rung ba'i lus kyis khyad par can kho na dang khyab pa brjod par 'dod pa dang / de grub pa tsam gyi sems pa can tsam gyis byas par nges pa nyid du 'dod pa yin na 'gyur mod chad pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te blo dang ldan pa bltar rung ba'i lus kyis khyad par can kho na dang khyab pa brjod par 'dod pa dang / de grub pa tsam gyi sems pa can tsam gyis byas par nges pa nyid du 'dod pa yin na 'gyur mod chad pa ci yod /
translated: Therefore, if the intelligent one wishes to state the pervasion that only the body that is suitable to be seen is qualified, and if he wishes to ascertain that it is definitely produced by the mere mind that is established by that, then what is the harm?

original: 'on kyang rtsva la sogs pas 'khrul pa zlog par dka' ba kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtsva la sogs pas 'khrul pa zlog par dka' ba kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: However, it is difficult to reverse error with regard to grass and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ci 'dra ba'i byin gyis rlob po zhes bshad pa gzhan byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ci 'dra ba'i byin gyis rlob po zhes bshad pa gzhan byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that the other one is the one who blesses.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa sgrub pa'i don du ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa la brten pa legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa sgrub pa'i don du ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa la brten pa legs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not good to rely on perception and non-perception in order to establish the relation characterized by the nature of cause and effect.

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba spangs pa kho nas bltar rung ba'i yul can pa'i phyir dang / sems pa can log pas 'bras bu tsam ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba spangs pa kho nas bltar rung ba'i yul can pa'i phyir dang / sems pa can log pas 'bras bu tsam ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the object to be seen is only excluded by the exclusion of the cause, and because the mere result is not established to be excluded by the exclusion of the sentient being,

original: go rims bzhin du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed la ltos nas nges pa dang the tshom za ba dag gis ma nges pa mi spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed la ltos nas nges pa dang the tshom za ba dag gis ma nges pa mi spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: respectively, the ascertainment and doubt regarding the probandum and the probans are not eliminated.

original: bzlog pa la gnod pa'i tshad mas 'gog pa la 'jug pa yang 'di tsam nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa la gnod pa'i tshad mas 'gog pa la 'jug pa yang 'di tsam nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The engagement in the refutation by the valid cognition that contradicts the opposite is also eliminated by this much.

original: 'di ltar gal te yang 'bras bu tshogs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin @25b par nges pa de lta na yang tshogs pa skyes bu la rag las so zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te yang 'bras bu tshogs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin @25b par nges pa de lta na yang tshogs pa skyes bu la rag las so zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin de bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, even though it is certain that the effect is established by the assembly, how could the assembly depend on a person?

original: 'o na ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgrub byed mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i byed pa de nyid 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgrub byed mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i byed pa de nyid 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: If you say, “Because we see it that way,” then the proof of positive and negative concomitance is by the power of perception and inference.

original: de yang rigs kyi khyad par gyi yul can yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang rigs kyi khyad par gyi yul can yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And it has already been explained that the object of that is a specific type.

original: de'i phyir rigs gang zhig tshogs pa skyes bu la rag las bar rtog pa de 'dra ba nyid na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs gang zhig tshogs pa skyes bu la rag las bar rtog pa de 'dra ba nyid na /
translated: Therefore, if you imagine that a specific type depends on a person, then it is just that specific type

original: ldog pa yin gyi 'bras bu tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa yin gyi 'bras bu tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: that is excluded, not just the effect.

original: skyes bu'i 'bad pa med par rgyu'i tshogs par 'gyur na thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'bad pa med par rgyu'i tshogs par 'gyur na thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say, “If the assembly of causes were to occur without human effort, it would occur at all times.”

original: ma mthong ba yongs su smin pa'i lhan cig byed ba can rgyu thams cad kyi yongs su gyur pa brgyud pa la ltos pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yongs su smin pa'i lhan cig byed ba can rgyu thams cad kyi yongs su gyur pa brgyud pa la ltos pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence of a cause that is not seen, which is the common locus of the ripening of the seed and the transformation of all causes, is tenable as being occasional.

original: sems pa can gyi byed pa med par yang shing phung dud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs pa can gyi me byung ba'i ni mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: sems pa can gyi byed pa med par yang shing phung dud pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs pa can gyi me byung ba'i ni mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: And it is seen that fire arises from the collection of causes that have the nature of a heap of wood, even without the activity of an intelligent agent.

original: ma mthong ba rtogs pa la ni sgra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin du sun 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba rtogs pa la ni sgra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhin du sun 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: As for the inference of what is not seen, it is to be refuted, like the effect of sound, etc.

original: du ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ni sun 'byin pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: du ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ni sun 'byin pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir mi mtshungs so //
translated: But the inference of smoke is not similar, because there is no opportunity for refutation.

original: mngon sum la brten pa'i byed pa sun 'byin pa 'di ni blo dang ldan pa tsam bzhin du nye bar len ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la yang thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum la brten pa'i byed pa sun 'byin pa 'di ni blo dang ldan pa tsam bzhin du nye bar len ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la yang thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This refutation of activity that is based on perception is also common to the establishment of the superknowledges, such as the knowledge of the appropriator, etc., just as it is to the mere possession of intelligence.

original: bde byed la sogs pas nye bar len ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i khyad par bshad pas ni grub pa la sgrub pa spong bar rung yang /
analyzed: bde byed la sogs pas nye bar len ba la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i khyad par bshad pas ni grub pa la sgrub pa spong bar rung yang /
translated: The explanation of the special knowledge of the appropriator, etc., by Bhadanta Rāma and others is suitable to refute the establishment of what is already established.

original: de ltar 'dod pa bsgrub par ni ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa bsgrub par ni ni mi nus so //
translated: But it is not possible to establish what is desired in this way.

original: gang gi rigs can gyi 'bras bul byed pa po rjes su dpog pa de dang / de la de'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi rigs can gyi 'bras bul byed pa po rjes su dpog pa de dang / de la de'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the agent is inferred from the effect of the type of action, and the knowledge of the appropriator, etc., of that is itself the knowledge of the effect.

original: 'di la mi 'dod pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la mi 'dod pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no disagreement here.

original: gang las nges par mang po shes pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba skyes bu byas pa'i 'bras bu'i rigs thams cad la /
analyzed: gang las nges par mang po shes pa nyid du yang 'gyur ba skyes bu byas pa'i 'bras bu'i rigs thams cad la /
translated: From what is it that the knowledge of the many would also be, since the agent is not ascertained as one with regard to all effects of the type of action?

original: byed pa po gcig nyid du nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po gcig nyid du nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the agent is ascertained as one.

original: mang po rnams kyi byed pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po rnams kyi byed pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the action of many is also seen.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rgyang ring du spang ba nyid las brjod pa don med do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rgyang ring du spang ba nyid las brjod pa don med do //
translated: It is meaningless to say that omniscience is to be rejected from afar.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i rtsis khong dum bcug par blo dang ldan pa tsam gyis dbang du byas nas mngon sum tsam la brten @26a * //🔽ba'i khyab pa la sun 'byin pa brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i rtsis khong dum bcug par blo dang ldan pa tsam gyis dbang du byas nas mngon sum tsam la brten @26a * // ba'i khyab pa la sun 'byin pa brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the intelligent one should take to heart the fact that the pervasion based on mere perception is refuted, and that the mere fact that the two are observed together is not a proof.

original: re zhi ga tha dad pa dag gi dngos po pa'i 'brel pa ni rgyu 'bras las gzhan ma yin la de yang ma grub pa zhes ston pa theg pa kho na'o //
analyzed: re zhi ga tha dad pa dag gi dngos po pa'i 'brel pa ni rgyu 'bras las gzhan ma yin la de yang ma grub pa zhes ston pa theg pa kho na'o //
translated: The relation of inherence is not different from the relation of cause and effect, and that is not established.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag las gzhan ni rgyu dang 'bras bu grub pa la sgrub byed med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag las gzhan ni rgyu dang 'bras bu grub pa la sgrub byed med do //
translated: Therefore, apart from perception and non-apprehension, there is no proof for the establishment of cause and effect, following the valid means of knowledge.

original: de la brten pa na yang khyad par nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la brten pa na yang khyad par nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges ba'i phyir /
translated: Even when based on that, the difference is ascertained as the relation of cause and effect.

original: de tsam zhig mngon sum gyi rjes su 'brangs nas sun phyung pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam zhig mngon sum gyi rjes su 'brangs nas sun phyung pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that much is refuted by following perception.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dbyibs la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa ni rigs so zhes blta'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dbyibs la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa ni rigs so zhes blta'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that it is reasonable to prove shape and so on in that way.

original: de ltar sgrub byed nyid du rigs pa brjod nas de'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa yang 'thad par brjod pa'i sgo nas de nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni dbyibs sam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub byed nyid du rigs pa brjod nas de'i 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa yang 'thad par brjod pa'i sgo nas de nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni dbyibs sam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The shape of the parts.

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in shape.

original: dngos po nyid dam zhes bya ba ni don bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid dam zhes bya ba ni don bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: The very thing that performs a function.🔽The meaning of the commentary on the transformation of the difference🔽is stated in order to dispel the doubt “What is the meaning of the commentary

original: 'o na khyad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel gyi don ci yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa sel ba ni gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel gyi don ci yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa sel ba ni gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: on the transformation of the difference?”

original: ri la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan las ni byed pa bo rdza mkhan rjes su dpog pa'am /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan las ni byed pa bo rdza mkhan rjes su dpog pa'am /
translated: The potter is not inferred from other things, such as the clay.

original: ril sogs pa nye bar len pa la sogs ba rigs pa rjes su dpog pa'am /
analyzed: ril sogs pa nye bar len pa la sogs ba rigs pa rjes su dpog pa'am /
translated: Nor is the clay, etc., which is appropriated, etc., inferred through reasoning.

original: ma mthong ba rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the unseen inferred.

original: de ltar 'di thams cad rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa'i bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dngos po ba khyab byed nyid du rab tu 'grub pa'i blo dang ldan pa ni dbyibs zhes sgra mtshungs pas tha dad la med pa'i ri la sogs pa las rjes🔽su dpag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di thams cad rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad pa'i bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dngos po ba khyab byed nyid du rab tu 'grub pa'i blo dang ldan pa ni dbyibs zhes sgra mtshungs pas tha dad la med pa'i ri la sogs pa las rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the one who has the idea that the various things such as pot, etc., as explained by the author of the Pramanavarttika, are established as the pervader, should not infer the shape from the various things such as mountain, etc., by means of the similar expression “shape.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir ri la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa rigs pa rjes su dpog pa yang spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ri la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa la sogs pa rigs pa rjes su dpog pa yang spangs pa yin la /
translated: For that very reason, the inference of the reason is also rejected in the case of the mountain, etc., as the appropriator, etc.

original: khyab pa ma rtogs pa nyid kyis mthong ba rjes su dpog pa yang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa ma rtogs pa nyid kyis mthong ba rjes su dpog pa yang spangs pa yin te /
translated: And the inference of the seen is also rejected by the very non-comprehension of the pervasion.

original: dper na skya bo skya bo zhes sbra mtshungs pas tha dad pa med pa'i skya po'i rdzas las skya bo'i khyad par la khyab par byed ba nyid du rab tu grub pa'i me rjes su dpog par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skya bo skya bo zhes sbra mtshungs pas tha dad pa med pa'i skya po'i rdzas las skya bo'i khyad par la khyab par byed ba nyid du rab tu grub pa'i me rjes su dpog par mi rigs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not reasonable to infer the fire which is established as the pervader of the difference of the pale from the pale substance which is not different by means of the similar expression “pale.”

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This very point is explained by “If” . . .

original: byed pa po'i khyad par ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid dam /🔽bum ba'i nye bar len pa @26b la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: byed pa po'i khyad par ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid dam / bum ba'i nye bar len pa @26b la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The difference of the agent is the characteristic of the state of the potter, etc.🔽Or, it is the characteristic of the knowledge of the appropriation of the pot, etc.

original: ba ltar rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: ba ltar rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Or, it is the characteristic of the suitability of the pot, etc.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dbyibs btang nas zhes bya bas de rjes su 'jug pa can gyi dbyibs bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dbyibs btang nas zhes bya bas de rjes su 'jug pa can gyi dbyibs bzhag ste'o //
translated: The phrase “having abandoned the shape that follows it” means that the shape that follows it is posited.

original: dngos po tsam zhes bya ba ni bsdad nas 'jug pa dang / 'bras bu'i nyid la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam zhes bya ba ni bsdad nas 'jug pa dang / 'bras bu'i nyid la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “mere thing” refers to the shape that is engaged in remaining, and the phrase “the effect, etc.” illustrates it.

original: khyad par can gyis khyab pa bor nas spyi la brten na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par can gyis khyab pa bor nas spyi la brten na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “having abandoned the pervader, it is based on the general” is this:

original: dpe'i rnam par 'grel pa ni skya bo'i rdzas las zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dpe'i rnam par 'grel pa ni skya bo'i rdzas las zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The example is explained in the phrase “from the substance of smoke.”

original: ci'i phyir skya bo'i rdzas las me rjes su dpag par mi rigs snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skya bo'i rdzas las me rjes su dpag par mi rigs snyam na /
translated: Why is it that it is not reasonable to infer fire from the substance of smoke?

original: de la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response to this question, the root text states, “because it is not seen.”

original: me rjes su dpog pa'o ;
analyzed: me rjes su dpog pa'o ;
translated: The meaning of this is that it is not reasonable to infer fire from the substance of smoke.

original: /'o na du ba nyid las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: /'o na du ba nyid las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “But from smoke itself” is the opponent’s response.

original: lan ni 'dir smras pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'dir smras pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “The response to that” is the response to the opponent’s response.🔽“By what” and so on is the response to the opponent’s response.

original: gang gis du ba de nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad brjod pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis du ba de nyid las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad brjod pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba /
translated: “From smoke itself” and so on is the opponent’s response.

original: du ba nyid tha dad pa las na skya bo'i khyad par du gyur pa ma yin no //🔽du ba khyad par ma yin na du ba'i khyad par du rtogs pa'i skya bo gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don ma rtogs nas du bar rtogs pa'i zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: du ba nyid tha dad pa las na skya bo'i khyad par du gyur pa ma yin no // du ba khyad par ma yin na du ba'i khyad par du rtogs pa'i skya bo gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don ma rtogs nas du bar rtogs pa'i zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: “If smoke itself is different” means that the difference in the color of the smoke is not different.🔽“If smoke is not different” means that if the color of the smoke is not different, then the color of the smoke is not understood.

original: len ni me'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: len ni me'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The response to that” is the response to the opponent’s response.

original: de'i phyir dper na skya bo'i rdzas las me rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu tsam las kyang dbang phyug rjes su mi dpag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na skya bo'i rdzas las me rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu tsam las kyang dbang phyug rjes su mi dpag ste /
translated: “Therefore, just as the color of the smoke is not inferred from fire, in the same way, Īśvara is not inferred from the mere effect,

original: skyes bus khyab par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus khyab par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that he is the pervader.”

original: 'dir lan 'thad par ma mthong nas /
analyzed: 'dir lan 'thad par ma mthong nas /
translated: Here, not seeing a response to that,

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi sgo nas dkrugs par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi sgo nas dkrugs par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi gal te zhes smras so //
translated: In order to stir up some people in some way, he says, If you say....

original: myu gu 'ba' zhig du ma zad de /
analyzed: myu gu 'ba' zhig du ma zad de /
translated: Not only is the sprout,

original: du ba 'dir yang na rjes su 'gro ba ste yod pa dang / ldog pa ste med pa de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa nyid ji ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: du ba 'dir yang na rjes su 'gro ba ste yod pa dang / ldog pa ste med pa de dag gi rjes su 'jug pa nyid ji ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: but also this smoke, in regard to which, the pervasion, i.e., existence, and the counter-pervasion, i.e., non-existence, how are they to be understood?

original: khyab pa rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa ni bzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa ni bzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that the pervasion, i.e., the forward pervasion, and the counter-pervasion, i.e., the reverse pervasion, cannot be grasped.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam pa nyid ston pa ni du ba 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam pa nyid ston pa ni du ba 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The very form of the forward pervasion and the counter-pervasion is shown by this smoke....

original: lan ni rgyu 'bras dngos por ma bzung bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rgyu 'bras dngos por ma bzung bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is without taking cause and effect as real entities....

original: rnam 'grel gyi don gsal bar byed pas mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi don gsal bar byed pas mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion, which clarifies the meaning of the Pramanavarttika, is Therefore....

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par can yang yin la bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe yang yin zhing tha dad pa'i dngos po yang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par can yang yin la bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe yang yin zhing tha dad pa'i dngos po yang yin pa ste /
translated: It has the distinction of shape, is an example such as a pot, and is a different entity.

original: de la mthong ba'i dngos po'i khyad par skyes bu byin gyis brlabs pa'i bye brag gang yin pa @27a * //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i dngos po'i khyad par skyes bu byin gyis brlabs pa'i bye brag gang yin pa @27a * //
translated: The specific thing that is seen is a particular case of the empowerment of a person.

original: de rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin la zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin la zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is not reasonable to infer that.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni rang sgrub pa'i sgra'i don te /
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni rang sgrub pa'i sgra'i don te /
translated: The word “seen” has the meaning of “established by oneself.”

original: don gyis 'ongs pas na dpe zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don gyis 'ongs pas na dpe zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is a case of the meaning coming after, it is called a “simile.”

original: de ni sgra mtshungs pa tha dad pa med pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag par rig pa ma yin no zhes bya bar blta'o //🔽de bzhin du nye bar len pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'am /
analyzed: de ni sgra mtshungs pa tha dad pa med pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag par rig pa ma yin no zhes bya bar blta'o // de bzhin du nye bar len pa la sogs pa mngon par shes pa'am /
translated: It should be understood that it is not known to be an inference from a reason that is not different from a similar instance.

original: ma mthong ba'i dbang phyug kyang rjes su dpag par mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i dbang phyug kyang rjes su dpag par mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is not reasonable to infer the existence of a god who is the creator of the world, or the existence of a god who is the enjoyer of the world, or the existence of a god who is the agent of the world, or the existence of a god who is the appropriator of the world, and so on.🔽Or the existence of a god who is the creator of the world, or the existence of a god who is the enjoyer of the world, or the existence of a god who is the agent of the world, or the existence of a god who is the appropriator of the world, and so on, is not seen.🔽This is a definite conclusion.

original: gang du dpe mthong pa yang rjes su mi dpog pa der ma mthong ba ni smos mi dgos so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du dpe mthong pa yang rjes su mi dpog pa der ma mthong ba ni smos mi dgos so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Where the simile is seen but not inferred, there is no need to mention that the unseen is not inferred.

original: gal te khyad par gyis khyab par rtogs kyang spyi las rjes su dpog na de'i tshe du ba ma yin pa'i dkar po las kyang me dpog par thal lo zhes bya ba 'di la lan smras pa ni //
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyis khyab par rtogs kyang spyi las rjes su dpog na de'i tshe du ba ma yin pa'i dkar po las kyang me dpog par thal lo zhes bya ba 'di la lan smras pa ni //
translated: If one infers fire from smoke, then one infers fire from a white thing which is not smoke.🔽The answer to this is:

original: 'on te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “But if . . . ”

original: mngon sum gyis 'dod pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni thams cad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis 'dod pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni thams cad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “always” makes it clear that the opponent accepts this on the basis of perception.

original: lan ni med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: “No.”

original: gnod pa med pa tsam gyis ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa tsam gyis ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference does not operate merely on the basis of non-contradiction.

original: gal te gnod pa med pa las rjes su mi dpog na gang las dpog ce na /
analyzed: gal te gnod pa med pa las rjes su mi dpog na gang las dpog ce na /
translated: If one does not infer from non-contradiction, then what does one infer?

original: de ni 'brel pa mthong ba las yin no zhes le'u dang por brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'brel pa mthong ba las yin no zhes le'u dang por brjod pa yin no //
translated: The answer is that one infers from the perception of the relation. This was stated in the first chapter.

original: 'brel pa yang de'i bdag nyid las gzhan de las byung ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang de'i bdag nyid las gzhan de las byung ba kho na yin la /
translated: The relation is only that of identity or origination.

original: blo dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu gnyis la ni 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes dpyad ma thag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu gnyis la ni 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes dpyad ma thag pa kho na'o //
translated: It was just explained that the intelligent person does not have these two in regard to the effect.

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa la ma ltos par gnod pa med pa tsam las rjes su dpog na'o //
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa la ma ltos par gnod pa med pa tsam las rjes su dpog na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if one infers merely from the absence of contradiction, not depending on a relation,

original: 'on te 'dir gnod pa yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'dir gnod pa yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: then in this case, there is a contradiction.

original: des na rdza mkhan rjes su dpag par ci ltar thal zhe na /
analyzed: des na rdza mkhan rjes su dpag par ci ltar thal zhe na /
translated: So how could it follow that the potter is inferred?

original: grog mkhar rdza mkhan gyis byas pa la ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: grog mkhar rdza mkhan gyis byas pa la ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response is: “In the case of an anthill, the potter’s creation . . .”

original: grog mkhar rdza mkhan gyis byas par rjes su dpog pa la ni gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grog mkhar rdza mkhan gyis byas par rjes su dpog pa la ni gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the case of inferring that an anthill is the creation of a potter, there is no contradiction.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o ;
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o ;
translated: The opponent says: “If . . . ” and so on.

original: / gal te byed pa po rdza mkhan yin na de'i tshe zhes khong nas drangs te /
analyzed: / gal te byed pa po rdza mkhan yin na de'i tshe zhes khong nas drangs te /
translated: If the potter is the agent, then . . .

original: dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: . . . it would be observed.🔽What?

original: ci zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: This is a philosophical standpoint.

original: ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya ri la sogs pa la dbang phyug kyang dmigs sam ci /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya ri la sogs pa la dbang phyug kyang dmigs sam ci /
translated: What? Is Īśvara also observed in the object of the thesis, such as a mountain, and so on, that is desired to be proven?

original: ma dmigs pa kho na'i phyir bsgrub @27b par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa kho na'i phyir bsgrub @27b par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Since he is not observed at all, he is the object to be proven.

original: rdza mkhan yang mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rdza mkhan yang mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: and the potter is not perceived at all.

original: de ni grog mkhar 'ga' zhig la dmigs pa gnod do zhes rtsva la sogs pa la yang blo dang ldan pa dmigs pa la gnod pa med dam ci mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni grog mkhar 'ga' zhig la dmigs pa gnod do zhes rtsva la sogs pa la yang blo dang ldan pa dmigs pa la gnod pa med dam ci mngon sum gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is not so, because the cognition of an anthill is impaired, but the cognition of grass, etc. is not impaired. The idea is that this is because it is based on direct perception.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di brjod pa yin te //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di brjod pa yin te //
translated: If it is as you say, etc. This is what is being said:

original: re zhig gnod pa yod dam med kyang bla ste /
analyzed: re zhig gnod pa yod dam med kyang bla ste /
translated: Whether there is impairment or not,

original: lhag ma ni gdon mi za bar brtag par bya dgos so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gdon mi za bar brtag par bya dgos so //
translated: the rest must be considered without a doubt.

original: des na las bzhin du dbang phyug kyang ci ste mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na las bzhin du dbang phyug kyang ci ste mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the effect is impermanent, why is God not impermanent?

original: lan du de ci zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan du de ci zhes bya'o //
translated: The answer is: What is that?

original: de lta na ni 'di brtags pa tsam tu 'gyur na tshad ma'i 'jug pa bsam par bya ba yang yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'di brtags pa tsam tu 'gyur na tshad ma'i 'jug pa bsam par bya ba yang yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if it is so, then this is just a hypothesis, but the operation of valid cognition is to be considered.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If, on the other hand, etc. is another's.

original: sun 'byin pa ni des na de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni des na de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is: Therefore, even from that, etc.

original: 'di nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Another refutation of this is stated in the line beginning “Moreover, etc.”

original: 'bras bu grog mkhar de la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu grog mkhar de la yang ngo //
translated: The effect is the anthill.

original: gzhan gyis brtags pa nyid du dka' na zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brtags pa nyid du dka' na zhes smras so //
translated: It is difficult to imagine that it is made by another.

original: de zhes bya ba ni grog mkhar la rdza mkhan rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni grog mkhar la rdza mkhan rtog pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the potter’s imagining the anthill.

original: lan du dbang phyug la yang med dam ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du dbang phyug la yang med dam ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, “Is it not also the case with regard to God?”

original: phyed phyi ma'i rkang pa dang po 'chad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma'i rkang pa dang po 'chad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first line of the second half is explained in the line beginning “But, etc.”

original: gnyis pa 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second line is explained in the line beginning “If, etc.”

original: 'di dag kyang byas pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang byas pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line “These are not made, etc.”

original: ri la sogs pa dag skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes blta'o //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa dag skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes blta'o //
translated: means that mountains and so on are not made by a person.

original: ci phyed rgas pa 'dzin tam zhes bya ba ni phyed rgas pa la yod pa'i nor ni phyed rgas pa'i nor te /
analyzed: ci phyed rgas pa 'dzin tam zhes bya ba ni phyed rgas pa la yod pa'i nor ni phyed rgas pa'i nor te /
translated: The line “Is it the wealth of the aged, etc.” means that the wealth of the aged is the wealth of the aged.

original: ga hal sogs pa'i yin pa'i phyir cha'o //
analyzed: ga hal sogs pa'i yin pa'i phyir cha'o //
translated: The suffix “ka” is added because of the meaning of the root “hal” and so on.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig phyed rgas pa'i nor ni 'dod kyi de ni ma yin pa de bzhin du khyed kyang rdza mkhan dang / dbang phyug du rtogs pa gnod pa'i dbang gis rang rgas pa las dbang phyug gi cha 'dod pa 'di ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig phyed rgas pa'i nor ni 'dod kyi de ni ma yin pa de bzhin du khyed kyang rdza mkhan dang / dbang phyug du rtogs pa gnod pa'i dbang gis rang rgas pa las dbang phyug gi cha 'dod pa 'di ni mi 'thad do //
translated: For example, some people desire the wealth of an old man, but not the old man himself. In the same way, you desire the portion of the Lord that is the potter and the Lord that is Maheśvara, but not the portion that is old age. This is not tenable.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi mdzes par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi mdzes par ro //
translated: Otherwise means in an unattractive way.

original: 'chad pa ni ci skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni ci skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation is “What is the person who is the cause of the shape of a pot?”

original: des na 'di yang brtags pa tsam kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di yang brtags pa tsam kho na'o //
translated: Therefore this is mere speculation.

original: de'i phyir bum ba la sogs pa'i dbyibs skyes bu med na mi 'byung bar dmigs pa ci 'dra de 'dra ba ni ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa la ma yin pa'i phyir de la skyes bus byas pa nyid rjes su dpog pa ma yin no //🔽gal te de bzhin du sgra la byas pa las mi rtag ba nyid @28a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bum ba la sogs pa'i dbyibs skyes bu med na mi 'byung bar dmigs pa ci 'dra de 'dra ba ni ri dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa la ma yin pa'i phyir de la skyes bus byas pa nyid rjes su dpog pa ma yin no // gal te de bzhin du sgra la byas pa las mi rtag ba nyid @28a * //
translated: Thus, since the shape of a pot, etc., is observed to occur without a person, it is not inferred that a person is the cause of that shape.

original: kyang rjes su dpag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: kyang rjes su dpag par mi bya ste /
translated: If that is so, impermanence should not be inferred from being produced in the case of sound.

original: der yang bum pa la gnas pa'i byas ba nyid sgra la yod pa'am /
analyzed: der yang bum pa la gnas pa'i byas ba nyid sgra la yod pa'am /
translated: Moreover, the fact of being produced that resides in the pot does not exist in sound,

original: sgra la yod pa nyid bum pa la yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra la yod pa nyid bum pa la yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and the fact that it exists in sound does not exist in the pot.

original: sgra la byas pa nyid kyi phyir de lta mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra la byas pa nyid kyi phyir de lta mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that because sound is produced, it is not accepted that it is impermanent.

original: des na 'di ni ltag chod yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di ni ltag chod yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is a mere quibble,

original: chos tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos tha dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a conception of different attributes.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rang gi gzhung du 'dras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid 'di nyid /
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos rang gi gzhung du 'dras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid 'di nyid /
translated: In this way, the master Dignaga, in his own treatise, states this very definition of similarity:🔽The result itself by the part of another

original: 'bras nyid gzhan gyi cha yis ni //
analyzed: 'bras nyid gzhan gyi cha yis ni //
translated: The effect itself is not by the part of another.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs bas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di bsdus nas rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs bas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di bsdus nas rnam 'grel las /
translated: This is the doubt that is summarized in the Pramanavarttika:

original: bsgrub byas rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub byas rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: Because it is pervaded by the probandum.

original: re zhig gang gi tshe mngon sum la ltos nas khyad par can gyi rigs dang 'brel ba'i 'brel par rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe 'di rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gang gi tshe mngon sum la ltos nas khyad par can gyi rigs dang 'brel ba'i 'brel par rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe 'di rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to say that the relation is understood in terms of the relation of the specific to the universal, in dependence on perception.

original: gang gis bzlog na gnod pa can gyi rjes su dpog pa'i stobs kyi 'bras bu byas pa nyid la bsgrub bya mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis bzlog na gnod pa can gyi rjes su dpog pa'i stobs kyi 'bras bu byas pa nyid la bsgrub bya mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyis rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: If you object that this is reversed, then the result of the probative argument, impermanence, is pervaded by the universal of being produced, because of the relation of the specific to the universal.

original: spyir bsgrub byar byed pa la gang zhig 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad pa'i skyon brjod pa de'i tshe na kho bo cag gi lugs kyis de 'bras mtshungs su 'dod do //
analyzed: spyir bsgrub byar byed pa la gang zhig 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad pa'i skyon brjod pa de'i tshe na kho bo cag gi lugs kyis de 'bras mtshungs su 'dod do //
translated: If you object that it is faulty because the relation of the specific to the universal is different from the relation of the pervader to the pervaded, then in our system we accept that they are the same.

original: 'dir dbyi bas tsam la skyes bus byas pas sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'ga' yang med de //
analyzed: 'dir dbyi bas tsam la skyes bus byas pas sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'ga' yang med de //
translated: Here, there is no inference that proves that sound is produced by a person merely on the basis of the relation of the specific to the universal.

original: mngon sum yang me las du ba skye bar mthong ba ltar rigs kyi khyad par gyi yul can kho na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yang me las du ba skye bar mthong ba ltar rigs kyi khyad par gyi yul can kho na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as perception sees smoke arising from fire, it only understands the relation of cause and effect in terms of the object of a specific type.

original: des na 'dir yang gal te rigs kyi khyad par la brten pa skyon ma yin na de'i tshe gang du yang ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad las thams cad brtags par thal lo //
analyzed: des na 'dir yang gal te rigs kyi khyad par la brten pa skyon ma yin na de'i tshe gang du yang ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad las thams cad brtags par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, if the difference of type is not a fault here, then it follows that everything is imagined from everything, because it is not anywhere.

original: rigs kyi khyad par la brten na yang /
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par la brten na yang /
translated: Even if the difference of type is the basis,

original: khyab pa'i rigs kyi khyad par nyid las rjes su dpog pa yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyab pa'i rigs kyi khyad par nyid las rjes su dpog pa yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the inference is only from the pervader’s difference of type, not from anything else.

original: de'i phyir khyab pa spyir grub pa la ni 'di 'dra ba ltag chod kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab pa spyir grub pa la ni 'di 'dra ba ltag chod kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, when the pervasion is established in general, this is just a quibble.

original: ming ni cir yang gdags la rag go //
analyzed: ming ni cir yang gdags la rag go //
translated: A name can be designated in any way.

original: khyad par gyi khyab pa ma grub na ni lan nyid do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: khyad par gyi khyab pa ma grub na ni lan nyid do zhes gnas so //
translated: If the pervasion of the difference is not established, it is just a response.🔽If this very method of engaging the Pramānﬁ ava was accepted by the author of the Pramānﬁ ava,

original: gal te lang rnam 'grel la 'jug pa'i tshul 'di nyid bshad pa byed pas kyang bzhed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te lang rnam 'grel la 'jug pa'i tshul 'di nyid bshad pa byed pas kyang bzhed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: then it would be correct to explain the Pramānﬁ ava in this way.

original: de lta na yang rkang @28b mig gi lugs sun dbyung bar dgongs nas rnam pa gzhan du sbyar nas phyis gtso bo la sbyor ba na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rkang @28b mig gi lugs sun dbyung bar dgongs nas rnam pa gzhan du sbyar nas phyis gtso bo la sbyor ba na /
translated: Nevertheless, intending to refute the system of Bhaviveka, he applies it in a different way, and later applies it to the principal.

original: rnam 'grel de nyid la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel de nyid la 'jug pa ni /
translated: The commentary on that is:

original: gal te skyon 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te skyon 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is said that this is a fault, etc.

original: 'bras bu du ma'i phyir na 'bras mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni rkang mig gi mdo ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu du ma'i phyir na 'bras mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni rkang mig gi mdo ste /
translated: Because of the many effects, the effect is the same is the sutra of Bhaviveka.

original: 'bras bu rtsol byung de du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsol byung de du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect that arises from effort has many.

original: de nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on that is:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: As it is said, etc.

original: de bzhin du dbyibs gzhan gyi 'bras bu yang mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyibs gzhan gyi 'bras bu yang mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because the effect of a different shape is also seen,

original: bsgrub par bya ba blo dang ldan pa la gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba blo dang ldan pa la gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: the probandum is not ascertained as one for the intelligent.

original: dper na rtsol pa la byung ba nyid bsgrub bya 'bras bu nyid la gcig tu nges pa la yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsol pa la byung ba nyid bsgrub bya 'bras bu nyid la gcig tu nges pa la yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the probandum that arises from effort being ascertained as one in the effect.

original: des na ci ltar 'bras mtshungs te lan ltar snang ba yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na ci ltar 'bras mtshungs te lan ltar snang ba yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, just as the result is similar to the cause, in the same way, this is also so.

original: rnam 'grel gyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rtsol pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rtsol pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result of the Pramāṇavārttika is the result of effort.

original: brtsal ma thag pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is immediately upon exertion.🔽The object of the proof is the object of the proof that is immediately upon exertion.🔽How is it a fault to state separately?🔽He says result and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya bas 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dir mdo la yod pa'i rjes 'gro zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bas 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dir mdo la yod pa'i rjes 'gro zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
translated: Here, result and so on should be taken as referring to consequence in the sūtra.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yul ni sgrub byed brtsal ma thag pa nyid kyi yul la'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yul ni sgrub byed brtsal ma thag pa nyid kyi yul la'o //
translated: The object of the proof is the object of the proof that is immediately upon exertion.

original: ci ltar tha dad bar brjod pa'i skyon yin zhe na /🔽'bras bu nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽'di bsgrub bya brjod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu nyid brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar tha dad bar brjod pa'i skyon yin zhe na / 'bras bu nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so // 'di bsgrub bya brjod pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu nyid brjod pa ste /
translated: How is it a fault to state separately?🔽He says result and so on.🔽Here, result and so on should be taken as referring to consequence in the sūtra.

original: skabs kyis na brtsal ma thag pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: skabs kyis na brtsal ma thag pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The object of the proof is the object of the proof that is immediately upon exertion.

original: des na sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu rtsol ma thag pa nyid la 'brel pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa 'bras bu rtsol ma thag pa nyid la 'brel pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas brtags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the proof is examined in terms of the relation of the effect to the immediately preceding activity.

original: ci ltar brtsal ma thag pa'i sgras skyes pa dang mngon par gsal ba gnyig brjod pa de ltar ni gtan tshigs kyi 'khor lo bshad pa'i skabs su ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ltar brtsal ma thag pa'i sgras skyes pa dang mngon par gsal ba gnyig brjod pa de ltar ni gtan tshigs kyi 'khor lo bshad pa'i skabs su ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the words “immediately upon activity” express both production and manifestation, so it will be shown in the section on the wheel of reasoning.

original: tshul 'dis 'grel pa can tha dad pa tha dad par brjod pa'i skyon gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: tshul 'dis 'grel pa can tha dad pa tha dad par brjod pa'i skyon gang yin pa de ni /
translated: By this method, the fault of expressing the difference of the different commentaries is

original: 'bras mtshungs yin te /
analyzed: 'bras mtshungs yin te /
translated: the same as the effect.

original: rtag ba la gsal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag ba la gsal ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because manifestation is impossible for the permanent.🔽Even though manifestation exists, it is not a contradiction in the Vaiśeṣika system.

original: gsal ba yod kyang rigs pa can gyi lugs kyis ltag chod ma yin no zhes ston ba ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsal ba yod kyang rigs pa can gyi lugs kyis ltag chod ma yin no zhes ston ba ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To show this, he says, “In that case,” and so on.

original: sgra ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Sound is the effect because it is immediately upon activity.

original: brtsal ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang spang ste /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang spang ste /
translated: This and so on should be rejected.

original: @29a * // gzhan 'ba' zhig tu yin par ni ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: @29a * // gzhan 'ba' zhig tu yin par ni ma zad pa'o //
translated: It is not only the other.

original: brjod pa'i rnam pa bshad pas ni rtsol bas sgrib pa gsal ba gang yin pa de las mngon par gsal bar gyur pa la yang brtsal ma thag pa nyid yod pa kho na yin pa des nam des pa yin no zhes de ltar yang mi 'gal na zhes
analyzed: brjod pa'i rnam pa bshad pas ni rtsol bas sgrib pa gsal ba gang yin pa de las mngon par gsal bar gyur pa la yang brtsal ma thag pa nyid yod pa kho na yin pa des nam des pa yin no zhes de ltar yang mi 'gal na zhes
translated: The explanation of the mode of expression is that the manifestation of the object of activity of the effort that is the manifestation of the object of activity of the effort that is the clearing away of the obscurations is also the very thing that is the immediate antecedent of the manifestation.

original: bya ba de'i tshe yang 'gal ba ma yin no'o //
analyzed: bya ba de'i tshe yang 'gal ba ma yin no'o //
translated: Thus, if it is not contradictory in that way, then it is not contradictory at that time.

original: ma nges pa'i nyes brjod par byed pas 'gal bar mi byed na'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i nyes brjod par byed pas 'gal bar mi byed na'o //
translated: If one does not make a contradiction by stating the fault of inconclusiveness,

original: de ltar byas pa'i rigs pa can la sogs ba'i lugs ltar na ni ma nges pa nyid brjod par 'gyur bas ltag chod ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas pa'i rigs pa can la sogs ba'i lugs ltar na ni ma nges pa nyid brjod par 'gyur bas ltag chod ma yin no //
translated: then it is not a reductio since it would be stated as inconclusiveness according to the system of the logicians and so on who do it that way.

original: 'o na khyod kyi ltar na ci ltar ltag chod yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi ltar na ci ltar ltag chod yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it a reductio according to you?

original: 'on kyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Nevertheless, it is said.

original: mngon par gsal ba dang skye ba yongs su dor pa'i spyis kyang brtsal ma thag pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba dang skye ba yongs su dor pa'i spyis kyang brtsal ma thag pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even by the generality that abandons manifestation and arising, the immediate antecedent and so on are established.

original: gal te khyad par gnyis srid pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gnyis srid pa yin na /
translated: If it is possible that there are two attributes,

original: ji ltar yongs su dor nas sgrub byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su dor nas sgrub byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be established by abandoning it?

original: gang gi phyir zhes rtag pa la ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes rtag pa la ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because of that, it is said, “in the case of permanence. ”

original: byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi gsal ba yang ngo //
analyzed: byed pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi gsal ba yang ngo //
translated: Not only is the activity, but also the manifestation.

original: 'gal ba ni tshad mas mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni tshad mas mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: The contradiction is that it is not tenable by valid cognition.

original: des na khyad par gnyi ga mi srid pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi ltar na ma nges pa brjod pa ni ltag chod do //
analyzed: des na khyad par gnyi ga mi srid pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi ltar na ma nges pa brjod pa ni ltag chod do //
translated: Therefore, since both distinctions are impossible, for us, the expression of uncertainty is a reductio.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtag ba la mngon par gsal ba srid na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtag ba la mngon par gsal ba srid na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if manifestation were possible in the case of permanence,

original: 'dir rkang mig gi lan no //
analyzed: 'dir rkang mig gi lan no //
translated: Here is the response of Akṣapāda.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this.

original: rtag pa la ni gsal bar 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la ni gsal bar 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: It is only the manifestation that is asserted in the case of permanence.

original: de lta na yang spyis kyang sgrub bar byed ba yin bzhin du tha dad pa'i skyon brjod pa ni ltag chod kho na yin gyis ma nges pa nyid du brjod ba bden ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang spyis kyang sgrub bar byed ba yin bzhin du tha dad pa'i skyon brjod pa ni ltag chod kho na yin gyis ma nges pa nyid du brjod ba bden ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even so, the expression of the fault of difference, while the proof is in the form of the universal, is a reductio. It is not truly an expression of uncertainty,

original: sgra mngon par gsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra mngon par gsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the manifestation of sound is not tenable.

original: 'bras bu gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The explanation of “If the effect were different” and so on is as follows.

original: gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag ba nyid mngon par gsal ba dang / skye ba'i gsal ba nyid rnam pa gnyis yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag ba nyid mngon par gsal ba dang / skye ba'i gsal ba nyid rnam pa gnyis yin na'o //
translated: If it were different, it would be twofold: the manifestation that is immediately antecedent to the effort and the manifestation that is produced.

original: 'on te sgra la mi dmigs pa'i rgyu bar chod la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te sgra la mi dmigs pa'i rgyu bar chod la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: But in the case of sound, there is an obstruction to the cause of nonapprehension.

original: des na rtsol ba rgyu ma yin pa ni 'dod ba kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: des na rtsol ba rgyu ma yin pa ni 'dod ba kho na'o snyam na /
translated: Therefore, it is only asserted that effort is not a cause.

original: sgra la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Sound is not like that.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni bar chod kyi rgyu mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni bar chod kyi rgyu mi 'thad pas so //
translated: “ Therefore” means because it is not tenable that there is an obstruction to the cause.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //🔽de la zhes bya ba @29b ni ka ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'o // de la zhes bya ba @29b ni ka ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to sound.🔽“ In that” refers to a pillar, etc.

original: nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The summary is “Therefore.”

original: skye ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not produced.

original: sgra la ni bar chod kyi rgyu 'ga' yang ma dmigs te /
analyzed: sgra la ni bar chod kyi rgyu 'ga' yang ma dmigs te /
translated: No cause of obstruction to sound is observed at all.

original: des na brtsal ma thag pa ni skye ba'i sgo nyid nas yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //🔽'di sun 'byin pa ni ka ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sgra la'ang gsal ma thag tu mngon par gsal ba de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang las ci ltar zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du gzhal bya dang tshad ma
analyzed: des na brtsal ma thag pa ni skye ba'i sgo nyid nas yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o // 'di sun 'byin pa ni ka ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sgra la'ang gsal ma thag tu mngon par gsal ba de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang las ci ltar zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du gzhal bya dang tshad ma
translated: Therefore, it is thought that the momentariness of sound is established by the very door of its arising.🔽The refutation of this is as follows: Not only is the momentariness of a pillar not established by the very door of its arising, but also the momentariness of sound is not established by the very door of its arising.

original: dag spangs ba'o //
analyzed: dag spangs ba'o //
translated: The momentariness of sound is not established by the very door of its arising.🔽If one cannot understand this,

original: gang gi tshe 'di rtogs par mi nus shen /🔽gal te mngon par gsal ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di rtogs par mi nus shen / gal te mngon par gsal ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the momentariness of sound is not established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.

original: gal te mngon par gsal ba dang / 'grel pa rtag pa la yang 'thad pa dang ldan ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te mngon par gsal ba dang / 'grel pa rtag pa la yang 'thad pa dang ldan ba yin te /
translated: If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.🔽If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.

original: nyes ba brten pa ma yin pa de'i tshe sgra la de ma thag tu gsal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes ba brten pa ma yin pa de'i tshe sgra la de ma thag tu gsal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the momentariness of sound were established by the very door of its arising, then the momentariness of a permanent manifestation would also be established by the very door of its arising.

original: 'on te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If the momentariness of

original: bar chod pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ni gsal bar rtogs pa med pa med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bar chod pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ni gsal bar rtogs pa med pa med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: The reason for the obstacle, etc., is not the non-existence of the non-perception of the manifest.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni nges pa med pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyu gang ci yang rung ba bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni nges pa med pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyu gang ci yang rung ba bzung ste /
translated: The word “etc.” includes whatever reason for non-perception there may be, such as uncertainty, etc.

original: dper na bram zes gnas pa'i rlung brtags pa'i lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bram zes gnas pa'i rlung brtags pa'i lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the view of the Brahmins who imagine the wind to be a substance.

original: de yang ma mthong ba kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: de yang ma mthong ba kho na'o snyam na /
translated: And that is not seen at all.

original: lan du de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: “That is not true.”

original: bum pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la bar chad la sogs par brtag par ni ma zad de sgra la'ang ngo //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la bar chad la sogs par brtag par ni ma zad de sgra la'ang ngo //
translated: It is not only a pot, etc., that is imagined to be an obstacle, etc., but also sound.

original: yang 'di 'dra ba'i rtog pa de ga las yin snyam na /
analyzed: yang 'di 'dra ba'i rtog pa de ga las yin snyam na /
translated: Moreover, where does this kind of imagination come from?

original: gang gi phyir sgra ni 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra ni 'jig pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Because sound is not destroyed.

original: dmigs pa'i snga rol du zhes rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: dmigs pa'i snga rol du zhes rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: It should be understood that it is not destroyed prior to perception.

original: / ci'i phyir mi 'jig ce na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir mi 'jig ce na /
translated: Why is it not destroyed?

original: ngo shes pa ni yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is recognized.

original: bum pa la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: Also, with regard to a pot, etc.,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “Or” refers to the other.

original: mi dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na yang skyes bu gzhan gyis dmigs pa'i phyir na bum pa 'di ni gnas ba kho na'o zhes de ltar rtogs ba yin na'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na yang skyes bu gzhan gyis dmigs pa'i phyir na bum pa 'di ni gnas ba kho na'o zhes de ltar rtogs ba yin na'o //
translated: “This pot is just as it is” means that it is perceived by another person in the state of non-perception.

original: sun 'byin pa ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Refutation” refers to the other.

original: de ltar rtogs kyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa 'di ni gnas pa kho na'o snyam par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs kyi zhes bya ba ni bum pa 'di ni gnas pa kho na'o snyam par rtogs pa'o //
translated: “It is understood in this way” means that it is understood that “this pot is just as it is.”

original: ci ltar gzhan gyi dmigs pa las gzhan de ltar rtogs pa yin zhen /
analyzed: ci ltar gzhan gyi dmigs pa las gzhan de ltar rtogs pa yin zhen /
translated: How is it understood from the perception of another in this way?

original: brgyud nas zhes gsungs @30a * //
analyzed: brgyud nas zhes gsungs @30a * //
translated: “Indirectly” is stated.

original: te / gzhan gyis dmigs nas bum pa yod ces brjod pa de las gzhan la de ltar rtogs ba skye ste de ltar na brgyud nas gzhan gyis dmigs pa las de ltar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: te / gzhan gyis dmigs nas bum pa yod ces brjod pa de las gzhan la de ltar rtogs ba skye ste de ltar na brgyud nas gzhan gyis dmigs pa las de ltar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: From the statement “The pot exists” by another who perceives it, understanding arises in another in that way. Thus, it is understood in that way from the perception of another indirectly.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “By oneself” should be connected with the previous.

original: dngos su zhes bya ba ni dngos su byed pa'i shes pa las so //
analyzed: dngos su zhes bya ba ni dngos su byed pa'i shes pa las so //
translated: “Directly” means from the cognition that is directly produced.
