original: chen po yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyis mthong bas ni ngo shes bas brtan par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyis mthong bas ni ngo shes bas brtan par rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the other’s perception does not ascertain the object as permanent.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba gang zhig da ltar mthong ba de ni gzhan gyis bar du mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ngo shes pa las gzhan gyis shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sngar mthong ba gang zhig da ltar mthong ba de ni gzhan gyis bar du mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ngo shes pa las gzhan gyis shes pa ma yin no //
translated: “ Moreover” means that the object seen previously is not recognized as the same as the object seen now by the other, because the object seen by the other is not recognized.

original: de lta ma yin na res 'ga' gzhan kho na zhig gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na res 'ga' gzhan kho na zhig gzhan gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, sometimes the other would understand the other.

original: des na ngo shes pa la ma brten par gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: des na ngo shes pa la ma brten par gzhan las kyang /
translated: Thus, without relying on recognition, the other cannot understand the object as permanent.

original: de rtag pa nyid du ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de rtag pa nyid du ci ltar rtogs /
translated: How can it be understood as permanent?

original: de'i phyir gang dag ngo shes pa chad ma yin pa dang / rtag pa la mngon par gsal ba yang 'dod pa de'i ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag ngo shes pa chad ma yin pa dang / rtag pa la mngon par gsal ba yang 'dod pa de'i ltar na /
translated: Therefore, for those who assert that recognition is neither interrupted nor manifest in the permanent,

original: ma nges pa nyid brjod pa 'di ni lan ltar snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid brjod pa 'di ni lan ltar snang ba ma yin te /
translated: this statement of uncertainty is not a plausible response.

original: spyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal does not prove it.

original: kho bo cag gi lugs ltar na ni /🔽bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi lugs ltar na ni / bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: In our system,🔽it is the opposite.

original: lan ltar snang ba kho na'o zhes gnas so //
analyzed: lan ltar snang ba kho na'o zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is only a semblance of an answer.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na kho bo cag gi sun 'byin pa nyid skabs su bab pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na kho bo cag gi sun 'byin pa nyid skabs su bab pa yin te /
translated: For this very reason, our refutation is the one that is appropriate,

original: dbyibs la sogs pa'i spyi chen po la ni ma khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa'i spyi chen po la ni ma khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: because the universal of shape, etc. does not pervade.

original: gang yang 'dir ngo shes pa la brten ba nyid gsal ba'i don du tre lo ca nas sgra yongs su brtag par brjod pa de ni gzhan du bsam par bya ba yin pas re zhig bzhag go //
analyzed: gang yang 'dir ngo shes pa la brten ba nyid gsal ba'i don du tre lo ca nas sgra yongs su brtag par brjod pa de ni gzhan du bsam par bya ba yin pas re zhig bzhag go //
translated: Also, the examination of sound that is stated by Trelochanas the very meaning of manifestation based on recognition is to be considered elsewhere, so it is set aside for the moment.

original: da ni rnam 'grel gyi don ji lta ba nyid la sbyar ba'i don du yang na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni rnam 'grel gyi don ji lta ba nyid la sbyar ba'i don du yang na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to apply the meaning of the Pramanavarttika to reality, the word “or” is stated.

original: de skad du bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It is stated in that way”

original: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'gro'i phyir 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'gro'i phyir 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i rnam par 'grel ba'o /
translated: is the commentary on the statement, “Because it follows the probandum, it is the effect.”

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni 'bras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase in this refers to the characteristic of having the same effect.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni byas ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni byas ba'o //
translated: The phrase the effect refers to the produced.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni bum ba la yod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni bum ba la yod pas so //
translated: The phrase by another refers to the vase.

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la 'dir cir 'gyur zhes sbyor ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la 'dir cir 'gyur zhes sbyor ro //
translated: The phrase at that time is to be supplied from the commentary.

original: mi rtag pa dag la med do zhes rtsod par byed na zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dag la med do zhes rtsod par byed na zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase if one argues that impermanent things do not have it is to be supplied.

original: 'gal ba @30b ltar snang ba ni mthun ba'i phyogs la med pa tsam las bsams nas so //
analyzed: 'gal ba @30b ltar snang ba ni mthun ba'i phyogs la med pa tsam las bsams nas so //
translated: The phrase it appears to be contradictory is to be supplied.

original: rtag pa la yang med do zhes rtsod par byed pa yin na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rtag pa la yang med do zhes rtsod par byed pa yin na zhes 'brel to //
translated: The phrase if one argues that permanent things do not have it is to be supplied.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: mi rtag pa 'ba' ni ga tu ni ma zad de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa 'ba' ni ga tu ni ma zad de /
translated: The phrase not only impermanent things is to be supplied.

original: rtag pa dag la yang ched do zhes so //🔽gal te byas pa tsam la mi rtag pas khyab pa tshad mas des na ni sgra la yang god pa med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dag la yang ched do zhes so // gal te byas pa tsam la mi rtag pas khyab pa tshad mas des na ni sgra la yang god pa med do //
translated: The phrase but also permanent things is to be supplied.🔽If one argues that the mere fact of being produced is not sufficient to establish that sound is impermanent, then the argument is not refuted.

original: des na gcig kyang sun 'byin ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ltar snang ba sgra'i don to //
analyzed: des na gcig kyang sun 'byin ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ltar snang ba sgra'i don to //
translated: The phrase therefore, neither is refuted is the meaning of the word only.

original: des na 'di nyid 'bras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid du rigs so zhes thugs la bzhag nas /
analyzed: des na 'di nyid 'bras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid du rigs so zhes thugs la bzhag nas /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to posit this as the definition of a similar reason.

original: rkang mig gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rkang mig gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The definition of the eye-witness is stated as:

original: ngo shes pa'i tshad ma dang / rtag pa gsal bar khas blangs pas na ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i tshad ma dang / rtag pa gsal bar khas blangs pas na ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he accepts that a valid cognition which recognizes and a permanent thing are manifest, he is uncertain.

original: gal te rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sun 'byin pa'i 'bras mtshungs yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sun 'byin pa'i 'bras mtshungs yin na /
translated: If this kind of refutation is a similar reason,

original: 'o na rnam rtog mtshungs ba ji ltar gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam rtog mtshungs ba ji ltar gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: then how is it that the conceptualization is similar?

original: rnam rtog mtshungs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam rtog mtshungs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The conceptualization is similar is stated.

original: byas pa nyid kyis byas pa bsgrub bya dang dpe chos mtshungs pas chos mthun na yang ngo //
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyis byas pa bsgrub bya dang dpe chos mtshungs pas chos mthun na yang ngo //
translated: If the reason is similar to the property of the example, then the reason is similar to the property of the thesis.

original: khyad par tshos pa nyid dang / mig gi gzung bya nyid la sogs pa dang brjod par nye bar bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par tshos pa nyid dang / mig gi gzung bya nyid la sogs pa dang brjod par nye bar bgrod pa'o //
translated: The difference is that the property of the thesis is the property of the example, such as being burned, being the object of the eye, and so on, and is approached by the expression.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: For example is explained.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag ba'i phyir sgra mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin no zhes sngar brjod pa gang yin pa de bzhin du bum pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can sgra chos can sgra chos mthun pa nyid sgrub par byed pa byas pas byas pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag ba'i phyir sgra mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin no zhes sngar brjod pa gang yin pa de bzhin du bum pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can sgra chos can sgra chos mthun pa nyid sgrub par byed pa byas pas byas pa ste /
translated: As before means that just as it was previously stated, “Sound is impermanent because of being a product, like a pot,” so too, the pot and the probandum, the subject, sound, are similar in being the probandum, being a product.

original: de chos can sgra la mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par byas pa na /
analyzed: de chos can sgra la mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par byas pa na /
translated: When that is the subject, sound, the probandum,

original: sun 'byin pa brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is like stating a refutation.

original: ci skad brjod ce na ;
analyzed: ci skad brjod ce na ;
translated: What is stated?

original: bum pa nyid mi rtag pa yin gyis gzhan sgra ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa nyid mi rtag pa yin gyis gzhan sgra ni ma yin te /
translated: A pot is impermanent, but sound is not,

original: tshos par bya ba nyid dang / mig gis gzung ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshos par bya ba nyid dang / mig gis gzung ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: because it is not an object of burning and it is not apprehended by the eye.

original: gal te rnam pa 'di lta bu'i nyes pa khyed ci ltar spang zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'di lta bu'i nyes pa khyed ci ltar spang zhes dogs na /
translated: If you think, “How can we avoid such a fault?”

original: mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas spang pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni skyon gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu la ni sngar brjod pa lan yin no //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas spang pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni skyon gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu la ni sngar brjod pa lan yin no //
translated: The conclusion by way of rejection is “Therefore, . . .” “Here” refers to the above-mentioned reply to the objection.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: phyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Even later . . .” and so on.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If . . .” is the opponent’s position.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba dbang phyug sun 'byin par yang 'bras mtshungs dang 'dra ba nyid do @31a * //🔽zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba dbang phyug sun 'byin par yang 'bras mtshungs dang 'dra ba nyid do @31a * // zhes 'brel to //
translated: “Here too . . .” connects the refutation of Īśvara with the same result.

original: dper na sgra la sogs par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na sgra la sogs par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: For example, in the proof that sound is impermanent, the crow is irrelevant.

original: bya rog nag po 'brel ba med pa yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: bya rog nag po 'brel ba med pa yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is just like that.

original: gal te 'di gzhi dang gzhi can 'brel ba ma grub pa ma yin nam skabs su bab pa ni de ltar ma yin no zhes dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di gzhi dang gzhi can 'brel ba ma grub pa ma yin nam skabs su bab pa ni de ltar ma yin no zhes dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: If you say that the relation between the basis and the property to be proven is not established, do not worry that this is not relevant here.

original: shin tu ma 'brel ba tsam gyis 'di dper brjod pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu ma 'brel ba tsam gyis 'di dper brjod pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because I want to use this as an example of mere irrelevance.

original: 'o na gang zhig sgrub byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig sgrub byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the proof?

original: dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: He says, “The shape, etc.”

original: gal te thams cad thams cad du 'dod pa bsgrub par 'gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad thams cad du 'dod pa bsgrub par 'gyur mod ce na /
translated: If it is argued that “everything is the proof of everything,”

original: rigs gzhan las ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: rigs gzhan las ni zhes smos te /
translated: he says, “from another class,”

original: bum pa la sogs ba la rab tu grub pa'i skyes bu ni dbyibs dbyibs zhes bya ba'i sgra'i spyi mthong ba las ril sogs pa la sgrub par byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs ba la rab tu grub pa'i skyes bu ni dbyibs dbyibs zhes bya ba'i sgra'i spyi mthong ba las ril sogs pa la sgrub par byed par mi rigs so //
translated: because it is not reasonable to prove a universal such as “shape” in a pot, etc., by seeing the universal “shape” in a man who is well known to possess it.

original: de yod pas zhes bya ba ni sgra yod pas so //
analyzed: de yod pas zhes bya ba ni sgra yod pas so //
translated: “Because of its existence” means because of the existence of the sound.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i brjod bya nyid rjes su 'jug pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i brjod bya nyid rjes su 'jug pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs pa'o //
translated: “Accepted by the other” means accepted as the proof of the pervasion of the mere object of expression of the sound.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'i brjod bya nyid rjes su 'gro bar sgrub byed yin pa yang spangs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'i brjod bya nyid rjes su 'gro bar sgrub byed yin pa yang spangs pas so //
translated: “This” means the mere object of expression of the sound.

original: ser skya la sogs kyi zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyal ba ba bzung ngo //
analyzed: ser skya la sogs kyi zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni rgyal ba ba bzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” in “Kapila, etc.” includes Kanada.

original: sems med sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni nang ma yin pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sems med sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni nang ma yin pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are not mind, etc.” includes the reason “because they are not internal.”

original: mi rtag sogs phyir zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i bsgrub bya bde ba la sogs pa sems med pa dang / nang ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag sogs phyir zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i bsgrub bya bde ba la sogs pa sems med pa dang / nang ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed do //
translated: The phrase “because of impermanence, etc.” refers to the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye ba can la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye ba can la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they arise.”

original: dang gi sgras ni sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i nam mkha'i gos can rnams kyi shing rnams shun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i gtan tshigs de las sems dang ldan ba yang dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i nam mkha'i gos can rnams kyi shing rnams shun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i gtan tshigs de las sems dang ldan ba yang dpyad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.

original: dang gi sgra yang gi don can ni 'dir yang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dang gi sgra yang gi don can ni 'dir yang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they arise.”🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa sems ba med pa can nam gzhan shing rnams sems pa can dag mi rtag ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sgrub byed gang las so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sems ba med pa can nam gzhan shing rnams sems pa can dag mi rtag ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sgrub byed gang las so //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they are impermanent” and so on, which proves that pleasure, etc., are not mind, are not internal, etc.🔽The phrase “and so on” in the line “because they are impermanent, etc.” includes the reason “because they

original: grub ba nyid khang bzangs yin te de'i rtser 'dzeg par 'gyur ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed de yang sgra tsam mtshungs pa nye bar 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: grub ba nyid khang bzangs yin te de'i rtser 'dzeg par 'gyur ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed de yang sgra tsam mtshungs pa nye bar 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: The mansion itself is the establishment, and the one who ascends to the top of that is the proof of impermanence, etc.  That is also just the mere similarity of the sound.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don gyi de kho na nyid @31b med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gyi de kho na nyid @31b med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no reality of the object.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgras bstan par bya ba'i don dngos por med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sgras bstan par bya ba'i don dngos por med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object that is to be taught by the words “impermanence,” etc. does not exist as a thing.

original: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'don pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don de med pa'i phyir ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'don pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don de med pa'i phyir ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The reading “because there is no object” should be understood as “because there is no object of impermanence, etc.”

original: re zhig grangs can la ltos nas 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig grangs can la ltos nas 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the clarification in regard to the Sāṃkhya, which is expressed by “in this way.”

original: grangs can de'i phyir mi rtag pa ni mi gsal ba yin gyi zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: grangs can de'i phyir mi rtag pa ni mi gsal ba yin gyi zhes 'brel to //
translated: In regard to the Sāṃkhya, “impermanence” is not clear.

original: mi gsal ba'i mi rtag ba nyid sgrub byed du ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i mi rtag ba nyid sgrub byed du ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would the proof of impermanence that is not clear not be suitable?

original: mngon par mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon par mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “The nonmanifest” is stated.

original: phyir rgol ba ma grub ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba ma grub ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the opponent is not established.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Now, this is the other party's.

original: skal ba zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: skal ba zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'dri ba'o //
translated: What is this? The proponent of tenets asks.

original: mi mngon pa'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: mi mngon pa'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: The imperceptible self is the other party's response.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Now, this is the tenets.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa zhes la sogs pa'i sgras ni skyes bu rnams gzung ngo //🔽'on te mi mngon pa tsam gyis ni mi rtag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa zhes la sogs pa'i sgras ni skyes bu rnams gzung ngo // 'on te mi mngon pa tsam gyis ni mi rtag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The word etc. in primal substance, etc. includes persons.🔽If you think that it is not impermanent merely because it is imperceptible,

original: 'on kyang yod pa mi mngon pa'i zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa mi mngon pa'i zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: but rather that it is impermanent because its existence is imperceptible,

original: yod pa mi mngon pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa mi mngon pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that its existence is imperceptible.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa mi rtag par thal ba spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa mi rtag par thal ba spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni snang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the qualm that the consequence of primal substance, etc. being impermanent is to be rejected is appearance.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa ni gtan du mi snang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa ni gtan du mi snang ba kho na ste /
translated: Primal substance, etc. are only never seen.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not impermanent.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig zhes bya ba sun 'byin ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig zhes bya ba sun 'byin ba ste /
translated: What is this so-called appearance? This is the refutation.

original: shes pa'am shes bya ba'i rang bzhin yin zhes rnam par rtog pa nyid zhe la gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'am shes bya ba'i rang bzhin yin zhes rnam par rtog pa nyid zhe la gzhag pa yin no //
translated: It is the nature of cognition or the cognized object.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po sun dbyung ba'i phyir gal te don gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po sun dbyung ba'i phyir gal te don gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: The first conception is refuted by “If the object . . . ”

original: de'i tshe ji ltar snang ba bltar rung ba mi snang ba bltar mi rung bar 'gyur snang bzhin pa gang yin pa de nyid ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar snang ba bltar rung ba mi snang ba bltar mi rung bar 'gyur snang bzhin pa gang yin pa de nyid ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: At that time, how could the visible appearance become invisible? What is appearing now does not become invisible.

original: 'gyur na ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur na ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is the problem if it does?

original: de spangs na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de spangs na zhes gsungs te /
translated: “If it is abandoned . . . ” is stated.

original: snang ba nyid spangs na ste /
analyzed: snang ba nyid spangs na ste /
translated: If appearance itself is abandoned,

original: don gyis na tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyis na tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: the meaning is that it is not different.

original: gnyis pa gsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa gsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is stated for the sake of clarity: “If it is not . . . ”

original: de zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i bdag nyid med pa nyid ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i bdag nyid med pa nyid ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin /
translated: “That” refers to the absence of the nature of appearance. How could it not be a subsequent nature?

original: rjes su 'gron ni de nyid gnas par thal bas dngos po snang ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gron ni de nyid gnas par thal bas dngos po snang ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a subsequent nature, it would follow that it would endure, and it would be an entity that appears.

original: @32a * // cha 'gas rjes su 'gro yang snang ba nyid du 'gyur bar mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: @32a * // cha 'gas rjes su 'gro yang snang ba nyid du 'gyur bar mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that even though it is a subsequent nature, it cannot be an appearance,

original: 'o na snang bar 'gyur ba de nyid shes pa yin par smra ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na snang bar 'gyur ba de nyid shes pa yin par smra ba yin na /
translated: then you are saying that the appearance itself is consciousness.

original: de yang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang med pa kho na'o //
translated: But that is completely nonexistent.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gnas na de la ci zhig byung na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gnas na de la ci zhig byung na /
translated: If the nature of an entity endures, what happens to it?

original: gang gi dngos po med pa de rjes su 'gro ba med bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi dngos po med pa de rjes su 'gro ba med bar mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is nonexistent, it cannot be a subsequent nature.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med par gzhig pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med par gzhig pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, how could it not be destroyed without a subsequent nature?

original: 'on te yang shes pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa kho nar zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te yang shes pa ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa kho nar zhig pa yin la /
translated: But if consciousness is destroyed without a subsequent nature,

original: don ni bskal pa yin la /
analyzed: don ni bskal pa yin la /
translated: and the object is separate,

original: mi rtag pa yang de nyid yin na des na sgra tsam mtshungs pa nye bar bkod pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang de nyid yin na des na sgra tsam mtshungs pa nye bar bkod pa ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If it is the same thing as impermanent, then how is it that mere sound is cited as an example?

original: gzhan med na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan med na zhes gsungs te /
translated: If there is no other,

original: shes pa med na don gzhan bskal pa bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa med na don gzhan bskal pa bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if there is no consciousness, then the object will not be different even for an eon.

original: 'on kyang don gtso bo dang 'dra bar na gtan du mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas mi rtag pa nyid med par thal lo zhes bshad pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang don gtso bo dang 'dra bar na gtan du mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas mi rtag pa nyid med par thal lo zhes bshad pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: However, if it is like the principal object, then it follows that it is not impermanent, since it is an entity that is never seen.

original: don de yang ngo //
analyzed: don de yang ngo //
translated: That object is also like that.

original: gang gi phyir de ltang dngos po'i gnas par sgrub byed ma grub pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltang dngos po'i gnas par sgrub byed ma grub pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof of the existence of an entity is not established in that way.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa tshad mas rab tu grub pa gang yin pa de yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa tshad mas rab tu grub pa gang yin pa de yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is established by valid cognition as impermanent and so on is not a proof,

original: bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med ba'i phyir ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med ba'i phyir ro zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: because there is no valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: sems pa can du sgrub pa'i rtags kyang sgra mtshungs par bkod pa tsam yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni shun pa thams cad bshus na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa can du sgrub pa'i rtags kyang sgra mtshungs par bkod pa tsam yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni shun pa thams cad bshus na zhes bya'o //
translated: The reason proving that it is a sentient being is stated by the mere similarity of sound.

original: 'on te 'di ni sangs rgyas pa la grub pa kho na ma yin nam des na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni sangs rgyas pa la grub pa kho na ma yin nam des na /
translated: But isn't this established only for the Buddhists?

original: de skad ji ste brjod snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: de skad ji ste brjod snyam du dogs na /
translated: So how can it be said in that way?

original: rnam shes la sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam shes la sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: The statement consciousness, etc. is made.

original: ma grub pa ni the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni the tshom za ba'o //
translated: Non-establishment is doubt.

original: sangs rgyas pa gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The statement for which Buddhist and so on is the explanation.

original: de la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang dbang po la sogs pa 'gags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa dang dbang po la sogs pa 'gags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The statement and so on refers to the nature of the cessation of consciousness, faculties, and so on.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gags pa ni shing rnams la yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gags pa ni shing rnams la yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If it is asked, Isn't the cessation of consciousness, etc. found only in trees?

original: de'i phyir 'gags pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'chi ba ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gags pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'chi ba ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: Therefore, how is death not established by the nature of cessation?

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The statement the cessation of consciousness is made.

original: de bzhin du tshe 'gags pa yang tshe med pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes ba lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshe 'gags pa yang tshe med pa la yod pa ma yin no zhes ba lta bar bya'o //
translated: So too, the cessation of life is not in the absence of life.

original: gang gis tha dad @32b par ston pa ci tshe rnam par shes pa lus tha dad pa yin nam zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gang gis tha dad @32b par ston pa ci tshe rnam par shes pa lus tha dad pa yin nam zhes dogs na /
translated: If one asks, “By what is it taught to be different?”

original: tshe ni srog yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe ni srog yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Life is the life force, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'gags pa khas len na sems pa yod pa'i sgrub byed nye bar bgod pa'i don med par thal ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'gags pa khas len na sems pa yod pa'i sgrub byed nye bar bgod pa'i don med par thal ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If one accepts that the cessation of consciousness, etc. is prior, then it follows that the proof of the existence of intention is pointless.

original: 'on te yang shing dag la 'chi ba khas blangs kyang sems pa khas blangs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang shing dag la 'chi ba khas blangs kyang sems pa khas blangs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if one accepts death in trees, one does not accept intention.

original: des na de'i sgrub byed 'god pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na de'i sgrub byed 'god pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, it is the proof of that that is presented.

original: 'chi ba khas len na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'chi ba khas len na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one accepts death, etc.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa sngon du 'gro ba 'gogs pa'i rang bzhin 'chi ba yin par khas mi len pa des na sangs rgyas pa 'di /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa sngon du 'gro ba 'gogs pa'i rang bzhin 'chi ba yin par khas mi len pa des na sangs rgyas pa 'di /
translated: Since you do not accept that death is the nature of cessation that is preceded by existence, then,

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni skam pa tsam mo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni skam pa tsam mo //
translated: “that” refers to just drying up.

original: de yang grub po zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba de yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang grub po zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba de yang ngo //
translated: If you say that that also exists, “that” refers to death.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “Or” refers to another.

original: 'chi ba'i don mthong ba gang yin pa de las sgra der brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i don mthong ba gang yin pa de las sgra der brjod par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word “death” is seen.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not produced without that.

original: lan du / 'chi ba grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan du / 'chi ba grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In response, it is said, “If death exists,” and so on.

original: de'i sgras ni 'chi ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: de'i sgras ni 'chi ba'i sgra'o //
translated: The word “that” refers to the word “death.”

original: 'brel pa ni 'chi ba las zhes rtogs bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni 'chi ba las zhes rtogs bar bya'o //
translated: The connection is to be understood as “from death.”

original: de las zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sgra las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sgra las so //
translated: “From that” refers to the word “death.”

original: de lta bu'i 'chi ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'chi ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “Such death” and so on explains that.

original: de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba yin na /
translated: If it arises from seeing such death,

original: de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba'i sgra las 'chi ba grub la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba'i sgra las 'chi ba grub la /
translated: The sound that arises from seeing such a death establishes death.

original: 'chi ba grub na yang de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba'i sgra grub pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba grub na yang de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba'i sgra grub pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: And if death is established, then the sound that arises from seeing such a death is established. Thus there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: rva can nyid do zhes bya ba ni go'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rva can nyid do zhes bya ba ni go'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The horn-ness is the object of expression of the word “horn.”

original: des na 'dis ni ser skya la sogs kyi zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel bshad nas mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni ser skya la sogs kyi zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel bshad nas mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the commentary on the passage beginning, “The followers of Kapila and so on.” The conclusion is “Therefore . . . .”

original: brgya la 'dir tshul 'di 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na skabs su bab pa nyid brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: brgya la 'dir tshul 'di 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na skabs su bab pa nyid brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that this method might be established here, then the relevant point is stated: “In the same way . . . .”

original: dbyibs la sogs pa la yang bsgrub byas khyab pa'i don med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa la yang bsgrub byas khyab pa'i don med pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, in the case of shape and so on, the meaning is pervaded by the probandum.

original: sgra tsam mtshungs pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra tsam mtshungs pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere word is the same. This is the thought.

original: de nges par ma rtogs pas bsam pa gzhan du brtags nas rtsod pa ni /
analyzed: de nges par ma rtogs pas bsam pa gzhan du brtags nas rtsod pa ni /
translated: Since he did not understand that, he imagined something else and argued as follows.

original: gal te khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, etc.

original: 'o na de'i tshe zhes khong nas byung la /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe zhes khong nas byung la /
translated: Then, at that time, etc.

original: @33a * // byas pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan yang zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: @33a * // byas pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan yang zhes sbyar ro //
translated: And also, the other, such as being produced, etc.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: gal te 'chi ba dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs la /
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs la /
translated: If, in the case of the reason, such as death, shape, etc.,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la gags pa dang / rtsom pa dang ldan pas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid khyad bar yongs su rtogs pas gtan tshigs ma yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la gags pa dang / rtsom pa dang ldan pas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid khyad bar yongs su rtogs pas gtan tshigs ma yin na /
translated: the reason is not established because the universal, which has the characteristic of being pervaded by the possession of consciousness, etc., and beginning, is not understood,

original: de'i tshe byas ba nyid kyang gtan tshigs ma yin bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byas ba nyid kyang gtan tshigs ma yin bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, being produced, etc. would not be a reason.

original: gal te khyad par yongs su brtags pas 'chi ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs ma yin yang byas ba la sogs pa yang gtan tshigs ma yin par go ci ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par yongs su brtags pas 'chi ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs ma yin yang byas ba la sogs pa yang gtan tshigs ma yin par go ci ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you think that although death, etc. are not reasons because the universal is not understood, how could being produced, etc. also be reasons?

original: rgol ba gzhan ltos bas sam zhes smras so //
analyzed: rgol ba gzhan ltos bas sam zhes smras so //
translated: He said, “If you are dependent on another disputant, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir rgol ba gzhan la ltos pas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgol ba gzhan la ltos pas te /
translated: Because it depends on the opponent.

original: phyir rgol ba la ltos nas ni thams cad ma sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba la ltos nas ni thams cad ma sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Everything is unestablished because it depends on the opponent.

original: 'chi ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ma grub par brjod pa yang phyir rgol ba la ltos nas yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ma grub par brjod pa yang phyir rgol ba la ltos nas yin no //
translated: The statement that the specific reason of death, etc. is not established also depends on the opponent.

original: byas pa la yang slar rgol ba bram ze la ltos pa kho nas rigs ba can gyis brjod pa nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra la brten pa'i khyad par ma grub la /
analyzed: byas pa la yang slar rgol ba bram ze la ltos pa kho nas rigs ba can gyis brjod pa nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra la brten pa'i khyad par ma grub la /
translated: In the case of the thesis that sound is impermanent because it is produced, the Naiyāyika says that the specific reason based on the quality of space is not established because it depends only on the opponent, the brahman.

original: du ba la yang skad cig ma'i rang bzhin gyi ril sogs pa la brten pa ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: du ba la yang skad cig ma'i rang bzhin gyi ril sogs pa la brten pa ma grub pa'o //
translated: In the case of smoke, the specific reason based on the nature of momentariness is not established.

original: khyad par rnam par rtog pas kyang thams cad ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyad par rnam par rtog pas kyang thams cad ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: Even with a specific conception, everything is unestablished.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang dpe'i chos can gyi dbye bas gtan tshigs tha dad par rtogs pa ni thams cad mtshungs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang dpe'i chos can gyi dbye bas gtan tshigs tha dad par rtogs pa ni thams cad mtshungs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference of the reason in terms of the property of the probandum and the example is understood in everything that is similar.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is clarified by the statement “in this way,” etc.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan ni sgra yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan ni sgra yin la /
translated: The quality of sound is space.

original: de'i chos byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i sgrub byed du rigs pa can gyis brjod ba ni gzhan te /
analyzed: de'i chos byas pa nyid mi rtag pa'i sgrub byed du rigs pa can gyis brjod ba ni gzhan te /
translated: The reasoner's statement that the quality of sound is impermanent because it is produced is different.

original: phyir rgol ba la bram ze la ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba la bram ze la ma grub pa'o //
translated: It is not established for the opponent, the Brahmin.

original: bsgrub par bya ba sgra dang dpe bum pa la sogs pa de dag gi chos byas pa nyid ni phan tshun du ni zhes bya ba dpe dang bsgrub bya'i chos can la ma grub pa nyid rim gyis phyogs gnyis gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba sgra dang dpe bum pa la sogs pa de dag gi chos byas pa nyid ni phan tshun du ni zhes bya ba dpe dang bsgrub bya'i chos can la ma grub pa nyid rim gyis phyogs gnyis gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The probandum is sound, and the example is a pot, etc. The quality of being produced of those is not established in the example and the subject of the probandum.

original: de lta yin dang 'ga' yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'ga' yang sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: In that case, nothing would be a proof, but that is not so.

original: de'i phyir dbang phyug sgrub pa la yang sun 'byin ba 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang phyug sgrub pa la yang sun 'byin ba 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, this refutation also exists in the proof of God. This is the meaning of the dispute.

original: phyogs dang po la ni phyed snga mas lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni phyed snga mas lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: In the first position, the first half answers.

original: lung @33b gi zhes bya ba ni ma grub kyang gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung @33b gi zhes bya ba ni ma grub kyang gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though scripture is not established, it is not a refutation.

original: 'ga' la yang ni zhes bya ba ni byas pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'ga' la yang ni zhes bya ba ni byas pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “In some cases” means in the case of being produced, etc.

original: nam mkha'i chos nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i chos nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The nature of space is an illustration.

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa yang de bzhin du 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The momentariness, etc. are also to be understood in the same way.

original: rgol ba gzhan la ltos nas thams cad ma grub pa nyid do zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: rgol ba gzhan la ltos nas thams cad ma grub pa nyid do zhes brjod zin to //
translated: It has already been stated that in relation to the opponent, everything is unestablished.

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni khyad par rtogs bar byed na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni khyad par rtogs bar byed na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is stated in the expression “if one wishes to understand the distinction.”

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma grub bas byas ba la mi gnod pa dang byad par yongs su rtogs pa na yang gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma grub bas byas ba la mi gnod pa dang byad par yongs su rtogs pa na yang gtan tshigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because the quality of space is not established, the reason would be inconclusive when it is understood that it is not damaged by being produced.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin sgrub byed du byas pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin sgrub byed du byas pas /
translated: Since the nature of the thing is taken as the reason,

original: bsgrub byas khyab ba nyid du ma grub pa la ni ma grub pa nyid brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul 'di yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub byas khyab ba nyid du ma grub pa la ni ma grub pa nyid brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul 'di yin no //
translated: this is the method of stating the reason’s non-establishment when the pervasion by the probandum is not established.

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin nam /
translated: The nature of the subject

original: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin 'di grub na ni bstan bcos las bstan pa'i khyad par gnod byed ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub byas khyab pa'i gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin 'di grub na ni bstan bcos las bstan pa'i khyad par gnod byed ma yin te /
translated: If the nature of the reason pervades the predicate, then the specific statements in the treatise are not contradicted.

original: khyad par de ma grub kyang zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par de ma grub kyang zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Even if that specific statement is not established, it should be viewed in that way.

original: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par gyi mthar thug par byas te /
analyzed: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par gyi mthar thug par byas te /
translated: The general meaning is made to reach the specific conclusion.

original: ston pa ni sgra ni nam mkha' la brten bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni sgra ni nam mkha' la brten bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching is that sound is said to be supported by space.

original: dper na sgra nam mkha' la brten pa nyid ma grub kyang chos can sgra grub pa dang ; byas pa'i khyab pa grub pa la gnod byed ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra nam mkha' la brten pa nyid ma grub kyang chos can sgra grub pa dang ; byas pa'i khyab pa grub pa la gnod byed ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though the support of sound by space is not established, the subject, sound, is established, and the pervasion by the produced is not contradicted.

original: lung las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: lung las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the scripture is as follows.

original: gal te chos can gyi khyad par de 'dra ba ni rgol ba rigs pa can rang nyid kyis brtags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos can gyi khyad par de 'dra ba ni rgol ba rigs pa can rang nyid kyis brtags pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the specific characteristic of the subject is not imagined by the rationalist opponent himself,

original: des na de ma grub pa'i gnod pa'i rgyu mtshan du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na de ma grub pa'i gnod pa'i rgyu mtshan du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could it not be a reason for the contradiction of its non-establishment?

original: de bzhin du khyad par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the specific characteristic is stated.

original: rang gi bstan bcos las bstan pa nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par yongs su rtog pa yin na yang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi bstan bcos las bstan pa nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par yongs su rtog pa yin na yang ngo //
translated: If you are imagining the special qualities of space to be taught in our treatise, then that is so.

original: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra ni chos can zhes khyad par brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can 'di'i sbyor ba yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe ni nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan gyi sgra ni chos can zhes khyad par brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can 'di'i sbyor ba yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe ni nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: But if the term “quality of space” is the subject of this syllogism, then at that time this would be a fault.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: sgra tsam chos can du bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra tsam chos can du bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because mere sound is taken as the subject.

original: khyad par de ni ma smras kyang 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par de ni ma smras kyang 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though that distinction is not stated, it is intended.

original: de lta na yang re zhig mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang re zhig mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa yin la /
translated: But even so, impermanence is established for the time being.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan grub pa ni dpyad ba gzhan du 'os so snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan grub pa ni dpyad ba gzhan du 'os so snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The establishment of the quality of space is suitable for further analysis.

original: @34a * // ci'i phyir chos can ma grub pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: @34a * // ci'i phyir chos can ma grub pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the case that the subject is not established?

original: chos can nyid ni zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: chos can nyid ni zhes gsungs so /
translated: He says, “The subject itself . . . ”

original: khyad par ma grub na zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par ma grub na'o //
analyzed: khyad par ma grub na zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par ma grub na'o //
translated: If the distinction is not established means if the distinction of being a quality of space, etc. is not established.

original: 'o na khyad par rtogs par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par rtogs par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But why wouldn't the distinction be understood?

original: khyad par yongs su rtogs pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par yongs su rtogs pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, The understanding of the distinction also...

original: ci'i phyir mkho ba ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mkho ba ma yin snyam na /
translated: If you think why is it not necessary?

original: de la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes smos te /
translated: He says, In that...

original: byas pa nyid la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In the case of being produced, etc.

original: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid gnyis spyir khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid gnyis spyir khyab pa grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that the two, being produced and being impermanent, are established in general.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is taught by Thus... and so on.

original: khyad par nam mkha'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu grub pa na'o //
analyzed: khyad par nam mkha'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu grub pa na'o //
translated: When the distinction is well established, having the characteristic of being a quality of space, etc.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is it not accepted?

original: rgyu'i de ma thag byung zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i de ma thag byung zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, The antecedent condition of the cause...

original: ci'i phyir khyad par rjes su ma 'brel ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyad par rjes su ma 'brel ce na /
translated: Why is the distinction not connected?

original: snga ma dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: snga ma dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, The former...

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin dben pa'i byas pa nyid dang / phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni sgra dang bum pa'am gzhan du yang rung ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin dben pa'i byas pa nyid dang / phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni sgra dang bum pa'am gzhan du yang rung ste /
translated: The nature of the former, i.e., impermanence, is the same as the nature of the latter, i.e., production, and the nature of the former, i.e., impermanence, is the same as the nature of the latter, i.e., sound or pot.

original: 'gar yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gar yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference whatsoever.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyogs de ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs de ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, “That place,”

original: ri la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: i.e., the characteristic of a mountain, etc.

original: yang na phyogs dang lhan cig gnas pas na /
analyzed: yang na phyogs dang lhan cig gnas pas na /
translated: Or, because it abides together with a place,

original: phyogs bcas te sgra'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcas te sgra'o //
translated: it is “with place,” i.e., sound.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byas ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs so /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byas ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs so /
translated: “ That” refers to the reason, i.e., production, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni gcig tu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “It is one.”

original: des na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud de /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud de /
translated: “ Therefore” is a conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'di la bsgrub bya dang dpe dbye bas rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'di la bsgrub bya dang dpe dbye bas rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: Since that is so, there is no conceptual differentiation of the probandum and example in this case of production, etc.

original: 'dis ni grub nas ma grub kyang /
analyzed: 'dis ni grub nas ma grub kyang /
translated: This shows that even if it is established, it is not established.

original: khyad par gnod byed ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gnod byed ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: In particular, the explanation is “not the harm-doer,” and so on.

original: 'o na dbyibs la sogs pa la ji ltar rnam par rtog pa yod ces dogs pa sel ba na /
analyzed: 'o na dbyibs la sogs pa la ji ltar rnam par rtog pa yod ces dogs pa sel ba na /
translated: Now, in order to dispel the doubt, “How can there be conceptual thought in regard to shape, etc.?”

original: dngos po'i ngo bor ma grub la /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor ma grub la /
translated: it is said, “It is not established as the entity of a thing.”

original: tshul 'di zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi cha rnam par 'grel pa ni dbyibs la sogs pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi cha rnam par 'grel pa ni dbyibs la sogs pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the part of the Pramānﬁ avārtika that goes, “In regard to shape, etc.,”

original: de dang zhes bya ba sems pa can la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya dang 'brel ba ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba sems pa can la sogs pa'i bsgrub bya dang 'brel ba ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: is the non-establishment of the connection between the probandum and the reason, such as “sentience,” etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir ni rnam par rtog pas nyes bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir ni rnam par rtog pas nyes bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, in this case, there is only the fault of conceptual thought.

original: 'di la skyon gzhan yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di la skyon gzhan yang yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But is there not another fault here?

original: ci ste ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste ma brjod ce na /
translated: If it is asked, “Why is it not stated?”

original: lhag ma @34b ni zhes gsungs so //🔽tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //
analyzed: lhag ma @34b ni zhes gsungs so // tha dad dngos la rab grub pa //
translated: it is said, “The rest is as before.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: It is said, “The establishment of the different entities,” etc.

original: nyes pa lhag ma ni sngar brjod zin pa kho na bas yang mi brjod do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa lhag ma ni sngar brjod zin pa kho na bas yang mi brjod do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the other faults are just as they were previously stated, and so they are not stated again.

original: de bas na dbyibs la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de bas na dbyibs la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, since the proof of shape, etc. is not related to the probandum,🔽the proof of shape, etc. is left incomplete.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa'i sgra tsam du sgrub byed du lus pa yin no zhes ston pa ni dbyibs kyi sgra tsam ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa'i sgra tsam du sgrub byed du lus pa yin no zhes ston pa ni dbyibs kyi sgra tsam ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “only” in “the word ‘shape’ only” shows this.

original: sgra ma grub kyang zhes bya ba ni lus can nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: sgra ma grub kyang zhes bya ba ni lus can nyid la sogs pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The word “even” in “even if the word is not established” refers to the words “corporeal,” etc.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po grub na bsgrub bya grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po grub na bsgrub bya grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the entity of the proof is established, the probandum is established.

original: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par du ston pa ni 'ug pa las byung ba ni 'ug pa pas te bye brag pa'o //
analyzed: spyir brjod pa'i don khyad par du ston pa ni 'ug pa las byung ba ni 'ug pa pas te bye brag pa'o //
translated: The word “specifically” in “the general meaning is stated specifically” means “in particular.”

original: 'ug pa'i cha byad 'dzin pa'i bde byed kyi slob mar grags bas na gzegs zan no //
analyzed: 'ug pa'i cha byad 'dzin pa'i bde byed kyi slob mar grags bas na gzegs zan no //
translated: Since he is known as the student of Bṛhaspati, he is called “Kātyāyana.”

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni dus cung zad gnas pas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni dus cung zad gnas pas so //
translated: The word “impermanent” means “existing for a short time.”

original: rdul phran dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdul phran dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “atoms” means

original: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa yin gyi sgra ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa yin gyi sgra ni ma yin te /
translated: form, smell, taste, and touch, but not sound.

original: bye brag pas yon tan nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab tu khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag pas yon tan nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / rdul phra rab tu khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Vaiśeṣikas accept that it is a quality, and because they accept that it is a subtle particle.

original: yang na don dam par sgra yang rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang na don dam par sgra yang rdul phra rab yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, because sound is a subtle particle ultimately, there is no fault.

original: dpe ni bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: dpe ni bum pa bzhin no zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: The example is like a pot.

original: sgrub par byed pa 'di yang gzhan gyi lugs kyis brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa 'di yang gzhan gyi lugs kyis brjod pa yin te /
translated: This proof is also stated from the perspective of the opponent’s system.

original: des na ma khyab pa nyes pa med de /
analyzed: des na ma khyab pa nyes pa med de /
translated: Therefore there is no fault of nonpervasion.

original: lhan cig byung bar mthong ba tsam gyis khyab pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byung bar mthong ba tsam gyis khyab pa khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pervasion is accepted merely by seeing that they arise together.

original: gzhi ma grub pa'i nyes par yang dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa'i nyes par yang dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not suspect the fault of the reason being unestablished.

original: rdul phra rab dag la log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag la log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no misconception regarding subtle particles.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba 'dir lus can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sangs rgyas ba dang bye brag pa phan tshun mngon par 'dod pa'i yul reg pa dang ldan pa dang / thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i rdzas kyi tshad kyi mtshan nyid la grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor ba 'dir lus can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sangs rgyas ba dang bye brag pa phan tshun mngon par 'dod pa'i yul reg pa dang ldan pa dang / thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i rdzas kyi tshad kyi mtshan nyid la grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The word “here” in the statement “because it is a body here” is not established for the Vaiśeṣikas and Buddhists as a characteristic of the measure of a substance that is in contact with and pervades all objects that are mutually desired.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa can la sgra 'di reg bya dang ldan pa la ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa can la sgra 'di reg bya dang ldan pa la ma grub ce na /
translated: Why is this word not established for the Naiyāyikas as being in contact with a tangible object?

original: rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “all substances do not pervade all.”

original: 'dir sangs rgyas pa la ci ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas pa la ci ltar grub ce na /
translated: Here, how is it established for the Buddhists?

original: bde bar gshegs pas rnams la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas rnams la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “the Sugata said that all . . .”

original: reg ba'i ni rang gi yul dang gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa yin te /
analyzed: reg ba'i ni rang gi yul dang gzhan skye ba'i gegs byed pa yin te /
translated: Contact is the obstruction to the arising of its own object and others.

original: de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with that.

original: sangs rgyas pa des mngon par 'dod pa'i don reg pa @35a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa des mngon par 'dod pa'i don reg pa @35a * //
translated: The Buddhists assert that contact is the cause of the arising of feeling.

original: dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas pa dang bye brag pa gnyis ka las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni sangs rgyas pa dang bye brag pa gnyis ka las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition of a valid means of knowledge is established by both Buddhists and Vaiśeṣikas.

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'khrul pa'am grub pa nyid yin na bsgrub bya'i don 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni mi 'khrul pa'am grub pa nyid yin na bsgrub bya'i don 'grub pa'o //
translated: If it is “just that,” i.e., nonerroneous or established, then the object to be established is established.

original: 'di gnyis la zhes bya ba sbra dang dngos po dag la'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la zhes bya ba sbra dang dngos po dag la'o //
translated: “ These two” refers to the thesis and the entity.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid 'khrul pa la sogs pa yin na zhes sogs pa'i sgras ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba yin na zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid 'khrul pa la sogs pa yin na zhes sogs pa'i sgras ma grub pa dang / 'gal ba yin na zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If the nature of the entity is erroneous, etc., the word “etc.” should be understood to mean “unestablished” and “contradictory.”

original: mi 'khrul bar 'dod kyang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya la'o //
analyzed: mi 'khrul bar 'dod kyang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya la'o //
translated: “ Even if nonerroneous” refers to the object to be established.

original: don de dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis sgrub byed de la brten pa'i dpyad pa mi 'khrul ba'i yul can nyid nye bar mkho ba yin no //
analyzed: don de dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis sgrub byed de la brten pa'i dpyad pa mi 'khrul ba'i yul can nyid nye bar mkho ba yin no //
translated: The nonerroneous object, which is the analysis of that object based on the nature of the entity that establishes it, is required.

original: sgra'i dpyad pa yang 'di nyid du bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i dpyad pa yang 'di nyid du bya'o zhe na /
translated: The analysis of the word should also be done here.

original: dngos po 'khrul pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po 'khrul pa dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He says, “The entity is erroneous,” etc.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod cing zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul la tshig tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod cing zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: “Later” refers to the passage, “We do not accept inference to be a valid means of knowledge with regard to its object.”

original: de bzhin du rtag pa la yang tshad med nyid ces bya bar grub po zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtag pa la yang tshad med nyid ces bya bar grub po zhes 'brel to //
translated: Similarly, it is established that “eternality” is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi lta bas dbang phyug 'ba' zhig khams gsum gyi rgyur grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lta bas dbang phyug 'ba' zhig khams gsum gyi rgyur grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not established that Īśvara alone is the cause of the three worlds by the opinion of others,

original: rtag pa nyid kyis nam mkha' la sogs pa dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis nam mkha' la sogs pa dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “because of eternality, space, etc.”

original: 'di nyid brtsal bas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid brtsal bas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to refute this very opinion, he says, “In that case.”

original: ci ltar de rang bzhin gang gis dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de rgyu yin pa de lta nyid ces bya ba rang bzhin de nyid kyi nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po de rgyu ma yin par pha rol gyis gang gi tshe khas blangs pa de'i
analyzed: ci ltar de rang bzhin gang gis dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de rgyu yin pa de lta nyid ces bya ba rang bzhin de nyid kyi nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po de rgyu ma yin par pha rol gyis gang gi tshe khas blangs pa de'i
translated: In whatever way that thing called “Īśvara” is a cause by virtue of its nature, in just that way, by virtue of that very nature, that thing called “space,” etc., is not a cause. When the opponent accepts this,🔽then,

original: tshe / gang gis de ci ltar dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de rgyur 'dod la /
analyzed: tshe / gang gis de ci ltar dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de rgyur 'dod la /
translated: and by what is that called “Īśvara”?

original: rgyu ma yin te rgyu ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa gang gi rgyur mi 'dod ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin te rgyu ma yin par mngon par 'dod pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa gang gi rgyur mi 'dod ces sbyar ro //
translated: That which is not a cause, such as space, is not asserted to be a cause.

original: gnyi ga yang rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir rang dbang du rgyu nyid dam cig shos su 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir rang dbang du rgyu nyid dam cig shos su 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The point is that since both are similar in being essentially existent, one would be an independent cause or the other would not be.

original: yang na ji ltar 'byin par byed pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar 'byin par byed pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Or, just as in the state of being a creator,

original: dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de ji ltar rgyu yin ba de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de gang gi tshe rgyu ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de ji ltar rgyu yin ba de lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de gang gi tshe rgyu ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: that which is called “Īśvara” is a cause, in the same way, when that which is called “Īśvara” is not a cause,

original: dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de rgyu nyid du 'dod la rgyu ma yin par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di gang gis de ji ltar yin /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos po de rgyu nyid du 'dod la rgyu ma yin par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di gang gis de ji ltar yin /
translated: by what is that called “Īśvara”? How is that asserted to be a cause and not asserted to be a noncause?

original: rtag pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe rgyu ma yin pa @35b kho nar 'dod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe rgyu ma yin pa @35b kho nar 'dod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it should be accepted that it is never a cause, because it is not differentiated by permanence.

original: 'chad pa ni ji ltar dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni ji ltar dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation is “just like Īśvara, etc.”

original: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa ni skye ba can mtha' dag gi rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di gzhan la rab tu grub pa kho na ma yin nam zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa ni skye ba can mtha' dag gi rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di gzhan la rab tu grub pa kho na ma yin nam zhen ma yin te /
translated: If space, etc., are the causes of the causal signs of all that is produced, isn’t this well established for others? No, it is not,

original: byed pa po rang dbang can nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po rang dbang can nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is asserted that the agent is independent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'on te de ni zhes bya ba la sogs par dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'on te de ni zhes bya ba la sogs par dogs pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, there is the doubt, “But if that is so . . .”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug go //
translated: “That” refers to Īśvara.

original: 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lugs kyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi lugs kyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: “Knowledge characterized by desire” is stated according to our own system.

original: gzhan gyi lugs kyis ni 'dod pa dang shes pa tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs kyis ni 'dod pa dang shes pa tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: According to the other system, desire and knowledge are different.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: “Also” means also in space, etc.

original: 'di ltar dper rtag pa nyid kyis dbang phyug la shes pas cung zad kyang mi 'byed pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper rtag pa nyid kyis dbang phyug la shes pas cung zad kyang mi 'byed pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la yang yin no //
translated: For example, just as God is not distinguished in the least by permanence, so also it is in space.

original: de lta mod kyi gal te shes pa de dbang phyug gi yin na de'i tshe nam mkha'i yang yin par ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gal te shes pa de dbang phyug gi yin na de'i tshe nam mkha'i yang yin par ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: But if you admit that consciousness belongs to God, why not admit that it belongs to space?

original: des na shes pa ni gnyi ga la mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa ni gnyi ga la mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus consciousness is the same in both cases.

original: des na dbang phyug 'ba' zhig ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dbang phyug 'ba' zhig ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, God alone is not the cause.

original: 'on te dbang phyug la ni shes pa dang lhan cig 'du ba'i 'brel pa yod kyi nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni med do //
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug la ni shes pa dang lhan cig 'du ba'i 'brel pa yod kyi nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni med do //
translated: But if God has a connection with consciousness through conjunction, but space, etc. do not,

original: des na dbang phyug kho nas rgyu yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na dbang phyug kho nas rgyu yin no snyam na /
translated: then God alone is the cause.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, that is not so,

original: 'du ba'i 'grel pa ni de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'du ba'i 'grel pa ni de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the connection of conjunction is the same in both cases.

original: des na dbang phyug bzhin du nam mkha' yang rgyu yin pa'am /
analyzed: des na dbang phyug bzhin du nam mkha' yang rgyu yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, like God, space is also a cause.

original: yang gnyi ga yang ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: yang gnyi ga yang ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Or else, he remains in the position that neither is the case.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan ma brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //🔽de'i 'dod pa skyes pa dang / 'bras bu yang skyes pa ni bya rog dang ta la phrad pa ltar gzhan gyis sbyar ba yin nam /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan ma brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o // de'i 'dod pa skyes pa dang / 'bras bu yang skyes pa ni bya rog dang ta la phrad pa ltar gzhan gyis sbyar ba yin nam /
translated: Another refutation is stated in the words “Moreover. . .

original: 'on te 'bras bu 'dod pas sbyar ba yin zhes 'di la nges pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu 'dod pas sbyar ba yin zhes 'di la nges pa ci yod /
translated: ” Is the arising of his desire and the arising of the effect like the coming together of a crow and a palm fruit, or is it like the coming together of desire and the effect? What is the certainty here?

original: 'di la ni rang dbang du byed pa po nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni rang dbang du byed pa po nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gal te la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this regard, there is no such thing as an independent agent. This is demonstrated in the words “If he is the cause. . .

original: de'i tshe rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: ” At that time, he is the cause.

original: rang dbang gi rang bzhin na /
analyzed: rang dbang gi rang bzhin na /
translated: If he is independent,🔽if he is not independent,

original: de lta min na ste gal te rang dbang du mi 'dod na /
