analyzed: de lta min na ste gal te rang dbang du mi 'dod na /
translated: if he is not accepted as independent,

original: kun gyi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: kun gyi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: then he is not the cause of all things, and so on. This is easy to understand.

original: 'on te lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos par ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig byed pa la mi ltos par ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: But if he does not depend on the cooperating conditions, how can he be said to be the cause?

original: 'o na ni rang dbang nyid nyams pa mi zlogs so //
analyzed: 'o na ni rang dbang nyid nyams pa mi zlogs so //
translated: Well then, the fault of his lack of independence is not avoided.

original: rnam pa ci ltar @36a * //
analyzed: rnam pa ci ltar @36a * //
translated: In what way?

original: yang rung ste /
analyzed: yang rung ste /
translated: In any way.

original: 'dir rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is the cause here.

original: gal te las la sogs pa'i tshogs pa yod pa na /🔽de'i dbye ba las sngar 'bras bu ma dmigs pa las /
analyzed: gal te las la sogs pa'i tshogs pa yod pa na / de'i dbye ba las sngar 'bras bu ma dmigs pa las /
translated: If the collection of karma and so on exists,🔽then the effect would be observed later,

original: de yod pas dmigs nas ni de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de yod pas dmigs nas ni de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: because it exists, but it is not observed.

original: de ltar ni nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible that way,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis tshogs pa mngon sum du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis tshogs pa mngon sum du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to perceive the collection in its entirety.

original: dbang phyug ni rgyur rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pas na /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni rgyur rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pas na /
translated: It is also not reasonable that God is the cause.

original: rnam 'grel rnam pa gzhan du sbyor bar byed pa ni yang na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel rnam pa gzhan du sbyor bar byed pa ni yang na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, the Commentary applies the argument in a different way:🔽“Or, if he is the creator of the world, then why is he not the cause of everything?”

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas sbyor ba gnyis pa mdzad do//
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas sbyor ba gnyis pa mdzad do//
translated: Therefore, following this explanation, the second syllogism is presented.

original: 'on te bsams nas 'gro ba sprul pa la 'jug pa des ni ci ltar rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bsams nas 'gro ba sprul pa la 'jug pa des ni ci ltar rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if he engages in the creation of the world through deliberation, then how is he not a cause?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that “he is not the cause of everything, such as desire and so on.”

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
translated: The world, etc. is the other’s doubt.

original: lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lan ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The reply, etc.

original: 'jig rten gzhan gyi las gang yin pa de'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan gyi las gang yin pa de'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas na /
translated: Since the world is dependent on the karma of another,

original: 'di ni dbang phyug ma yin pa nyid de rang dbang ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang phyug ma yin pa nyid de rang dbang ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: it is not independent, i.e., not self-dependent.

original: des na ji skad brjod pa 'di ji ltar dbang phyug yin te /
analyzed: des na ji skad brjod pa 'di ji ltar dbang phyug yin te /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that the world is God, since it is not God?

original: dbang phyug ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not God.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi las las kyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ni 'jig rten de la brtse ba'i tshul gyis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi las las kyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ni 'jig rten de la brtse ba'i tshul gyis byas pa yin no //
translated: But if the world is dependent on the karma of another, i.e., is characterized by dependence on another, then God is the creator of the world, out of love for it.

original: zhe na / lan du dmyal ba la sogs pa ste dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa de bsgrubs pa'i phyir brtse ba med pa cis dbang phyug yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / lan du dmyal ba la sogs pa ste dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa de bsgrubs pa'i phyir brtse ba med pa cis dbang phyug yin te /
translated: In reply, we say: Since God is not the creator of hell, etc., i.e., of animals, ghosts, etc., how can he be God, since he is not loving?

original: brtse ba dang ldan pa ni de ltar 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pa ni de ltar 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that a loving person should act in that way.

original: thams cad bde ba kho nar ci ste mi skyed snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bde ba kho nar ci ste mi skyed snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Why does he not create all as only happy?

original: gzhan gyis 'jig rten las nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'jig rten las nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The opponent says, “The world is created by God.”

original: de 'dra zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byed pa des dmyal ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba yin gyi 'gro ba bde bar bya ba de la dbang phyug ni nus pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byed pa des dmyal ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba yin gyi 'gro ba bde bar bya ba de la dbang phyug ni nus pa med do zhe na /
translated: The reply is, “If he is like that,” i.e., if he is the creator of the suffering of the hells, etc., then the hells, etc. are suffering. God is powerless to create the happiness of the world.

original: sun 'byin pa ni 'di dam pa min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni 'di dam pa min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The refutation is, “This is not the highest good.”

original: de lta na ni 'o na dbang phyug dam pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dbang phyug dam pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then God is not the highest good.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dam pa gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dam pa gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The reply is, “If the highest good . . . ”

original: nus pa med kyang zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa med kyang zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Without power” means without ability.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dam pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the highest good.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'jug ce na /
translated: Why does he not engage in it?

original: dam @36b pa min pa'i bya ba ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: dam @36b pa min pa'i bya ba ni zhes smos so //
translated: The reply is, “Because he is engaged in the non-highest good.”

original: sdig pa'i bya bas phung po rnams la sdug bsngal bskyed pa na /
analyzed: sdig pa'i bya bas phung po rnams la sdug bsngal bskyed pa na /
translated: When the aggregates are created as suffering by the action of evil,

original: rma la rgya tshvas 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: rma la rgya tshvas 'debs pa yin no //
translated: It is like applying a caustic to a wound.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “But” is the opponent’s view.

original: tshul 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bsod nams byed pa de ni bde ba myong du 'jug la /
analyzed: tshul 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bsod nams byed pa de ni bde ba myong du 'jug la /
translated: “This method” is that one who performs meritorious actions is made to experience pleasure,

original: gang zhig sdig pa byed pa de ni sdug bsngal myong du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sdig pa byed pa de ni sdug bsngal myong du 'jug pa'o //
translated: and one who performs sinful actions is made to experience suffering.

original: dbang phyug 'di ni tshul de nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug 'di ni tshul de nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: This is the method of God.

original: de zhes bya ba de ma thag tu brjod pa'i tshul bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba de ma thag tu brjod pa'i tshul bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “That” refers to the method just mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir di ltar yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa sel bas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir di ltar yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa sel bas /
translated: In order to remove the doubt, “Why is it so?

original: dbang phyug gis bsams pa smras pa ni nga'i rang bzhin 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bsams pa smras pa ni nga'i rang bzhin 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ” the thought of God is stated: “My nature is such that I am God.”

original: dbang phyug nga'i'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug nga'i'o //
translated: “I am God.”

original: lan de ni bdag la'ang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lan de ni bdag la'ang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is, “It is the same for me.”

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
translated: “If” is the opponent’s doubt.

original: 'jig rten de yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten de yang ngo //
translated: “The world” is God.

original: lan phan tshun rten de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan phan tshun rten de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, “It is mutual dependence.”

original: 'jig rten ni dbang phyug gis bskul nas las sna tshogs byed la /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni dbang phyug gis bskul nas las sna tshogs byed la /
translated: The world is impelled by God to perform various actions.

original: las sna tshogs kyi sgo nas kyang 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bskul ba ste /
analyzed: las sna tshogs kyi sgo nas kyang 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug bskul ba ste /
translated: And the world impels God to perform various actions.

original: las la dbang phyug bskul ba dang / dbang phyug las la bskul ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las la dbang phyug bskul ba dang / dbang phyug las la bskul ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by “God impels action” and “action impels God.”

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi ci skyon ce na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi ci skyon ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the problem?

original: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba phan tshun brten pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba phan tshun brten pa yin na /
translated: If that is so, if they are mutually dependent,

original: las kyi bskul ba dang dbang phyug gi bskul ba gcig kyang yod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: las kyi bskul ba dang dbang phyug gi bskul ba gcig kyang yod par mi 'thad de /
translated: it is not tenable that either action impels God or God impels action,

original: gcig med na gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig med na gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one does not exist, the other also does not exist.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug la dge ba'i las la bskul ba'i nus pa yod dam med /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug la dge ba'i las la bskul ba'i nus pa yod dam med /
translated: Moreover, does God have the ability to impel virtuous action or not?

original: de la yod pa'i phyogs 'gog pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la yod pa'i phyogs 'gog pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Refuting the first of these possibilities, the treatise states:🔽If he is able to,

original: nus pa med min zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nus pa med min zhes bya ba ni /
translated: he is not able not to.

original: nus pa yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he has the ability, this means that he is able to.

original: de'i tshe ni 'gro ba legs pa'i las byed pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'gro ba legs pa'i las byed pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: At that time, all migrating beings would only perform virtuous actions.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,🔽because we see that they perform nonvirtuous actions.

original: chos ma yin pa byed pa dag mthong ba'i phyir ro 'on te las gnyis ka la bskul bar nus pa yin na /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa byed pa dag mthong ba'i phyir ro 'on te las gnyis ka la bskul bar nus pa yin na /
translated: If you are able to instigate both types of action,

original: de lta na ni bur ma mngar bar byed pa po yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pas blang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni bur ma mngar bar byed pa po yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pas blang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: then because you are the one who makes the sugarcane sweet, you are not to be accepted by those who have understanding.

original: gnyis pa sel ba ni gal te 'jig rten de 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sel ba ni gal te 'jig rten de 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second refutation is this: If the world is here,

original: de'i tshe las smra ba nyid dge ste /🔽gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe las smra ba nyid dge ste / gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then the proponent of karma is virtuous,🔽because it is definitely to be accepted.

original: lhag pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyal @37a * //
analyzed: lhag pa bkag pa'i phyir ro // rgyal @37a * //
translated: But it is not, because the remainder is refuted.

original: ba ni mtho ba'i rtser phyin pa ste /
analyzed: ba ni mtho ba'i rtser phyin pa ste /
translated: The king has reached the peak of greatness,

original: sgrub par byed pa med kyang gnod byed mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa med kyang gnod byed mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for him to be harmed, even though he has no means of defense.

original: des na 'dir phyogs gsum srid de /
analyzed: des na 'dir phyogs gsum srid de /
translated: Therefore, three positions are possible here.

original: 'gro ba las kyi gzhan dbang yin pas sam /
analyzed: 'gro ba las kyi gzhan dbang yin pas sam /
translated: Or, because beings are subject to the power of karma,

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa byed pa'i ngang tshul yin pas sam /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa byed pa'i ngang tshul yin pas sam /
translated: or, because they are in a state of doing what is desired and what is not desired,

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das de'i bsam pa'i khyad par brtag par sus nus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das de'i bsam pa'i khyad par brtag par sus nus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or, because who can fathom the special intention of the Lord?

original: phyogs dang po la ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i tshogs pa'i nang du gtogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i tshogs pa'i nang du gtogs pa yin yang /
translated: In the first case, even though it is included in the collection that produces the effect,

original: rgyu gzhan bzhin du rang dbang nyid nyams par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan bzhin du rang dbang nyid nyams par brjod pa yin no //
translated: it is said that its independence is lost, like any other cause.

original: de'i ngang tshul yin pa la yang bu ram dang mngar bar byed pa po nyid du brjod pa zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i ngang tshul yin pa la yang bu ram dang mngar bar byed pa po nyid du brjod pa zin pa kho na'o //
translated: And in the second case, it is said that it is in a state of being the producer of sweetness, like molasses.

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang snying rjes sbyor bar byed pa nyid ni thag bsrings pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang snying rjes sbyor bar byed pa nyid ni thag bsrings pa kho na'o //
translated: In both cases, the application of compassion is far away.

original: gsum pa ni rkang pa brkyang ba tsam du zad pas 'di ni shan pa bzhin du rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag gis blang bya nyid du brtag par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rkang pa brkyang ba tsam du zad pas 'di ni shan pa bzhin du rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag gis blang bya nyid du brtag par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the third case, it is merely an extension of the leg. Therefore, it is not considered to be something to be adopted by those who have understanding, like a butcher.

original: gang gi tshe bsam pa brtag par mi nus pa de'i tshe ni snying rje zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'khyar ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsam pa brtag par mi nus pa de'i tshe ni snying rje zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig 'khyar ba kho na ste /
translated: When it is not possible to examine the thought, then it is compassion that is engaged.

original: gzhan la gzhan gyi skyon yon nges pa'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan gyi skyon yon nges pa'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is just a meaningless statement, because there is no evidence for the faults and virtues of others.

original: yod kyang snying rje med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yod kyang snying rje med pa kho na ste /
translated: Even if there is, it is just the absence of compassion,

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa la 'god pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa la 'god pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the cause of the placement of beings in the hells and so on.

original: de ltar mang du smras pas chog go //
analyzed: de ltar mang du smras pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extensive discussion.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang dbang du ma gyur mod /
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang dbang du ma gyur mod /
translated: If you think that although the self is not independent,

original: rgyu tsam du ni 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu tsam du ni 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: it is still a cause,

original: lan ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response is, “In that case, then…”

original: de 'dra ba byed pa ni de 'dra ba kho nas shes par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba byed pa ni de 'dra ba kho nas shes par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory to your assertion that the activity of the self can be known only by the self.

original: bdag cag la sogs pas ni zhes bya ba ni gal te de'i byed pa rtogs par mi nus kyang /
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pas ni zhes bya ba ni gal te de'i byed pa rtogs par mi nus kyang /
translated: We do not know the activity of the self, but

original: rnam par 'jog na ni zhes zhe la gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog na ni zhes zhe la gzhag pa ste /
translated: If it were to posit, it would be placed in the mind.

original: de'i tshe mtshon dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshon dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs par sla'o //
translated: At that time, the meaning of “the instrument” and so forth is easily understood.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “ But” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.🔽“ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.

original: sdong dum gyi zhes bya ba ni shing dum gyi'o //
analyzed: sdong dum gyi zhes bya ba ni shing dum gyi'o //
translated: “ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.

original: lan du sdong dum gyis yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du sdong dum gyis yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ The stump” is the reply.🔽“ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o //
translated: “ That” is the agent.

original: 'o na ma dmigs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste /🔽sdong dum bltar rung ba la bltar mi rung ba'i byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ma dmigs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi ste / sdong dum bltar rung ba la bltar mi rung ba'i byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: “ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.

original: lan ni 'o na de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.🔽“ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni sdong dum la ni byed pa mngon sum @37b gyis gnod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni sdong dum la ni byed pa mngon sum @37b gyis gnod pa yin la /
translated: “ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.🔽“ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.🔽“ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.🔽“ That” is the agent.🔽“ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log.🔽“ The stump” is the reply.🔽“ That” is the agent.

original: rtag pa la ni rang bzhin khyad par med pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa la ni rang bzhin khyad par med pa ste /
translated: “ But if it is the non-apprehension itself” is the opponent’s opinion.🔽“ The stump” is the log

original: rim dang rim ma yin pas don bya ba nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par byed pa yang ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: rim dang rim ma yin pas don bya ba nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par byed pa yang ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not possible for the nature of an action to be devoid of the distinction of sequential and nonsequential,

original: don byed pa nyid du mi rung ngo /
analyzed: don byed pa nyid du mi rung ngo /
translated: because it would be impossible for it to perform a function.

original: des na rim dang rim ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: des na rim dang rim ma yin pa dang bral ba'i rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, because it is undermined by inference, which is free from the sequence and nonsequence, it is the same.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis ni nus pa ma nges pa nyid du yang rtogs bar 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis ni nus pa ma nges pa nyid du yang rtogs bar 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: However, direct perception also understands that potency is not ascertained, but inference does not.

original: bshad pa 'di ni bla bas btang snyoms su bzhag te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di ni bla bas btang snyoms su bzhag te /
translated: This explanation is set aside by the wise.

original: gzhan 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'chad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained by others.

original: phyogs de la ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin khyad par zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyogs de la ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin khyad par zhes sbyar ro //
translated: In that position, the nature of the effect is called a distinction.

original: dper na bum pa la rdza mkhan gyi lag pa'i byed pas bsgrub par bya ba 'jim pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la rdza mkhan gyi lag pa'i byed pas bsgrub par bya ba 'jim pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin du /
translated: For example, it is like the distinction of clay and so on, which is to be established by the action of the potter's hand.

original: gal te 'bras bu la yang gang zhis dbang phyug med na mi 'gyur bar brtag par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig dmigs na ni de'i tshe rdza mkhan bzhin du de mthong ba la brtag pa 'di'i byed pa yang rtogs par rigs pa ma yin
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu la yang gang zhis dbang phyug med na mi 'gyur bar brtag par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'ga' zhig dmigs na ni de'i tshe rdza mkhan bzhin du de mthong ba la brtag pa 'di'i byed pa yang rtogs par rigs pa ma yin
translated: If the effect were seen to have some special nature that would not exist without God, then at that time, like the potter, the activity of this God would be understood.

original: gyis / de lta ma yin na ni 'bras bu'i khyad par ma mthong na yang rgyu'i khyad par rtogs na ha cang thal ba'i phyir rtag ba'i byed pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gyis / de lta ma yin na ni 'bras bu'i khyad par ma mthong na yang rgyu'i khyad par rtogs na ha cang thal ba'i phyir rtag ba'i byed pa mi 'thad do //
translated: But if it were not so, then even if the special nature of the effect is not seen, if the special nature of the cause is understood, it would follow that it is completely unnecessary to posit God, and so it is not tenable that God is permanent.

original: 'chad ba ni rgyun gyis sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad ba ni rgyun gyis sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Annihilation” means “by a continuum.”

original: ji ltar rtag snyam na rgyun gyis sam gzhan du ther zug pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtag snyam na rgyun gyis sam gzhan du ther zug pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: How is it permanent? It is understood to be permanent by a continuum or as something else.

original: gang gi tshe mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi 'thad ce na /
translated: When is it not tenable?

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par ro //
translated: When there is no special nature.

original: su'i zhe na 'bras bu'i ste /
analyzed: su'i zhe na 'bras bu'i ste /
translated: Whose? Of the effect.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par ro //
translated: When there is no special nature of the effect.

original: nye bar mtshon par ci ltar 'thad ces bya ba ni byed pa nye bar mtshon par mi 'thad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon par ci ltar 'thad ces bya ba ni byed pa nye bar mtshon par mi 'thad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could it be tenable that it is exemplified?

original: dbang phyug la yang zhes yang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la yang zhes yang gi sgra ni rim pa bzhin du sbyor ro zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The word “also” in “with respect to Īśvara, etc.” is to be connected with each of the preceding words.

original: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel ba ni rtag la ldog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel ba ni rtag la ldog pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second half of the verse is explained by the words “because it is permanent and does not cease.”

original: rtag pa la ni ri zhig lta ba po nyid med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la ni ri zhig lta ba po nyid med pa kho na'o //
translated: For what is permanent cannot be a seer.

original: gal te lta ba po 'ga' zhig yod du chug kyang /
analyzed: gal te lta ba po 'ga' zhig yod du chug kyang /
translated: Even if it were possible for there to be a seer,

original: de lta na yang ldog pa med pa nyid kyis na nus pa rtogs par dka'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang ldog pa med pa nyid kyis na nus pa rtogs par dka'o //
translated: still, because it does not cease, it is difficult to understand its efficacy.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtag tu gnas zhes bya ba 'dis ne dus khyad par brjod la //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas zhes bya ba 'dis ne dus khyad par brjod la //
translated: The words “because it is permanent” indicate a difference in time.

original: khyab pas na yul khyad pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pas na yul khyad pa'o //
translated: Because it is all-pervading, it indicates a difference in place.

original: rdul phra rab las ni dus kyis byas ba'i ldog pa nyid sbangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab las ni dus kyis byas ba'i ldog pa nyid sbangs pa yin no //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is not subject to cessation in time.

original: @38a * // gal te ldog kyang de rgyu nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: @38a * // gal te ldog kyang de rgyu nyid du rtogs pa de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If you think that even if it is reversed, what is the fault when it is understood to be the cause?

original: gang dag yod na zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang dag yod na zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, “If they exist,”

original: sngar yang gang zhig med na ma byung ba zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar yang gang zhig med na ma byung ba zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
translated: and it should be considered as “If it does not exist, it does not occur.”

original: las yod na zhes bya ba ni rdza ma la spyod pa'i las yongs su smin pa yod na'o //
analyzed: las yod na zhes bya ba ni rdza ma la spyod pa'i las yongs su smin pa yod na'o //
translated: “If the action exists” means if the action of the potter’s wheel is fully ripened.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba nyid du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba nyid du brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is stated as something that must be accepted.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa la ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa byed pa 'jug pa nyid yin pas las gzhan ni don med do //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa la ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa byed pa 'jug pa nyid yin pas las gzhan ni don med do //
translated: Since direct perception and non-apprehension are the engagement of the potter and so on, another action is meaningless.

original: des na gnyis las gcig khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyis las gcig khas blang bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to accept one of the two.

original: 'jim gong la sogs pa la ni so sor rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jim gong la sogs pa la ni so sor rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the progression and reversal of the lump of clay and so on are seen individually,

original: gcig bzhag pa'i rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: gcig bzhag pa'i rtsod pa med do //
translated: there is no dispute about positing one.

original: thug pa med mod ci skyon ce na //
analyzed: thug pa med mod ci skyon ce na //
translated: If you say, “There is no end, so what is the problem?”

original: rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: “Without a subsequent engagement” is said.

original: rjes su 'jug pa dang bral ba ni rjes su 'jug pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa dang bral ba ni rjes su 'jug pa med pa ste /
translated: “Without a subsequent engagement” is without a subsequent engagement.

original: rgyu nyid du rtogs pa med pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du rtogs pa med pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: That which is not understood as a cause is said to be that.

original: de'i rtogs pa de'i 'jug pa de khas len na ste /
analyzed: de'i rtogs pa de'i 'jug pa de khas len na ste /
translated: If one accepts that understanding of it, its engagement,

original: 'dod na ni de las gzhan la yang gegs 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'dod na ni de las gzhan la yang gegs 'ga' yang med do //
translated: then there is no obstacle at all to it being different from that.

original: de khas len pa nyid nyes pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de khas len pa nyid nyes pa chen po yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that accepting that is a great fault.

original: thug pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i phyir na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i phyir na zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to explain in another way what was said about the infinite regress, he says,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?”

original: rgyu rnams kyi rgyu yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi rgyu yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “The cause of the causes as well.”

original: de nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gna' ma de nyid min pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gna' ma de nyid min pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because of being that itself” means because of not being the former itself.

original: de legs shes byas pa na zhes bya ba ni de la sogs pa legs par bsgrubs pa na'o //
analyzed: de legs shes byas pa na zhes bya ba ni de la sogs pa legs par bsgrubs pa na'o //
translated: “When that is well understood” means when that and so on are well established.

original: de'i khyad par ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The difference of that is the effect.

original: gshol gyi byed pa la sogs pa de las gzhan dag las khyad par du 'gyur ba yin pas na khyad par ro //
analyzed: gshol gyi byed pa la sogs pa de las gzhan dag las khyad par du 'gyur ba yin pas na khyad par ro //
translated: Since it is distinguished from other things, such as the function of the plow, it is a distinction.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni shal bas bshal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni shal bas bshal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the function of the plow, etc.

original: nges pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The transformation of the determination is the possession of the transformation.

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa ste /
translated: It is related to that.

original: nas la sogs pa'i myu gu rnams kyi rgyas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa'i myu gu rnams kyi rgyas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of the growth, etc., of the sprouts of barley, etc.

original: gshol gyi byed pa bzhin du yul la sogs pa la khyad par yod par ma mthong bas rtsod pa byed do //🔽phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba'i rkyen gyis khyad par las dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams @38b tshogs pa'i skad cig la rang bzhin la brten pa'i khyad par med kyang /
analyzed: gshol gyi byed pa bzhin du yul la sogs pa la khyad par yod par ma mthong bas rtsod pa byed do // phan tshun nye bar 'gro ba'i rkyen gyis khyad par las dmigs pa la sogs pa rnams @38b tshogs pa'i skad cig la rang bzhin la brten pa'i khyad par med kyang /
translated: Since one does not see a distinction in the object, etc., like the function of the plow, one argues.

original: nus pas byas pa'i khyad par ni gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don to //
analyzed: nus pas byas pa'i khyad par ni gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos so zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the reply is this: although there is no distinction based on the nature of the individual moments of the collection of the perceptions, etc., due to the condition of mutual approach, one must certainly accept a distinction made by capacity, due to the distinction in the object, etc.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni gal te 'bras bur gyur pa'i blos khyad par med par /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni gal te 'bras bur gyur pa'i blos khyad par med par /
translated: This is also explained in another way:

original: yul dang dbang po tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug 'di yang rgyu yin no zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug 'di yang rgyu yin no zhen ma yin te /
translated: If the mind that is the effect is the cause of the collection of objects and faculties without distinction, then this God is also the cause in the same way.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa de la yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa de la yang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because there is a distinction in the effect, consciousness.

original: de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni rgyun gyi khyad par med par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni rgyun gyi khyad par med par ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is also taught by way of negation: “If there is no distinction in the continuum . . .” and so on.

original: khyad par grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni bshad pa dang po ltar na rgyu la brten pa'i khyed par ro //
analyzed: khyad par grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni bshad pa dang po ltar na rgyu la brten pa'i khyed par ro //
translated: “The distinction is established” means that according to the first explanation, the distinction is based on the cause.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu la brten par brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu la brten par brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The second is stated with the intention of expressing that the distinction is based on the effect.

original: 'bras bu shes pa la brten pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs bya ba la rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rgyun de'i khyad par don dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med par ni so so so sor de
analyzed: 'bras bu shes pa la brten pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs bya ba la rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu'i rgyun de'i khyad par don dang 'dra ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med par ni so so so sor de
translated: Each individual thing, such as form, is not capable of producing the effect.

original: re re zhing nus pa med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams tshogs pa la'ang ste /
analyzed: re re zhing nus pa med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams tshogs pa la'ang ste /
translated: Even when they are assembled, they are not capable of producing the effect.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad bskyed pa la yang nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad bskyed pa la yang nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when they produce all the aspects of the entity, they are not capable of producing the effect.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: so sor 'bras bu de skyed par mi nus pa rnams /
analyzed: so sor 'bras bu de skyed par mi nus pa rnams /
translated: If each individual thing is not capable of producing the effect,

original: gal te tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang rang gis byas pa'i khyad par gyis mtshon par mi byed na /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa'i gnas skabs su yang rang gis byas pa'i khyad par gyis mtshon par mi byed na /
translated: and if even when they are assembled, they do not indicate the effect through their own particular features,

original: sha za la sogs pa bzhin du de rnams kyi nus pa ji ltar brtag par bya /
analyzed: sha za la sogs pa bzhin du de rnams kyi nus pa ji ltar brtag par bya /
translated: how could their capacity be conceived, like a flesh-eating demon and so on?

original: rgyu nyid kyang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyang yod pa yin te /
translated: The cause itself exists,

original: des na 'bras bu'i khyad par grub bo //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i khyad par grub bo //
translated: and therefore the effect is established.

original: de lta na yang yul la sogs pa las ni de'i rnam pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang yul la sogs pa las ni de'i rnam pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the aspect and so on of consciousness are from the object and so on.

original: de ltar 'di ni rgyu nyid la ni 'bras bu la gnas pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid kyis khyab par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni rgyu nyid la ni 'bras bu la gnas pa'i khyad par skyed par byed pa nyid kyis khyab par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this is a statement of the pervasion that the cause itself is the producer of the difference that is in the effect.🔽Because of that,

original: gang gi phyir de med pas na /🔽rgyur mi 'gyur ro snyam du thugs la bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med pas na / rgyur mi 'gyur ro snyam du thugs la bzhag pa yin no //
translated: it is not a cause.🔽This is what he has in mind.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni mig la sogs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni mig la sogs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He explains this in the lines beginning “The eye and so on are not the cause of consciousness.”

original: 'dras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid la rgyu nyid du nges par byed do zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid la rgyu nyid du nges par byed do zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du byed pa ste /
translated: He determines that the cause is just the difference in the nature of the effect. This is a conventional statement.

original: 'di ni nges par bzung ba gtso bor byed pa'i tshig go //🔽rang bzhin gyi khyad par de nyid ston pa ni 'bras bu rnam par shes @39a * //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par bzung ba gtso bor byed pa'i tshig go // rang bzhin gyi khyad par de nyid ston pa ni 'bras bu rnam par shes @39a * //
translated: This is a statement that emphasizes the determination.

original: pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He teaches just that difference in nature in the lines beginning “The effect is consciousness.”

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'di dag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'di dag go //
translated: Therefore, these are natures.

original: rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of permanence.

original: bya ba'i rang bzhin phan tshun spangs pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i rang bzhin phan tshun spangs pa gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the eye, etc., which have the nature of action that is mutually exclusive, are the cause of the effect, consciousness, but not anything else.

original: yang ji ltar na rang gis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par gcig la 'di dag rnam pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas byed pa 'jug par brjod kyi so sor gzhan la mi ltos par mtha' dag bskyed pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rang gis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par gcig la 'di dag rnam pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas byed pa 'jug par brjod kyi so sor gzhan la mi ltos par mtha' dag bskyed pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that these are said to function in terms of a single effect that is generated by itself, in terms of a specific difference, and not in terms of generating each individually, in terms of a separate other?

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni zhes gsungs so//
translated: Because of this, it is said, “since these are . . . .”

original: rnam pa'i tshogs ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rnam pa'i tshogs ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of aspects is the collection of natures.

original: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni mig las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni mig las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: “From the eye . . . ” and so forth.

original: gal te re re las rang bzhin mtha' dag skye par 'gyur na ni de'i mig las kyang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi yid la byed pa 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te re re las rang bzhin mtha' dag skye par 'gyur na ni de'i mig las kyang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi yid la byed pa 'ba' zhig las ni ma yin no //
translated: If each of the faculties were to produce all natures, then the eye would also produce the nature of the understanding, and not just the nature of mental attention.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci ltar rigs par khyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci ltar rigs par khyad par bya'o //
translated: And so on for the others, as is appropriate.

original: yang ji lta bu nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji lta bu nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not be so?

original: re re las de ltar mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: re re las de ltar mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because each is not seen to produce in that way.

original: so sor bdag nyid thams cad skyed par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor bdag nyid thams cad skyed par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each is not seen to produce all of itself.

original: des na rgyu la ni khyad par skyed par byed pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: des na rgyu la ni khyad par skyed par byed pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is the cause that is necessarily the producer of the particular.🔽Since that is not the case, it is established that God is not the cause.

original: de med pa'i phyir dbang phyug ni rgyu ma yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' smras bas bsams par rtogs nas gzhan gyis 'on te mig ces smras so //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dbang phyug ni rgyu ma yin no zhes grub pa'i mtha' smras bas bsams par rtogs nas gzhan gyis 'on te mig ces smras so //
translated: The opponent, having understood the intended meaning of the treatise, says, “Well then, the eye,” and so on.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba dang po ni dpe la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba dang po ni dpe la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first “and so on” refers to the example and so on.

original: 'dis ni yul dang yul can gnyis khyad par med pa'i phyir 'bras bu shes pa byad par med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul dang yul can gnyis khyad par med pa'i phyir 'bras bu shes pa byad par med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the result, consciousness, does not exist, because there is no difference between the two, the object and the subject.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba gnyis pa ni don la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba gnyis pa ni don la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The two “thus” are applied to the meaning.
